key.name: We've got a lot to cover, so let's skip straight to the good part!
I've got a juicy report from the $map:02000043$. If you ask real, real nice, maybe I'll share it with you...
Please! I must know!
Eh, pass.
I love the desperation in your voice. All right, listen up.
I'm listening.
You can't fool me, $MyPCName$. You want a piece of this. And by this, I mean this mission.
I'm listening.
Someone's been getting in the way of the trade caravans through the $map:02000043$.
This guy wanders around aimlessly, bumping into things and knocking carts over. So... what do you think?
Beats me.
Sounds... zombie-ish...
Tsk, tsk. You'll never make a decent spy at this rate.
So what do you think it is?
I think our old friend $npcName:11000492[gender:0]$ has been raised from the dead. We never did find his body, did we? I think he's the spook that's haunting the $map:52000037$.
That sounds plausible.
I've got an agent watching the situation. Head to the $map:02000043$ and see if they have any updates for me.
What's the matter? Can't tear yourself away from my side?
How did it go?
Go on. Give me all the juicy details.
<font color="#909090">(You tell her everything you learned.)</font>
That's a shame. It looks like we still don't have any useful information. Oh well.
So I went all that way for nothing?
Cheer up, $MyPCName$. You get an A for effort!
Let's get to work, sugar.
You haven't been by the $map:02000146$ recently, have you? My agents have picked up a strange energy pattern in the area.
The wavelength, the frequency—everything about it is totally new to us. You up for a one-on-one analsys sesh with me while we figure this out?
I sure am!
Eh... Not really.
That'd be great, right? Anyway, that's not our job. So... too bad!
What do I have to do?
Spoilsport. In that case, I've got another job for you.
What do I have to do?
Meet my agent at the $map:02000146$ and get an update. Then bring it back to me. Simple, no?
All this scientific mumbo-jumbo is beyond me, honestly. Give me a mark to tail and a back to stab any day of the week.
How did it go?
Go on. Give me all the juicy details.
<font color="#909090">(You tell her everything you learned.)</font>
So we still don't know where the signal is coming from, or who's sending it. We'll just have to keep working the problem, I guess.
I wish I knew what all this code meant...
Don't you mind that, $MyPCName$. Here's your reward.
You ready to get to work? Here's the plan.
My agents have been tracking a terrorist organization that calls itself the Resistance. They have this whole anti-magic shtick, and they aren't afraid to bust some heads to make a point.
Those guys are always up to trouble.
Never heard of 'em.

It seems they've come to $map:02000270$ in search of new technology. We thought this'd be a good opportunity to nab their leaders, but it's tough to tell an undercover Resistance agent from your average scientific egg-head.
How can I help?
Oh, you have the most important job of all! Meet my agents in $map:02000270$ and see if they have any messages for me.
My agents are patient, but it's rude to make them wait.
How did it go?
Go on. Give me all the juicy details.
<font color="#909090">(You tell her everything you learned.)</font>
I knew this wouldn't be easy...
Neither of the messages had anything useful?
Nothing I was looking for. But Dark Wind doesn't give up so easily. Sooner or later, we'll get these Resistance goons!
By the way... What was with the robot?
Only the best tech for the best intelligence agency!
Impressive.
Oh, I'm just getting started, $MyPCName$. Anyway, here. You earned this.
Ready for another mission, sunshine?
It's no secret that $npcName:11000251[gender:0]$ is the boss of Blackstar. What most people don't know, however, is that Blackstar has a genius advisor who's secretly behind their success.
Ever since we learned of this advisor's existence, we've chased him tirelessly. If we put him behind bars, it could spell the end for the mob.
Who is this advisor, then?
All we have is a name: $npcName:11003182[gender:0]$. Blackstar is careful not to leak anything about their great tactician.
But you managed to track him down anyway, right?
You know it! That's where things got weird, though. Lean in close, and I'll tell you something that'll blow your mind...
Oh, yes?
Uh... That'll be a no from me.
After reaching $map:02000131$, he just... stopped. I think he realized he was being followed. He just stands around and stares at enemies all day.
Well that's... weird.
You don't want the mission, then? I thought you were a team player!
Fine, fine. I'll do it.
I've got an agent at $map:02000131$. Find her and ask if she has any new intel for me.
Listen, I'd love to blow off work, too, but this is too important. We can spend time together later, okay?
How did it go?
Go on. Give me all the juicy details.
<font color="#909090">(You tell her everything you learned.)</font>
I don't get it...
Which part didn't you get? "Apple" or "snake"?
Ah, I forgot that you don't know our code. According to my agent, he doesn't do anything special but point at the enemies from time to time.
But... but why?
I don't have enough information to even try to guess. We'll just have to keep watching him for now.
Good job, $MyPCName$. Here's your reward.
We've got a lot to cover, so let's skip straight to the good part!
You know that Dark Wind is keeping a close eye on Blackstar, right?
That's news to me.
We've covered this before.
Right, right. Anyway, we may have a breakthrough in our investigation of Blackstar.
And what might that be?
You know that hot-shot alchemist $npcName:11000264[gender:0]$, right?
Of course I do.
...Who?
He's known for being totally obsessed with his work. So... why do you think he's been making so many visits to $map:02010020$ lately?
Is he a fight fan?
Ha! Good one.
I'm serious...
An egghead like $npcName:11000264[gender:0]$ wouldn't be into the MMA scene. Trust me. Anyway, one of my agents is convinced there's something strange going on with him.
I've already got boots on the ground at $map:02010020$. Meet up with my agent and see what you can learn.
What's the matter? Can't tear yourself away from my side?
How did it go?
Go on. Give me all the juicy details.
<font color="#909090">(You tell her everything you learned.)</font>
I see. So, as soon as he gets to $map:02010020$, he goes straight to the $map:52010010$...
So that's what it all meant...
I don't know what to think. Well, we'll just have to keep a closer eye on $map:02010020$.
Good job, $MyPCName$. Here's your reward.
A beautiful day like today ought to be spent enjoying yourself with someone lithe and spirited, hm? Too bad we've got so much work to do...
What do you know about those assassins we fought earlier?
You mean the Rooks?
Yes. Their techniques were advanced, to say the least. And they're clearly very, very well informed.
I did some digging, and I found... absolutely nothing. I've never seen anything like it! The only thing we know for sure about them is that they call themselves the Rooks.
How could they vanish without a trace?
The Rooks...
Beats me. Even my agents would be hard-pressed to pull that off...
Maybe you should let this one go.
Huh? Do you know something about them?
No! Nothing at all!
Relax! No need to be so serious.
Never mind.
They slipped my grasp this time... But I'm the great $npcName:11003535[gender:1]$! I found them before, and I'll do it again.
What are you standing around here for? My agents are already in $map:02000083$, tracking down leads. Head down there and see what they've found out.
While you're wasting time here, our enemies could be making their escape!
How did it go?
Go on. Give me all the juicy details.
<font color="#909090">(You tell her everything you learned.)</font>
Oh, these guys are pros, all right...
So we still don't know anything?
Yeah. This whole "failure" thing is new to me. I don't like it.
Keep at it. I believe in you.
Look at you, trying to cheer me up! Here, cutie. This is for you.
I had a dream about you last night, you know. It felt almost... prophetic.
It's clear to me now. We're destined to be together.
W-we are?
You're cute when you blush, you know that? Anyway, settle down. I've got a mission for you.

BeyondLink has a lab in the Land of Darkness. That's shady enough as it is, but it seems they've been doing experiments on humans, trying to make the perfect soldier. These experiments... Well, they aren't pretty.
That's not good.
Right? Just when you think you've seen the worst of the worst, some crazies in the Land of Darkness have to go and outdo themselves.
Don't worry. I'll put a stop to this.
Hold your horses, hotshot. While I'd love to charge in and stab some backs, we need to find out exactly what we'd be getting into. Intelligence is kind of my thing, after all.
I won't fail you!
You're awfully enthusiastic today, $MyPCName$! I like my $male:men,female:women$ enthusiastic.
I've already got agents at the $map:03000145$. They should have new reports for me by now.
Hey, what happened to all that enthusiasm you had a moment ago?
How did it go?
Go on. Give me all the juicy details.
<font color="#909090">(You tell her everything you learned.)</font>
I see... So that's how it is.
What's how it is?
Nothing concrete. We couldn't find any evidence of their experiments.
You've got to keep pushing.
I agree. We'll unmask these monsters soon enough.
Good job, $MyPCName$. Here's your reward.
I've got a sweet little mission for you.
You ready to work up a sweat?
Uh... no?
But I need you, $MyPCName$. You're the only one I trust to go on this mission to $map:02000001$.
What's that about $map:02000001$?
$map:02000001$? Who said anything about $map:02000001$? You're hearing things, Gramps.
Who're you calling gramps? You kids got no respect for your superiors, you know that? <FONT color='#909090'>(He wanders off and grumbles to himself.)</FONT>
Okay, looks like he's gone. That was a close one.
Why can't you tell $npcName:11003534[gender:0]$ about this mission?
I can't just go around spilling top secrets! If you disagree, I could always... revoke your security clearance...
No need to do that!
I've already got my agent stationed at $map:02000001$. Just make the rendezvous and get the coded message back to me.
These are choice secrets I'm offering you here! Aren't you at least a little curious?
It's not nice to keep a girl waiting, you know.
So? Did you get the message?
"The square looks at the flower twice."
Oh-ho! So $npcName:11000119[gender:0]$ really is hitting it off with $npcName:11000601[gender:1]$...
That's important... why?
Oh, you big, beautiful ignoramus! This intel is as important as it gets.
I don't get it.
You don't need to.
What are you two chatting about? Can I join in?
I don't know, kid. This is top secret business. But maybe you could find a way to... persuade me.
N-n-n-n-never mind!!
You did great, $MyPCName$. Take this as a token of my thanks. And remember—this is our little secret.
I've got work for you, kitten.
I'm getting new reports about a dragon-man on Karkar Island.
A dragon-man...?
Wherever he goes, destruction follows.
It also sounds like he's badly hurt. For him to do so much damage in such a state... We have to be careful with this one.
And anytime anyone tries to get close, he vanishes. He's not taking any chances, either.
It won't be easy to track him down.
It couldn't be him, could it...?
Whatever the case, I've got my agents working on tightening the net.
And you want me to check in with them.
I knew you were a clever one, kitty-cat!
If you say so.
I've already got boots on the ground at the $map:02010029$. Head out that way and see if my agents have learned anything new.
What, is this mission too scary for your delicate kitty-cat sensibilities?
How did it go?
Go on. Give me all the juicy details.
<font color="#909090">(You tell her everything you learned.)</font>
Motives unknown... Well, it's a start.
So the messages were no use?
Don't you worry about that, peach. Even if you weren't helpful, something will turn up sooner or later.
Good job, $MyPCName$. Here's your reward.
You ready to get your hands dirty?
I've got a little problem with some smugglers. Seems they're trying to bring $item:30000986$ into Maple World.
That doesn't sound good.
To the naked eye, $item:30000986$ looks just like $item:20000046$. But take a pinch of it, and hoo boy, you'll get a stomach ache like you won't believe.
I can't let the citizens of the empire get stomach aches, can I?
Absolutely not!
They've stuffed crates all over $map:02000139$ with the stuff. Head over there and bring back all of the $item:30000986$ you can find.
Will do.
Thanks, sweet cheeks.
You don't want the smugglers to get there first, do you?
Show me what you got.
This is it? I thought there'd be more.
I didn't miss a single box. Trust me.
Maybe. I think? Who knows?
That's what I like to hear!
I'm happy to please.
You think? You may have a pretty face, but I will not accept this kind of sloppiness from my operatives!
It's... it's a joke! I am joking!
Good. For a second there, I thought I was gonna have to discipline you.
I got all of the stuff. Don't worry.
We got a lot of their merchandise off the streets, but this isn't over. Scum like this never learns.
Anyway, that's it for now. Here's your reward. Swing by later if you want something more.
You ready to get your hands dirty?
Hey, have you ever had $item:20000015$ before?
I've eaten a gummy or two in my time.
I don't have a taste for that stuff.

In that case, you know how sticky $item:20000015$ can be. Once, one got in my hair, and—that's not important. The important thing is that some very bad men have a very bad plan involving our favorite gummies.
I won't stand for such badness!

Really? They're so good, though! Of course, they're also really sticky. Once, one got in my hair, and—that's not important. The important thing is that some very bad men have a very bad plan involving my favorite gummies.
And you want me to stop them.
I knew I could count on you! I've traced these "$item:30000987$" to $map:02000138$. They're being sold to the general population.
I'll take care of it.
Don't leave any $item:30000987$ behind. And break a kneecap or two while you're at it! These guys deserve nothing less.
What's the matter? Can't tear yourself away from my side?
You got them already?
You're so fast, $MyPCName$. And I mean that in the good way.
...Anyway, here are the $item:30000987$.
Thanks! So... wanna test 'em out?
No. Absolutely not.
Well, I am a little curious...
That's a shame. I guess I'll just test them out on one of my agents.
Poor agent...
All right! Get ready, 'cause I'm gonna throw it!
Wait!!
Chickened out on me, eh? That's okay. I'll just test these $item:30000987$ on one of my agents, instead.
Poor agent...
Keep up the good work!
Look at you, all bright eyed and bushy tailed. Let's get to it, then.

I'm not much of a scientist, but there's a certain beauty to chemistry. Take a healing potion, change one ingredient, and pow—you get an acid that causes unbelievable pain without doing any permanent damage.
Uh... What are you getting at?
It seems someone at $map:02000134$ accidentally spilled some $itemPlural:20000055$ into an experimental potion. It released such a bad smell that everyone in the room was literally paralyzed.
And now the stuff is showing up on the streets. I'm guessing one of the researchers thought he could make a quick buck selling it as a weapon. We can't have that, can we?
No. No, we can't.

We're on the same page. Head to $map:02000134$ and round up all the $itemPlural:30000988$ you can find. And whatever you do, make sure you don't have any $itemPlural:20000055$ on you when you get there!
Clear the streets of $map:02000134$ of all the $itemPlural:30000988$ you can find.
You'd better have something for me.
Hold on. What am I smelling?
It's my new $male:cologne,female:perfume$. Like it?
I might have stepped in some $itemPlural:20000055$...
Is that so? If I didn't know any better, I'd say you were trying to impress me, hot stuff.
Maybe. Maybe not.
G-get out of here! I am not getting knocked out by stink gas!
I didn't really step in any! I think!
Well, maybe I like it. Keep it up and I'll have to take you in for one of my special interrogations.
I'll keep that in mind...
If you say so. Maybe you should wash up before you go anyway. You smell like chemical warfare.
Hmph.
Anyway, here's your reward.
I hope you're ready to work.
These are crazy times, and all the little people are getting scared. Scared enough to go out and buy the first sword they can find, even if they don't know how to use it.
Self-defense is important.
Sure, but what good is self-defense if your weapon is made with the shoddiest second-hand material in all the land?
Their weapons can't be that bad, can they?
I'm just saying that these swords are more likely to shatter than they are to parry an attack. Innocent people could get hurt!
My agents tell me that the lizardfolk of $map:02000011$ have been selling $item:30000989$ to just such innocent people. So, what should we do about it?
Get those $itemPlural:30000989$ off the streets!
Take a nap?
Correct!
Leave it to me.
Hey, now. This isn't the $MyPCName$ that I've come to know and adore. Now, what are you going to do?
Get those $itemPlural:30000989$ off the streets!
Go to $map:02000011$, defeat the $npcNamePlural:21090172$, $npcNamePlural:21090173$, and $npcNamePlural:21090174$, and get those $itemPlural:30000989$!
Go to $map:02000011$, defeat the $npcNamePlural:21090172$, $npcNamePlural:21090173$, and $npcNamePlural:21090174$, and get those $itemPlural:30000989$!
I've been waiting.
Did you get the $itemPlural:30000989$?
Here they are.
Great. Now I just need to figure out what to do with all these blades...
$npcName:11003535[gender:1]$, why don't you donate those swords to the Royal Guard?
On the one hand, it would be hilarious to see your men fumble around with these crummy blades. On the other, are you sure you want to do that to them?

Our resources are strapped thin as it is, and beggars can't be choosers, as they say. Besides, back in my day, you were lucky to have more than one sword to every two men, and at least half of our blades were made of tin foil!
Nothing about that sounds accurate.
Well... At least the Royal Guard has proper military training. I guess we'll just have to see what happens.
Anyway, good work out there. A girl could get used to working so closely with you, if you know what I mean.
Are you ready to get to work?
I assume you're up to date on the $item:20000046$ smuggling situation.
Oh, yeah. I know all about that.
Um... Am I supposed to know about that?
Let me bring you up to speed. There are some bad dudes trying to smuggle $item:20000046$ into the empire from the Land of Darkness. And now you're up to speed.
Interesting, interesting. Do go on.
My agents have been giving the smugglers a hard time, so they've decided to try making their own $item:20000046$ over here on our side of the Shadow Gate.
Apparently, the whole mess involves growing their own $itemPlural:20000102$ and fermenting the stuff in crates.
I want to get the $item:30000990$ before they do.
Head to $map:02000129$ and search the crates there for $item:30000990$. I'm counting on you.
Head to $map:02000129$ and search the crates there for $item:30000990$. I'm counting on you.
You've got the afterglow of a job well done.
Let's see that $item:30000990$.
Here you go.
Oh, I wish I could see the look on the smugglers' faces when they find their crates smashed and their product gone!
Nothing beats seeing bad guys lose and good guys win. You know what I'm saying?
I sure do.
Hm. If I give this $item:30000990$ to $npcName:11003536[gender:0]$ for analysis, maybe I can convince her to thank me... personally. This really is my day.
Thanks, $MyPCName$. I owe you one.
Ready for a mission?
I'm sure you've heard the rumors about Blackstar's ties to the criminal underbelly of the Land of Darkness.
It's not exactly a well-kept secret.
I haven't heard them, actually.
No, it isn't. Anyway, my people have been keeping a close eye on them.
Are the rumors true?
Well, now you have. Anyway, my people have been keeping a close eye on them.
Are the rumors true?
Let's just say I've been following the money, and the money's all being funneled through Blackstar. They're stashing their cash away until they can launder it all.
Where can they hide all that money?
They've stuffed the cash into $npcNamePlural:21000714$, $npcNamePlural:21000720$, and $npcNamePlural:21000726$. Someone in their cartel must be a gamer.
Since they packaged up all that money so prettily for us, I say we should put it to good use. Mind heading to $map:02010010$ and confiscating their $itemPlural:30000991$?
Go to $map:02010010$ and confiscate those $itemPlural:30000991$.
I hope you had a nice visit to the mall.
Wow. Now this is a tidy sum of cash!
How do you plan to use all this?
Weapons and gear for field agents, to start with. With all the leftovers, maybe a little extra something for a few special someones...
I never took you for a dirty cop.
I mean, this'll go straight to the $map:02000001$ Veterans' Fund!
That's what I thought.
Good job, $MyPCName$. Here's your reward.
You ready to get your hands dirty?
My agents are everywhere. Well, almost everywhere. I hate to admit this, but we're a little shorthanded ever since the battle of $map:02000001$.
That's why I've turned to technology. Security cameras, to be specific. It's not as good as having my people lurking in every shadow, but it's better than nothing.
Of course, it's not a perfect system. We need someone to download their data from time to time. By someone, I mean you.
What do you need me to do?
Go to the $map:02000277$ and hack into their security system to get the $itemPlural:30000992$ there.
Sure, I—wait, "hack"?
You didn't think they were our cameras, did you? Do you have any idea how those things are to set up? Anyway, try not to get caught!
This feels wrong.
I believe in you!
Go to the $map:02000277$ and hack into their security system to get the $itemPlural:30000992$ there.
Let's see what you got for me.
Looks like you got all of the footage. Good job!
Just set up your own cameras next time...
And miss out on sending you on these fun missions? Nah.
Really, it's okay. Give me boring missions.
You'll miss the fun missions when they're gone, you know.
Anyway, thanks for the footage. Let's do this again real soon.
Let's get to work!
Blackstar. Those guys, right? The whole lot of 'em should be behind bars!
Why aren't they?

Everyone knows they're up to no good, but they're careful to never leave even a shred of physical evidence. The empire has a little thing called "due process" that stops us from just tossing them in Alikar and throwing away the key.
If only we could link them to their criminal accounts...
I'll find those accounts!
You sure about that, $MyPCName$? This kind of job requires subtlety...
Well, what have I got to lose? Surely one of the $npcNamePlural:11000505[gender:0]$ at $map:02010016$ knows something. Good luck!
You aren't coming back empty-handed already, are you?
Finally, we get to have a nice, intimate chat.
So, how'd it go? Uncover any juicy secrets?
<font color="#909090">(You give her the $itemPlural:30000993$.)</font>
No way... Could this be...?
Did I do it?!
No! These ledgers tell me nothing. But thanks for trying.
Dang. I thought I had them dead to rights.
We'll get 'em next time. Anyway, I'm touched that I didn't even have to ask you to do the mission this time. You must really like me!
Maybe next time, I'll go with you. Show you the real fun of field work.
Hey there, sweet stuff. I've got work for you.
You remember $npcName:11000044[gender:0]$, don't you? You know, the traitor to Dark Wind that you and $npcName:11000064[gender:0]$ kicked to the curb.
Yep.
Well, we aren't done with him yet. That rat still has agents in the empire.
But I already took out $npcName:11000044[gender:0]$'s lackeys!
A few slipped our grasp. Ex-Dark Wind operatives. They know all our tricks and secrets, so tracking them down has been... frustrating.
My people spotted some of them on $map:02000147$. It's no secret that $npcName:11000044[gender:0]$ had a thing for $npcName:11000069[gender:1]$—I bet he's got his men keeping tabs on her.
There's a chance $npcName:11000044[gender:0]$ is with them. We can't let him escape again!
So, what's the plan? Sending a team of your best agents?
These guys know how we work. They'd see a team coming a mile away. No, we need someone they won't expect—someone who's gone toe-to-toe with $npcName:11000044[gender:0]$ and lived.
Gotcha. I'll see to this personally.
I don't like where you're going with this...
I'm counting on you. Head to $map:02000147$ and take care of those snakes.
Head to $map:02000147$ and take care of those snakes.
I hope you're here to tell me something good.
So? Was $npcName:11000044[gender:0]$ at $map:02000147$?
No, it was just his lackeys.
So, it was just another $map:52010041$. That's a shame... Still, I'm glad you were able to give them some trouble.
Thanks for the hand. I'll be calling for you again real soon.
Look at you, all bright eyed and bushy tailed. Let's get to it, then.
You remember $npcName:11000044[gender:0]$, don't you? You know, the traitor to Dark Wind that you and $npcName:11000064[gender:0]$ kicked to the curb.
Yep.
Well, we aren't done with him yet. That rat still has agents in the empire.
But I already took out $npcName:11000044[gender:0]$'s lackeys!
A few slipped our grasp. Ex-Dark Wind operatives. They know all our tricks and secrets, so tracking them down has been... frustrating.
My people spotted some of them on the $map:02010039$. They slipped away before we could collar any of them, though.
There's a chance $npcName:11000044[gender:0]$ is with them. We can't let him escape again!
So, what's the plan? Sending a team of your best agents?
These guys know how we work. They'd see a team coming a mile away. No, we need someone they won't expect—someone who's gone toe-to-toe with $npcName:11000044[gender:0]$ and lived.
Gotcha. I'll see to this personally.
I don't like where you're going with this...
I'm counting on you. Head to the $map:02010039$ and take care of those snakes.
Head to $map:02010039$ and take care of those snakes.
I've been waiting with baited breath.
Was $npcName:11000044[gender:0]$ at the $map:02010039$?
No, it was just his lackeys.
So, it was just another $map:52010041$. That's a shame... Still, I'm glad you were able to give them some trouble.
Thanks for the hand. I'll be calling for you again real soon.
I've got a new mission for you, hottie.
You remember $npcName:11000044[gender:0]$, don't you? You know, the traitor to Dark Wind that you and $npcName:11000064[gender:0]$ kicked to the curb.
Yep.
Well, we aren't done with him yet. That rat still has agents in the empire.
But I already took out $npcName:11000044[gender:0]$'s lackeys!
A few slipped our grasp. Ex-Dark Wind operatives. They know all our tricks and secrets, so tracking them down has been... frustrating.
I got reports of a group of them at the $map:03000103$. I'm not sure why they'd be there, though...

The Lumiknights are spearheading a full investigation of the Land of Darkness. I've recently taken an interest in the $npcNamePlural:40000136$ that wander the $map:03000130$.
I didn't know you like to play with dolls.
My interest or disinterest in dolls is none of your business. Please keep such foolish jokes to yourself.
Ah... Sorry.

How can I explain this so that you would understand? I believe that the $npcNamePlural:40000136$ are filled with rage because they are made from $itemPlural:30000995$, which are infused with shadow magic.
But how did they get filled with darkness in the first place?

That is a surprisingly adept query. I wish you to go to the $map:03000130$, vanquish the $npcNamePlural:40000136$, and return with their $itemPlural:30000995$. Then we will see about answering this question of yours.
I wish you to go to the $map:03000130$, vanquish the $npcNamePlural:40000136$, and return with their $itemPlural:30000995$.
The shadows cling to you...
No, they cling to the $itemPlural:30000995$ in your pack. I was very close to exorcising you with my blade...
Anyway, I did what you asked.
Yes. Most fascinating. To think that simple botanical matter could prove so efficacious at channeling dark magic...
You may leave the analysis to the Lumiknights. Anyway, here is your payment, as is custom.
Prepare yourself...
I'm transmitting images directly into your mind!
I don't see anything...
Nothing? Let's try this again. Open your minds eye... Can you see my message?
You're weirding me out.
Fine, I'll resort to inefficient verbal communication. My organization is presently researching the $npcNamePlural:40000055$ who reside within the Land of Darkness.
These dull creatures spend their days listlessly wandering about with a vacant expression upon their faces. Much like the one upon your face now, in fact.
You need new glasses.
I suspect the source of their witlessness to be the dark staves they carry. They've no choice in the matter, of course—once possessed, these staves are cursed to fuse to the poor creatures' hands.
You're just gonna ignore me, huh?
Go to $map:03000003$, defeat the cursed $npcNamePlural:40000055$, and retrieve the crystal balls from their staves.
Go to $map:03000003$, defeat the cursed $npcNamePlural:40000055$, and retrieve the crystal balls from their staves.
The wind foretold of your success.
And yet... these are not the crystals I requested.
I tried to get them to you in one piece, but I could only get these $itemPlural:30000996$.
What am I supposed to do with these? Was I not explicitly clear that I needed the intact crystal balls?
You could try gluing them back together.
These are no mere trinkets that you can simply "glue" together!
So what, you're giving up without even trying? Hmph! Back in my day, we weren't afraid of a little glue!
I believe that is my cue to wrap this up. Thank you for your... efforts, $MyPCName$.
You are compelled to aid me. Do not deny it.
The Lumiknights are continuing their research into the Land of Darkness. I need you to venture into that den of seething evil and retrieve $itemPlural:30000997$.
And why am I doing this?
Allow me to explain in terms simple enough for you to understand.
Actually, never mind! I'll just—
The $npcNamePlural:40000071$ have always been savage. However, since arriving at $map:03000143$, their savagery has grown a thousandfold.
I believe it is something in the water.
Go to $map:03000143$, defeat the $npcNamePlural:40000071$, and return with the $itemPlural:30000997$.
Go to $map:03000143$, defeat the $npcNamePlural:40000071$, and return with the $itemPlural:30000997$.
I have dreamed of this moment.
I trust you were successful?
Here is the $item:30000997$.
I sense no darkness within this water. I shall have to investigate further...
Maybe it wasn't the water that turned them savage. Maybe it was seeing your face.
Once again, your humor is lacking. Nonetheless, I appreciate your feeble attempt at nurturing camaraderie between us.
Right back at ya, buddy.
You may leave the analysis to the Lumiknights. Anyway, here is your payment, as is custom.
You, uh, want something from me?
You have your mission. Get to work.
But you haven't actually said anything...
I suppose it was too much to hope that my telepathic briefing would get through your thick skull. In short, I require $item:30000998$ samples.
The $npcNamePlural:40000134$ receive a constant IV drip of potent medicine, and yet they're constantly ill.
I suspect that this is due to the $itemPlural:30000998$. I believe that, once ingested, one can never recover from its poison.
I don't think I need telepathy for you to understand what I'm going to say next.
Yeah, yeah, I get it...
Go to $map:03000057$, defeat the $npcNamePlural:40000134$, and return with the $itemPlural:30000998$.
Go to $map:03000057$, defeat the $npcNamePlural:40000134$, and return with the $itemPlural:30000998$.
The shadows cling to you...
No, they cling to the $itemPlural:30000998$ in your pack. I was very close to exorcising you with my blade...
Anyway, I did what you asked.
Now, let us begin our experiment. Would you like to take the first bite of $item:30000998$, or shall I?
I-I just remembered, I have to be... not here.
More $itemPlural:30000998$ for me, I suppose. Before you go, here is your reward.
I've a new task for you, if you would heed the call.
The Lumiknights are spearheading a full investigation of the Land of Darkness. I've recently taken an interest in the $npcNamePlural:40000080$ that wander $map:03000165$.
So you like a big, strong woman who knows how to keeps things clean, do you?
What a small, dim perspective you must have, $MyPCName$. My interest in $npcNamePlural:40000080$ is purely intellectual. As a species, they've undergone a sudden transformation.
What kind of transformation?
As you might have guessed from the name, the $npcName:40000080$ is a tidy creature by nature. But, quite suddenly, they've become obsessed with rolling in the dirt.
We suspect that the source of this change lies in the $item:30000999$ that fills their environment.
Go to $map:03000165$, defeat the cursed $npcNamePlural:40000080$, and return with the $item:30000999$.
Go to $map:03000165$, defeat the cursed $npcNamePlural:40000080$, and return with the $item:30000999$.
You don't need to say anything.
I've already read your mind.
And indeed, I sense dark magic within this $item:30000999$.
For such a transformation to be triggered by mere contact, without ingestion... Very interesting.
The Lumiknights will investigate this matter closely. Thank you.
You are compelled to aid me. Do not deny it.
The Lumiknights are continuing their research into the Land of Darkness. I need you to venture into that den of seething evil and retrieve $itemPlural:30001000$.
And where can I get $itemPlural:30001000$?
So impatient! If you'd wait but a minute, I could explain everything in minute detail.
No need for details. Just tell me where to find them.

As I'm sure you're aware, $npcNamePlural:40000122$ are consummate... well, thieves. Even so, historically they've been mostly harmless. It wasn't until they stole a collection of $itemPlural:30001000$ from an abandoned lab that they became violent.
I really don't need the whole history lesson...
These $itemPlural:30001000$ are focal points for dark magic. I'd like to examine their properties personally.
Go to the $map:03000089$, defeat the $npcNamePlural:40000122$, and bring the $itemPlural:30001000$ to me for analysis.
Go to the $map:03000089$, defeat the $npcNamePlural:40000122$, and bring the $itemPlural:30001000$ to me for analysis.
The wind foretold of your success.
These must be the $itemPlural:30001000$ that I requested.
Yep.
Such potent darkness... I look forward to discovering how these were made.
Thank you, $MyPCName$.
Cease whatever it was you were doing. You're helping me now.
I need you to venture into that den of seething evil and retrieve $itemPlural:30001001$. In the name of research, of course.
I never agreed to this...
$npcNamePlural:40000109$ create a juice from $itemPlural:30001001$, into which they dip their apples. I've long suspected that this fungus is infused with dark magic...
Collect $itemPlural:30001001$ from $npcNamePlural:40000109$ so I can verify this hypothesis for myself.
And what will your Lumiknights be up to while I'm running errands for you?
Oh, $MyPCName$. Surely you realize that you lack the security clearance for such information.
Now hurry along to $map:03000118$, defeat $npcNamePlural:40000109$, and return with their $itemPlural:30001001$.
Go to $map:03000118$, defeat $npcNamePlural:40000109$, and return with their $itemPlural:30001001$.
You don't need to say anything.
I've already read your mind.
Did somebody order some $itemPlural:30001001$?
The Land of Darkness truly is a frightful place. For something so benign as a $item:30001001$ to become so dangerous...
The Lumiknights will investigate this matter closely. Thank you.
Her remains must be out there... somewhere...
$MyPCName$, tell me. What do you know of the goddess of darkness?
Not a whole lot.
In another age, the goddess of darkness sought to destroy Maple World. She was defeated by the goddess of light, and her remains were scattered across the world.
The Lumiknights believe that her remains fuel the shadow magic that fills the Land of Darkness.
Wherever any piece of this goddess is buried, the land becomes corrupted. Evil.
The $map:03000089$ is a hot spot for dark magic, even within the Land of Darkness. This is a good opportunity to test my theory! Go to the $map:03000089$ and look for anything out of the ordinary.
Go to the $map:03000089$ and look for anything out of the ordinary.
I have watched your progress through the eyes of the moon.
Have you found the remains of the goddess of darkness?
I haven't. Sorry.
That's a pity. But I won't give up.
On behalf of the Lumiknights, you have my thanks.
Her remains must be out there... somewhere...

Among the Lumiknights' many responsibilities, safeguarding the World Stones is one of our most important.
These stones repulse dark magic, helping to keep the Land of Darkness at bay.
That's pretty handy.
Recently, however, the darkness has grown too intense. One of our World Stones has fractured.
I've got a bad feeling about this...
Even though you're not a Lumiknight, I'd like your assistance in this matter.
I knew it.
Go to the $map:02000146$ and repair the World Stone.
Go to the $map:02000146$ and repair the World Stone.
I can sense that the darkness has lessened.
You've repaired the World Stone, then.
Admit it. You're impressed.
I wouldn't go that far.
All the same, you've shown that you have potential. Thank you.
