I am well aware of the results of your mission. Our connection allows me to see that much, and more. My only regret was that I could not be there at your side, exchanging blows with our common enemy.
The light burns a little brighter this day, thanks to you.
I knew you were on your way here, $MyPCName$.
The invisible thread of destiny binds us together.
...Was there something you needed?
Ah, but you already know, don't you? Allow me to elaborate. ... ... ...
Okay, you're gonna have to give me at least some of that out loud.
As you wish. My telepathic voice does tend to overwhelm. The Cerberus $npcName:23000047$ has been tainted by darkness.
The balance of light and dark is already in disarray. We cannot stand idly by while it falls further into chaos.
My superiors do not wish the knights to step in, which leaves you as my only recourse.
Sure, I'll take care of it.
Just as I foresaw. Very good, $MyPCName$. Fulfill your destiny.
The end of the world draws ever closer...!
Oh, right. You gave me a mission...
Report back when you're done.
You did well, $MyPCName$.
You have drawn the attention of forces far beyond our control...
That sounds... ominous.
You have nothing to fear. Walk in the light and you shall be judged fairly.
What're you just standing around for, $MyPCName$? If you've got this much free time, help me out!
You're just... so marvelously good-looking today. I couldn't help but stare in awe.
Darn straight I'm good-looking today. I'm good looking every day, cadet!
But we have bigger fish to fry, like your mission. We have our eye on $npcName:23000035$ lately.
While we're busy trying to rebuild Maple World, $npcName:23000035$ are off attacking humans and spewing poison everywhere. It's really starting to get in the way.
Which is why I volunteered to have a youngster like you go take care of them.
Yay. Hooray. Woohoo. Can't wait.
Enough sass. Get going!
Hey! What're you still doing here? Didn't I volunteer you for a mission?
Well, look at that. You did it. Not bad, cadet.
I'm gonna sleep well tonight, thanks to you! You know how the saying goes: one reliable cadet is worth a hundred loyal offspring! BAHAHAHAHA!
Cadet, about time you got here. Can't you see there's something on my mind?
Yeah, you look awful. Really awful. Oh no! Are you dying?
Your concern touches my heart, cadet. I know how much I mean to you. But if I'm dying, it's only from stress.
Thoughts of that blasted $npcName:23000099$ consume my mind, interrupting my sleep. As you can see, it's taken a toll on my complexion.
See, if it were a reasonable hunk of rock, it'd stay in the ruins and leave me in peace. But does it? No. The $npcName:23000099$ has to rampage around and smash things.
The worst part is, it also takes over the fortresses of Perion, completely obliterating the good name of the Royal Guard!
This cannot be allowed to stand!
Don't worry, Sir. I'll handle it.
Good! Go Strike Team Condor!
Anything for your beauty sleep, Sir!
<font color="#909090">(The world is a scary place...)</font>
Why are you still here, cadet? Did you have snails for breakfast? Why so slow? Get this done!
You're finally back! How'd things go?
It went great! You can rest in peace now, Sir, so to speak.
BAHAHAHAHA! I know how to pick 'em, don't I? You and I make a great team, cadet.
There you are, $MyPCName$. I've been waiting for you.
The crew of Sky Fortress looks up to you. I've been keeping an eye on you as well.
Which I why I want to further test your abilities on a critical mission I've set aside just for you.
Yay! You believe in me!
Let's not get carried away. For all I know, this could end up being a huge mistake.
Nah, I've got this. Promise.
Only time will tell.
In any case, I'll be briefing you on this mission myself, as our tactical officer is otherwise occupied. You've heard of $npcName:23000026[gender:1]$, I assume?
Of the three Baphomets, $npcName:23000026[gender:1]$ has always been the most spiteful. She's the cause of the freezing gusts constantly pestering us from $map:02000260$.
It's time something was done. You, $MyPCName$, are the one assigned to do it.
If you have any concerns that this task will be too difficult for you, share them now.
I told you, Captain. I've got this.
Very well. I leave it to you.
You haven't departed? I take that to mean you're making preparations for the critical mission ahead.
Based on your prior records, I hope I can trust you to perform adequately?
<font color="#909090">(Yeesh, the Captain sure can be passive aggressive at times.)</font>
Yup, I was just heading out!
Excellent. I'll be keeping an eye on your progress.
You've completed your mission admirably. Well done.
I don't believe we'll be hearing from the Baphomets again any time soon, thanks to you.
Go ahead and take a break before your next mission. It won't be long, so make the most of it.
Hm...
Is everything okay?
As "okay" as can be expected, yes. But...
Since assuming command of Sky Fortress, I haven't had a chance to put my combat skills to practical use.
Prior to being stationed here, I was most proficient with a sword. The only person in the entire Tria Navy who could match my skills was my fath—was Admiral Martini.
But even the sharpest blade dulls with neglect. If the admiral saw me now... I shudder to think what measures he would take.
I will not stand for it!
This is really getting to you, isn't it?
I'd be happy to spar with you, if you think it'll help.
Really?
Thank you. This means more to me than you could know.
It's not something I can ask of my crew. None would dare risk hurting their commanding officer. But for you to simply volunteer... Again, thank you.
Shall we get right to it?
$npcName:11003536$, reduce our speed and set a stable course. $MyPCName$ and I are going to take in some fresh air on the top deck.
Oooh! Captain! You finally found a sparring partner! Congratulations!!
Lower your voice.
My lips are sealed! Not another word out of me! $MyPCName$, this will be really good training for you, too!
Meet me on the top deck when you're ready. <font color="#909090">(You can challenge Captain Veliche via the Fortress Rumbles on the Challenge Map.)</font>
Meet me on the top deck when you're ready. <font color="#909090">(You can challenge Captain Veliche via the Fortress Rumbles on the Challenge Map.)</font>
I haven't had such an exciting match for years!
I thought the admiral was the only one who could stand against my blades, but I was wrong.
$MyPCName$, would you be willing to spar with me again, from time to time?
Oh man...
I'm kind of jealous...
I would be honored, Captain.
Thank you, $MyPCName$. You have my gratitude.
Are you prepared for another sparring session with me?
Let's see how much you've improved since our last match.
Meet me on the top deck when you're ready. (If you accept this mission, you cannot begin any other weekly [Special] Fortress Rumble missions until the weekly reset.)
Meet me on the top deck when you're ready. (If you accept this mission, you cannot begin any other weekly [Special] Fortress Rumble missions until the weekly reset.)
An excellent match. You've improved.
The more you better yourself, the better the Alliance becomes. I look forward to our next match.
You're pretty busy these days! Not too busy for your old sweetheart $npcName:11003584$, I hope...
Is Condor hogging you for himself? Or is Nainai keeping you occupied picking weird litter off the street? I swear, if they're trying to keep you from me...
No need to take it out on them! Honestly, at least their missions are straightforward.
Aw, you think my missions are tough? That's 'cause you can't just muscle your way through them like a dumb guard.
I had no idea you were so insecure, $MyPCName$. You should've mentioned it sooner.
I know exactly what to do. I think it's time I told you about...
...my secret Shadow Walker training technique.
This isn't going to involve torture, is it?
You'll find out soon enough!
Is it too late to back out?
Much, much too late, kitten.
Don't worry. I lived through this training, and so will you. And really, the concept is simple.
The technique is called... "Kill or be killed."
I'm leaving now.
Oh, no you aren't. Not unless you want me to slip worms into your ears while you sleep. Trust me, this is the only way to squeeze every last drop of potential out of you.

C'mon, let's start the training. Only one of us will leave this alive, so I guess this is goodbye, too. <font color="#909090">(You can challenge Schatten via the Fortress Rumbles on the Challenge Map.)</font>

C'mon, let's start the training. Only one of us will leave this alive, so I guess this is goodbye, too. <font color="#909090">(You can challenge Schatten via the Fortress Rumbles on the Challenge Map.)</font>
Ha! You should've seen your face! You didn't really think I was gonna kill you, right? Silly kitten.
I realized something while we sparred... Perhaps this particular bit of Shadow Walker training is, well, flawed.
What's the point of getting stronger if you've got the blood of someone you care about on your hands?
If it weren't for that training, I might've even been able to tell that scrawny instructor how I felt...
Whoa, I sense a tragic backstory!
Never mind that. $MyPCName$, do you really want to get stronger? In that case, I'll train you myself!
Perhaps training you will give me the courage to face my mentor again someday...
Just let me know whenever you want a rematch!
You. Me. A cage in a secret underground bunker. What do you say?
I can't wait to give you some of my... undivided attention. (If you accept this mission, you cannot begin any other weekly [Special] Fortress Rumble missions until the weekly reset.)
I can't wait to give you some of my... undivided attention. (If you accept this mission, you cannot begin any other weekly [Special] Fortress Rumble missions until the weekly reset.)
Not bad, hot stuff. I can tell you're improving.
But don't expect me to make things so easy for you next time.
$MyPCName$, do you have a moment? There's a place I'd like to show you.
Where?
In accordance with the order's Code of the Seventh Apocrypha, it is my duty to subject you to the holy rite of trial by ordeal.
In English, please.
To put it simply, to determine whether you are the one the oracle spoke of, you must come with me. This could determine your entire destiny.
You have tremendous potential. I've seen it myself while observing you in action. Perhaps you really could be the hero chosen to protect the world.
But anyone can have potential. I need to be sure.
Which is why I decided to put you to the test.
The procedure is quite simple.
To determine whether you are the one the oracle foretold, you must fight in a battle... against me.
Can't you just, like, touch my forehead and sense my destiny? Or maybe read some tea leaves? Anything?
A prophecy is a dangerous thing. It defies rhyme or reason. If you can't defeat me, then this fate was not meant for you.
This is your chance to prove yourself worthy of guarding and protecting the world. Will you come and hear the voice of the oracle with me?
...Fine.
Very good. Kindly keep in mind that I will not hold back. It is my duty to fight you with all my strength.
I'll see you shortly. <font color="#909090">(You can challenge Mason via the Fortress Rumbles on the Challenge Map.)</font>
I'll see you shortly. <font color="#909090">(You can challenge Mason via the Fortress Rumbles on the Challenge Map.)</font>
Unfortunately, the prophecy did not physically manifest before us. The oracle remained silent. How disappointing.
And yet... I cannot deny the power and potential that I felt within you as we fought.
Perhaps... Perhaps that is more important than some ancient promise full of indecipherable riddles.
If so, then... Hmmm... Yes, I've decided.
$MyPCName$, we will spar from time to time. Perhaps, if we give the oracle more opportunities to speak, we will learn your true destiny.
If you remain diligent and hard-working, who knows what your future may bring.
I understand.
Very good, $MyPCName$. I will be here whenever you're ready.
I... I almost can't believe I'm risking so much on something that is yet unproven...
This could get me removed from the Lumiknights. Yet, if it's for the greater good, perhaps that is my destiny.
I hear a whispering in my soul. It can only mean one thing...
Today is the day the oracle will speak. (If you accept this mission, you cannot begin any other weekly [Special] Fortress Rumble missions until the weekly reset.)
Today is the day the oracle will speak. (If you accept this mission, you cannot begin any other weekly [Special] Fortress Rumble missions until the weekly reset.)
The oracle remains silent.
So be it.
We will try again in our next battle.
You grow stronger nonetheless, $MyPCName$.
I have not given up hope...
...that you may be the one to punish the gods!
$MyPCName$! It's finally done!
My Combat Simulator is ready!
Yay?
Geez, Nainai. Is that the best you can do? "Combat Simulator"? How unoriginal.
Why don't you name it something like...
"Nainai's Spine-Tingling, Full-Body Combat Experience"!
Schatten! Be serious! How on earth did you come up with a name like that?
I don't know. I found a bunch of weird comic books in the tactical office quarters...
Those aren't mine!! And why are you snooping around in my room?!
I'm Schatten, baby. I am everywhere and nowhere...
Give me a break! You're always doing things to make me lose focus.
Just ignore her, $MyPCName$. She's just making all that stuff about the comic books up!
You know that, right?!
Ahem! Anyway, where was I? Oh yes, my Combat Simulator is in its final stages of testing.
It creates a virtual space that's every bit as detailed as real life! The combat AI is so sophisticated, not a single tester has been able to beat the simulation.
There's just one problem. I fed it every engagement manual we have on file, but I don't know how it will do against someone with a more... unorthodox style.
So I was thinking... Would you be willing to try out my simulator, $MyPCName$? I think the AI would be able to learn a lot from you.
I'd love to.
Thank you! I'll get the simulator running right away! <font color="#909090">(You can test out the Combat Simulator via the Fortress Rumbles on the Challenge Map.)</font>
Thank you! I'll get the simulator running right away! <font color="#909090">(You can test out the Combat Simulator via the Fortress Rumbles on the Challenge Map.)</font>
I don't understand! Where are all these anomalies coming from?! The simulator was perfect just a moment ago!
It was a tough fight, I'll tell you that.
Sure, that's great, but how am I supposed to interpret this data? It doesn't match any model I've ever seen!
And according to these reports, you weren't even scratching your combat potential. How can this be...?
$MyPCName$! You did this, so you have to fix it! I need your help if I'm ever going to get the simulator working properly!
You'll test it again later, won't you? I'll make sure it gives you an even bigger challenge next time!
My upgrades are ready! This round of testing won't be like last time!
Shall we jump right in? (If you accept this mission, you cannot begin any other weekly [Special] Fortress Rumble missions until the weekly reset.)
Shall we jump right in? (If you accept this mission, you cannot begin any other weekly [Special] Fortress Rumble missions until the weekly reset.)
...All this data... So many anomalies... Thousands of errors...
Why is it giving me different results each time?!
You must be improving as well, $MyPCName$... I think my simulator is picking up on it...
I need more data! I'm going to work on a patch. Help me test it out later!
How's it feel to work for me, cadet? Puts a bit of swagger into your step, doesn't it?
Absolutely, sir. Swagger positively oozes from my pores by now.
Stick with me, cadet, and you'll rocket to the top in no time.
Of course, you better be willing to put in the work.
Let me bring you in on a Royal Guard tradition. My captain offered it to me, and I'm offering it to you: a friendly spar. Just you and me, what do you say?
Forget that I tower over you in hierarchy for a moment, and just show me what you've got!
Gee, sir, wow! I'd be honored! I accept!
Wipe that grin off your face, cadet. When I fight, I fight for keeps.
Well, what're you waiting for? Let's get this match started! <font color="#909090">(You can spar with Condor via the Fortress Rumbles on the Challenge Map.)</font>
Well, what're you waiting for? Let's get this match started! <font color="#909090">(You can spar with Condor via the Fortress Rumbles on the Challenge Map.)</font>
You call that a fight? All I gotta say is...
Not too shabby, cadet!
You don't pull your punches just 'cause you're fighting your captain. I like that!
Fight me again sometime. With the right training, you'll go far.
Who knows? Maybe I'll pummel some of my greatness into you! BAHAHAHA!
Back for more, huh?
Good! Let's get ready to rumble! (If you accept this mission, you cannot begin any other weekly [Special] Fortress Rumble missions until the weekly reset.)
Good! Let's get ready to rumble! (If you accept this mission, you cannot begin any other weekly [Special] Fortress Rumble missions until the weekly reset.)
Get a load of you! You're improving, day by day!
Finally, a worthy opponent!
What a workout! Why don't we sweat it out at the sauna? Just don't mention it to the captain!
You can visit the sauna all you wish... when you aren't on duty.
You know I'd never slack off at work, Captain! I was joking!
Hahaha, sure you were!
You're just in time for a new mission, $MyPCName$.
We've received a sudden request for aid from $map:02000255$.
What's the matter?
Their report states that robots have swarmed the area, preventing residents from passing through.
Robots?
We're not exactly sure where they came from, but sheesh, how long do we have to keep cleaning up other people's messes?
They keep pestering us because they know the captain won't turn them down, but they oughtta treat us with a little more respect!
I recognize that the situation is less than ideal, $npcName:11003536[gender:0]$. Still, it's our duty to respond to support requests.
There's no one else for these people to turn to. We have to lend aid if we expect the situation in $map:02000255$ to stabilize.
We may be the Shield of the Sky, but we cannot turn our backs on any who face turmoil.
You're right, Captain, of course. We'll provide all the support we can.
That's the spirit!
Very good. Now, $MyPCName$, head to $map:02000255$ and eliminate the robots who have taken control of the area.
I gave you your orders. Is there some kind of problem?
Nah, no problem. Just returned for some supplies.
Good. I'm trusting you to handle the mission after you've restocked your supplies.
You're back. Have you completed your mission?
Let me put it this way... $MyPCName$: 1, robots: 0.
Hey now, $male:handsome,female:gorgeous$, it's not over yet. We've received reports of additional enemy activity in the area.
$npcName:11003535[gender:1]$'s right. Scan results confirm that there's an increase of monsters in that area once again.
I'll bet a thousand mesos that someone's herding the robots around. You know, there's something really suspicious about that alchemist from Taliskar...
For now, let's just focus on what needs to get done.
And what exactly is that?
Reconnaissance, naturally. $npcName:11003535[gender:1]$, you're up. Grab your supplies and get ready to head out.
Considering who may be involved, we'll want to handle this as covertly as possible. Think you can sniff your way to the bottom of this without being discovered?
Sniffing bottoms is my specialty, Captain. I've got this.
$MyPCName$, you've done well. It's only a matter a time before the folks below ask for more support, but we'll deal with that when it happens.
You know how to reach me.
Get some rest and stand by for the next mission. Dismissed.
Hi, sweetie. You here to help me out?
Some hoodlums out at the $map:02000083$ are causing trouble.
Who are these hoodlums?
We're not sure exactly. They all wear masks. We do know that they're running around assaulting the residents and stealing their stuff.
The locals have tried their best to maintain order, but these hoodlums must have political connections because nothing's been done locally to get rid of them.
The area is technically under my jurisdiction, so I'm stepping in.
I'd deal with them myself, if I had it my way. But, since the local citizens probably wouldn't appreciate my methods, I'm sending you instead.
Your methods...?
Oh, you know. Some dismembered limbs, some gouged-out organs. Same old, same old. Anyway, head to $map:02000083$ when you have a chance, okay?
Did you complete your mission already? You didn't get lost, did you?
Ah, you're back, $MyPCName$, my sweet!
Is the job done?
I took care of them, and their little dogs, too!
Wonderful! I knew I could count on you, $male:handsome,female:gorgeous$.
You probably didn't completely dismantle their organization, but they should stay quiet for a while.
And if they don't?
Then... I'll just have to step in myself.
You just sent a shiver down my spine.
I'm sure they're not entirely stupid. It'll be fine. And if not, I'll get to have a good time. Everybody wins. Great work, darling!
Ah, you made it, $MyPCName$.
... ... And that's your mission.
I have a question.
Yes?
What mission?
Your sense of humor tickles me, $MyPCName$.
No, really. What mission?
...Really?
Really.
Very well. As I just told you telepathically, now that the existence of the Lumiknights has been declassified, I feel comfortable taking a more aggressive stance.
You've been to the $map:02000146$. You've felt firsthand the power of the darkness there. The creatures have all become tainted.
If nothing is done, they will spread that darkness to other parts of Maple World. That must not be permitted to happen.
How can I help?
Cull the enemies there. It's a temporary measure, but at this time, a necessary one.
Slowing the darkness is the best we can do until we can stop its source once and for all.
Now, did my briefing stick with you the second time around?
Every word.
Wonderful. Then there's not time to lose.
Each moment you delay is a moment the enemy takes advantage of...
Ah, the darkness has abated somewhat.
I knew you were the right choice for this mission.
I got rid of as many monsters as I could, but new ones appeared just as fast...
Yes... The darkness has a strong foothold there. It troubles me as well.
My order closely monitors that area. I'll notify you if the balance grows too skewed.
What happens then?
Don't you know? You'll become very busy, $MyPCName$.
Ah. Of course.
For now, we've done enough to allow ourselves a moment to breathe. Thank you, $MyPCName$.
I was just thinking of you, $MyPCName$.
If you've got a minute, could you do me a favor?
What's up?
I got a call from an old friend. She's also a member of the Green Hoods.
She said that the area around $map:02000038$ has seen a sharp increase in monsters lately.
It's hard for her team to handle, since they're based in $map:02000076$, which is really far away.
My heart goes out to all the innocent people suffering... I think you know where I'm going with this, $MyPCName$.
Say no more. I'm on it.
Really? Thank you so much, $MyPCName$!
Wait just a moment, and I'll get you on your way.
How is $map:02000038$? Teach those monsters what's good for them!
You're back!
The junior members of the Green Hoods saw what you did. They couldn't stop raving about how amazing you were, $MyPCName$!
Shucks, it was nothing.
It's not nothing! Your help is making a big difference!
Speaking of which...
What is it?
Can you keep helping us, just like this time, now and again?
I know it's a lot to ask, and that you've already helped us so much, but...
No problem. I'll do it.
Really?! Thank you so much!
You have no idea what a huge impact you're making, $MyPCName$! I look forward to working with you!
Hurry up, cadet!
Didn't I give you the look 30 minutes ago? What took you so long?
No, Sir! I must've missed the look, Sir!
I consider myself a nice guy. I'll forgive you this time.
Now, I seem to recall you had fairly decent combat skills, is that right?
I do okay. Nothing compared to you, Sir.
That's to be expected. It's smart to realize your own limitations. It's what lets you know when people are pandering to you. Now, about the mission...
Your word is my command, Sir!
The Royal Guards work day and night to keep $map:02000001$ safe, but enemies from $map:02000088$ have been a huge pain in the rump lately.
The city could be attacked at any moment. Without proper rest between attacks, do you think the guards will be ready?
Probably not.
Right! And that's why you need to step in and teach our enemies a lesson!
You got it! It's not like I'm ever busy or need rest!
Exactly! Because you're Strike Team Condor!
You... really do actually have a lot of faith in me, don't you?
I really do, cadet.
Have you completed your mission? If not, then why are you talking to me?!
You're back, cadet!
Have things in $map:02000088$ been sorted out?
Absolutely!
Great! That's one burden off my shoulders.
Sometimes, the newer guards worry me. They act so clueless. At least they seem to gain courage from seeing you in action.
Good job, cadet!
May I speak with you for a moment, $MyPCName$?
Sure, what's up?
It's time we ran a drill to make sure you're up to your duties aboard Sky Fortress.
Do we have to?
All right! Let's do it!
Absolutely. You've proven your mettle in the past, but even the greatest soldier will begin to backslide if $male:he's,female:she's$ not testing her limits on a regular basis.
As such, I must require that every crewperson under my command run regular drills.
Everyone, $MyPCName$. You're no exception.
Okay. How do we do this?
It's simple. Complete a mission for me. We'll monitor your progress from here.
Sounds easy!
I appreciate your enthusiasm.
I'm all about enthusiasm!
Prove that you're worthy of being a part of this crew by completing a mission. You may begin.
You haven't started your mission yet? You know there's a time limit, right?
Ah, so you've completed your mission.
Then it's time to analyze the results.
Let's see here. The results say...
You meet all requirements for active duty service aboard Sky Fortress.
Yeah! I knew it!
You've earned your spot on my ship for the time being.
So I'm done with the drills now, right? Done forever?
$MyPCName$, you will have to take these routine drills for as long as you stay under my command.
What?!
That is all. Dismissed.
There you are, kitten!
It's time for drills! You ready?
Drills?
Aww, do I have to do this every time?!
You silly goose, have you forgotten already? It's a test to ensure you're still fit to carry out Dark Wind missions!
Oh, yeah...
I'm well aware of your... prowess... but rules are rules.
Okay.
Great. The test is simple, just do what I say,
Easy peasy.
Very well... Let's begin!
The clock is ticking. If you don't hurry it up, you might not pass.
Time's up!
Now, let's take a look at your results.
Eeek.
Don't get so tense, kitten. Of course you passed.
Well done, but I would've rather spent that time cozying up in my room with you than on a silly test.
Uh, that'd be a hard pass.
Are you sure? I have a lot of information stored in this noggin' that I'm sure you're aching to... unlock.
Pfft, only if $male:he,female:she$ has a death wish.
Come now, $npcName:11003862$. You spent time with me, and you're alive, aren't you? Are you interested in a second round?
I'd better get out of here before I say something I regret. I'll catch you cats later.
And there he goes. There's a lot I can tell you about him when we have some time alone, kitten.
You've kept me waiting, $MyPCName$.
It's time for you to be tested.
Tested... why?
Say it ain't so!
To see if you're worthy to stay aboard Sky Fortress. To see if you're worthy to talk to me.
So if I fail, does that mean... Never mind.
The Lumiknights have a similar test for new knights. It entails...
Actually, that's classified.
So about this current test...
Ah, but it is so.
What do I need to do?
Just complete the mission that I ask of you. Simple enough, no?
Now, go complete your mission.
Ah, your methods were... invigorating.
I appreciated how you tackled the test.
So... did I pass?
I already relayed the results to you telepathically...
And I'll repeat them again out loud. You passed. It's a relief that I don't need to erase your memories.
You can do that?!
Of course. I can't allow just anyone to recall having seen or talked to me.
But you and I... We'll get to keep our shared connection for some time yet. Isn't that special?
Ah, are you here for the drill, $MyPCName$?
You're early. Very diligent. I approve!
What's this about a drill?
I can't wait!
Are you serious? You don't know what the drill entails?
But you do realize that if you fail, you'll be forced to leave the fleet and be banned from setting foot on the Sky Fortress for an entire year? You know that part, right?
Where have you been, $MyPCName$?! Everyone, from the captain to the janitor, needs to take this test!
Right. Sure. I knew that.
Sheesh, $MyPCName$! You scared me!
Now, are you ready to begin?
As ready as I'll ever be.
I knew you'd come prepared!
Just, uh, tell me what to do!
It's simple. If you can complete a mission I give you, you pass! That's it!
You do realize I'm tracking the amount of time it takes you to complete the test, don't you?
All done! Good job!
You were even better than I expected.
I'll make sure to increase the difficulty next time!
Or we could just skip it...
No way! We have to stick to the established processes. Nobody gets special treatment!
And that includes me, as well. I have to run drills, just like everyone else.
You barely made it, cadet! I was about to cut you from the list!
Why are you still dragging your feet? Hurry it up!
What are you talking about?
Just give me one more chance!
It's time for drills! You do know what drills are, don't you?
Am I supposed to?
Did you think you had a permanent spot aboard Sky Fortress, cadet?
No! We have to test you now and again to make sure you're still fit for service!
I... guess that makes sense.
What're you waiting for, then? Get to it!
I'm ready when you are, Sir.
I hope you studied, cadet.
As thoroughly as I could, considering I just found out about this.
Good enough. Now... go and complete one of my missions! That's the drill!
What are you still fooling around here for? Do you want to get kicked out?
You've still got it, cadet. You had me worried for a minute there.
I now officially deem you worthy... to continue working under me... until your next drill. Walk proud today, cadet!
It's an honor.
Of course it is! Not many people get to see my face every day!
But never take that privilege for granted, or I'll kick you off this ship so fast you'll get airsick.
Your face is never far from my mind, Sir!
Good, good. Now what're you doing standing around for? Go find another mission to do!
As you know, the crew of the Sky Fortress undergoes regular testing to ensure they remain fit for duty. Once again, it is nearly time for everyone to prove themselves.
However, it's come to my attention that many among our crew believe these tests are too easy.
So, I've decided to increase their difficulty.

I'd like you to be my test case to ensure the examination is adequately difficult. But remember, this exercise is not about simply passing or failing; it is an evaluation of your ability to carry out missions. Don't be discouraged if you fall short.
Your task is simply to carry out a series of missions in Kritias. It is up to you to decide which missions you will undertake. Good luck.
Your evaluation was more than satisfactory. You are clearly qualified to take on S-Class missions.
Thank you for your assistance. I don't see any problems holding the rest of the crew to the same standards.
We haven't been in Kritias long, but it's already clear that there are a great number of robots here.
Certainly, they may vary in appearance and function, but they all seem to have one commonality.
What's that?
They are all hostile to us. They attack our scouts indiscriminately.

If these machines are intelligent, it is time we taught them that their aggression against us will be repaid tenfold. To that end, I would like you to decimate the following targets: $npcNamePlural:25020001$ in $map:02020029$, $npcNamePlural:25020101[gender:0]$ in $map:02020030$, and $npcNamePlural:25020201$ in $map:02020031$.
Consider this an opportunity not only to teach them a lesson, but to assess their abilities and vulnerabilities.
You haven't left yet? Well, be careful. This is sure to be a dangerous mission.
Ah, you've returned. What have you learned?
Well for a start, some of the targets on your list weren't machines at all—they were soldiers in high-tech armor.
I see... It seems we have much to learn about our new adversaries.
Excellent work, $MyPCName$.
Are you ready for your routine performance evaluation?
With all of the stresses of our work, especially in this new continent, it is important to ensure each one of us is prepared for whatever challenges come our way.
I expect everyone to take this examination seriously.

That includes you, $MyPCName$. Despite your many accomplishments, you cannot afford to grow complacent. Should it be determined you are no longer fit for service, I will have no choice but to restrict you from all missions until you redeem yourself.
Show me what you've got.
I expect only the best from each among our crew. Give this assignment your all.
Good job, $MyPCName$. I'm sure it was difficult, but you completed everything I asked of you.
But don't grow complacent. Before you know it, it will be time for your next examination.

$MyPCName$, do you remember the dropship you used when you first arrived in Kritias? We've had some problems with a remote launch and recovery. The craft seems to be experiencing a systems malfunction.
Can it be recovered?
Before we can recover the dropship, we'll need to repair it. But that could take several days, even without monsters in the area chewing on vital components.
A dropship is too great a resource to abandon. Therefore, I'd like you to travel to $map:02020029$ and deal with our vermin problem.
Please hurry to the dropship before it is damaged beyond repair.
How did it go?
I got rid of any monster that even looked in the direction of the dropship. I think the craft should be safe until we can repair it.
Excellent work. We will retrieve the ship as soon as repairs are complete.
Reports are coming back about the wide variety of lifeforms that call Kritias home.
While some pose no real threat at all, a great many appear hostile.
I would like you to engage these lifeforms in battle and determine if any are a threat to our operations here.
Defeat $npcNamePlural:25020005$ in $map:02020029$ , $npcNamePlural:25020105$ in $map:02020030$ , and $npcNamePlural:25020205$ in $map:02020031$.
Defeat $npcNamePlural:25020005$ in $map:02020029$ , $npcNamePlural:25020105$ in $map:02020030$ , and $npcNamePlural:25020205$ in $map:02020031$.
What did you learn?
Hostile or not, they're nothing the Alliance can't handle!
...I see. Good job.
Kritias is a land both of great technological wonders and tremendous natural beauty. It's only natural that our crew should feel a certain sense of peace here.
However, the Daemon Army has no respect for nature. It seems the machines in their thrall are cutting down trees in $map:02020029$.
Our analysis indicates they are collecting lumber to construct a military base.
Needless to say, we cannot allow that. Destroy $npcNamePlural:25020001$ in $map:02020029$ to deny them their military base and protect the forest.
Hurry. We cannot allow them to complete their military base.
Report.
The mechanical menace has been disrupted.
Excellent work as always, $MyPCName$.
$MyPCName$, do you have a moment?
Sure, what do you need?
Our researchers have been wanting to bring back docile lifeforms for study. With them being more the scholarly type, I need a volunteer animal wrangler to capture specimens for study.
The first creature on their list for study is the $item:61000153$ native to $map:02020029$. Please capture two and return here.
The first creature on their list for study is the $item:61000153$ native to $map:02020029$. Please capture two and return here.
Here it is, some freshly caught $itemPlural:61000153$.
Hmm. It's not the prettiest creature, is it? Are there no cats native to Kritias?
$MyPCName$, we have an urgent mission! $npcName:11004395[gender:1]$'s adjutant $npcName:11004396[gender:0]$ just called us to request backup.
The Tairen Kingdom's forces are attacking $map:02020030$, and Humanitas's defenses are undermanned.
I'll head there right away.
I knew I could count on you. Go to $map:02020030$ and assist our allies by defeating $npcNamePlural:25020101[gender:0]$.
Leave at once. Humanitas cannot survive the loss of $map:02020030$!
Humanitas called to thank me for your swift response. Excellent work today.
That's what allies are for!
Indeed. And Humanitas will never forget that when they were in peril, we did not hesitate to come to their aid.
$MyPCName$, I'm glad you're here.
<font color="#909090">(Looks like it's time for another mission!)</font>
The Special Projects division of Sky Fortress's R&D team has been hard at work studying the mechanized soldiers of Kritias, however, their research has come to something of a standstill.
The lab needs new machine components to analyze, but their target of choice represents a substantial threat to our average operative.
They want to harvest a particular part from the $npcNamePlural:25020201$ in $map:02020031$. That's where you come in.
I want you to go to $map:02020031$ and harvest $item:30001218$ from the $npcNamePlural:25020201$.
I want you to go to $map:02020031$ and harvest $item:30001218$ from the $npcNamePlural:25020201$.
I brought the parts you asked for.
The R&D team will be excited to get their hands on these. Good work, $MyPCName$.
Their research could be vital in the battle against these mechanical foes.
I've never seen anything quite like the harmony of nature and technology evidenced in Kritias. It is quite a marvel.
I agree.
On a related note, we've received reports that the Daemon Army has been tearing up $map:02020029$.
Our analysts have determined they are constructing a military base. Obviously, we cannot allow them to gain such a foothold in the region.
You are to travel to $map:02020029$ immediately and destroy the $npcNamePlural:25020002$ before their work goes any further.
Hurry to $map:02020029$.
Our sensors report a significant drop in $npcNamePlural:25020002$ in the area.
The Daemon Army won't be building a new base there any time soon. Good work, $MyPCName$.
Hmm...
What's wrong?
$npcName:11004395[gender:1]$'s adjutant, $npcName:11004396[gender:0]$, has contacted us over the fear of the growing number of $npcNamePlural:25020102$ outside $map:02020030$.
They to gather intelligence and test the town's defenses, putting all of its citizens at risk.
I want you to go and assist our friends in $map:02020030$ by dealing with their $npcName:25020102$ problem. Are you up to the task?
I'll head out right now.
Hurry. Every moment we waste, the people of $map:02020030$ are in danger.
Good work, $MyPCName$. Humanitas and the civilians under their care can rest easy tonight thanks to you.
I dare say you'll soon be recognized not just as a $male:hero,female:heroine$ of Maple World, but of Kritias as well.
We have built a safehaven for ourselves in Kritias, but resources remain a constant concern. We must expand our efforts to become self-sufficient in this new land.

In the meantime, there's a perfectly functional extraction operation sitting abandoned in $map:02020031$. Why not secure it, get it running again, and start trading the resources we extract with Humanitas?
Our crystal thingies for their food. Sounds like a fair trade to me!
That place is abandoned for a reason! It's crawling with hostile forces!
So why don't we throw Strike Team Condor at them? $MyPCName$ will have that placed mopped up in no time!
Oh my!
Did you come up with this idea all on your own?
It's been quite some time since he's provided an idea of substance. Quickly, someone mark this down on the calendar.
I'll take care of it!
Well, it's a step in the right direction. Very well, $MyPCName$. Defeat the $npcNamePlural:25020202$ in $map:02020031$ so we can establish a local mining operation. I'll discuss terms with Marlene.
Well, it's a step in the right direction. Very well, $MyPCName$. Defeat the $npcNamePlural:25020202$ in $map:02020031$ so we can establish a local mining operation. I'll discuss terms with Marlene.
I've come to a fair arrangement with Humanitas. In exchange for securing $map:02020031$, they will trade resources with us.
Hah! I knew it would work.
It was a good idea, $npcName:11004313[gender:0]$. We'll need more outside-the-box solutions like that on the road ahead.
$MyPCName$, are you familiar with $npcNamePlural:25020003$?
I'm not sure.

The $npcName:25020003$ is a violently aggressive monster with larger crystals growing from its spine. It has proven quite a pest to our operations within its native habitats. Anyways, our scientists want to investigate the species' aggression is in some way linked to those crystals.
Obviously, they'll need samples to prove their hypothesis.
I would like you to travel to $map:02020029$ and defeat $npcNamePlural:25020003$ and collect the $itemPlural:30001219$ growing from their spines.
I would like you to travel to $map:02020029$ and defeat $npcNamePlural:25020003$ and collect the $itemPlural:30001219$ growing from their spines.
So these are the $itemPlural:30001219$ that were embedded in the creature's spine? $npcName:11004411[gender:0]$, please analyze them.
I'll scan the crystals and send the data to the lab for analysis. It shouldn't take more than a few moments.
Hm... It seems their hypothesis was wrong. These are just ordinary crystals.
Then may I have them? The Lumiknights will put them to use.
What are you going to do with some crystals?
I'm afraid that matter is classified.
$MyPCName$, we have an emergency an our hands. Can you assist us?
I'm always ready!
$map:02020030$ is under siege by the Tairen Kingdom. Humanitas has requested our aid in warding off their assault.
I am told the $npcNamePlural:25020103[gender:0]$ pose a special threat. You are to assist Humanitas by defeating them.
Humanitas is our only ally in this new land, and $map:02020030$ their home. I don't need to remind you what's at stake should they be allowed to fall.
Go to $map:02020030$ and deal with the $npcNamePlural:25020103[gender:0]$.
Was your mission successful?
The Tairen will think twice before their next attack.
Excellent work, $MyPCName$.
$MyPCName$, do you remember the mechanical soldiers $npcName:11001813[gender:0]$ co-opted in $map:02020031$? Well, they're still in $map:02020031$ running amok.

The Daemon Army has wreaked enough havoc here. As they come from our own lands, it falls to us to see them purged from Kritias. To that end, I want you to destroy as many of $npcName:11001813[gender:0]$'s hacked machines as you can manage.
How exactly $npcName:11001813[gender:0]$ hacked these machines remains a mystery. I want you to salvage any data stores you can from the machines you destroyed so our technicians can analyze them.
Travel to $map:02020031$ as soon as you are able. Destroy the $npcNamePlural:25020203$ and collect their $itemPlural:30001220$.
Travel to $map:02020031$ as soon as you are able. Destroy the $npcNamePlural:25020203$ and collect their $itemPlural:30001220$.
Did you recover the $itemPlural:30001220$?
Good work. I'll have our research team analyze these immediately.
In this foreign land, our routine testing is more important than ever. We must be ever ready for the call of duty.

Despite your many triumphs, you are not exempt from these tests. If anything, your performance is more important than anyone else's. The crew looks up to you. So, are you ready for your next assessment?
Bring it on.
Excellent. Then let's get started.
Your task is simply to carry out a series of missions in Kritias. It is up to you to decide which missions you will undertake. Good luck.
Another successful examination! I expected no less.
You passed your assessment with flying colors. Keep it up, $MyPCName$.
$MyPCName$, your ongoing efforts have significantly bolstered our efforts to explore Kritias. I want to thank you on behalf of the entire crew.
I was just doing my duty.
We have obtained a wealth of new information through our ever-growing expedition, but the breadth of what we don't yet know makes our work dangerous.

Speaking of danger, our scouts have run into some trouble with the $npcNamePlural:25020501$ in $map:02020001$, the $npcNamePlural:25020301$ in $map:02020006$, and the $npcNamePlural:25020401$ in $map:02020004$.
I would like you to diminish their numbers to protect our patrols.
Defeat $npcNamePlural:25020501$ in $map:02020001$, $npcNamePlural:25020301$ in $map:02020006$, and $npcNamePlural:25020401$ in $map:02020004$.
Good work. Our scouts will be very grateful.
And with their jobs made safer, they should be able to gather vital intelligence much more efficiently. Good job, $MyPCName$.
$MyPCName$, how would you say you've adjusted to operations in Kritias?
No problems here!
That's excellent to hear. And I have the perfect opportunity for you to prove it. Your regular performance evaluation!
The better prepared we are for Kritias' unique challenges, the greater our ability to avoid unnecessary casualties. Well, let's get started.
Your test begins now.
Your performance results are in...
<font color="#909090">(Even though you know you did an awesome job, as always, you can't help but be nervous...)</font>
<font size="45">You passed.</font>
I'm glad you are as ready for action as you say. Keep up the good work.
$MyPCName$, have you been to, $map:02020001$ recently?
$map:02020001$? I don't recall.
I've heard the region's serene ambiance makes it an excellent place for meditation—or it would, if it weren't full of hostile forces.
In any case, I was thinking, the crew could really use some shore leave to take their minds off their troubles.
I'd like you to drive out these foes so that our crew can enjoy $map:02020001$.
Defeat monsters in $map:02020001$.
Excellent work. I've informed the crew that $map:02020001$ is now safe enough for shore leave.
Of course, our foes will probably return in time. But I trust you'll be ready to drive them out again!
Sigh.
What's the matter?

Much as it pains me to say, many among our crew have abandoned all sense of discipline. You see they've been charmed by an adorable local creature called the $npcName:25020301$, and they've been feeding the beast their much-needed rations. If this goes on, I worry Sky Fortress's pantries will be laid bare.
My warnings have done little to stem the problem. Only one course of action remains.
We must recover the rations by force. Go to $map:02020006$, and retrieve the $itemPlural:30001221$—from the beasts' bellies, if need be!
Go to $map:02020006$, and retrieve the $itemPlural:30001221$ from the $npcNamePlural:25020301$.
Have you recovered our rations?
I recovered what I could, but some of them were too far gone.
Thank you, $MyPCName$. I am ashamed that such a measure was even necessary.
New lands always have much to teach us. One thing I found quite surprising was that some of the machines here wield swords.
As much as I would like to test them in battle and learn from their fighting style, my duties as captain keep me here.
And it would not be acceptable to use my station to order the capture of one of these machines for my own personal gain...
Captain...
I apologize for rambling. These are not the sort of concerns I can voice to our crew. Thanks for listening.
If it's so important to you, why don't I go fight one of these robots and report back?
$MyPCName$, you would do that for me? Thank you very much.
Well then, do battle with the $npcNamePlural:25020401$ of $map:02020004$ and take notes about their technique.
Do battle with the $npcNamePlural:25020401$ of $map:02020004$ and take notes about their technique.
Ah, you've returned! Can you demonstrate the fighting technique used by the machine?
I'll try and show you everything I remember.
What unusual technique... It may take me a while to master them. I hope you don't mind if I call on your aid again.
$MyPCName$, could you come here for a moment?
Our crew can't seem to stop talking about these $item:61000158$ creatures.
They are said to be unbelievably cute. The fact they have captivated our crew so swiftly demands an analysis!
<font color="#909090">(You can't help but detect a faint twinkle in her eyes.)</font>
Capture $itemPlural:61000158$ in $map:02020006$.
Capture $itemPlural:61000158$ in $map:02020006$.
This is the $item:61000158$? No wonder the members were captivated.
So, are you going to keep it?
No. It is a wild animal, and that is where it belongs. After our scientists have studied it and verified it to be in good health, I will release it back into the wild.
That said... I might go and visit it from time to time. You know, to make sure it's still in peak health.
$MyPCName$, do you have a moment?
Our exploration of $map:02020001$ has been hamstrung by repeated run-ins with the local monsters.
These creatures don't seem to be willing to listen to reason. I want you to help make the region safe so our expedition members can continue their work.
Defeat the $npcNamePlural:25020502$.
Defeat the $npcNamePlural:25020502$.
Good job, $MyPCName$. I'll let the crew know it's safe to resume their exploration efforts.
I doubt those creatures will bother us anytime soon.
The docile lifeforms of Kritias could prove valuable as livestock, pets, or beasts of burdens. But the only way to find out is to study them!

Just as this new region is filled with new varieties of hostile monsters, so too will it contain docile ones. It would be valuable to determine which among them can be domesticated as beast of burdens, livestock or pets.
There's only one way to find out of course. I'd like to to capture a $item:61000157$ native to $map:02020006$.
Bring it back here and our research team will look into whether domestication is a suitable course of action.
<font color="#909090">(Hopefully this creature you're supposed to capture will come quietly...)</font>
Go to $map:02020006$ and a capture $item:61000157$.
I've got one beastie, ready for the lab.
Good work. Let's have a look at it...
Hmm. I'll have the monster delivered to our research team. Dismissed.
The personal flying machines of Kritias... intrigue me.

If we outfit our scouts with this kit, we could cut down the tactical advantage that Tairen has over us. $npcName:11004315[gender:1]$ tells me that there should be a part within the machine that controls the whole system.
Engage the $npcNamePlural:25020403$ in $map:02020004$ and retrieve these $itemPlural:30001222$.
Engage the $npcNamePlural:25020403$ in $map:02020004$ and retrieve these $itemPlural:30001222$.
So, this is the part.
I'll order its analysis immediately. The sooner we control this technology, the better.
We must take action. Our scouts' lives are on the line.
What can I do?
Our scouts in $map:02020006$ were attacked by $npcNamePlural:25020302$. Their poison makes the wounds particularly difficult to heal.
To make matters worse, their poison seeps into the ground, making it dangerous to even explore the area.
I'll take care of it.
Good. Go to $map:02020006$ and defeat $npcNamePlural:25020302$.
Go to $map:02020006$ and defeat $npcNamePlural:25020302$.
My commendations, $MyPCName$. $map:02020006$ is safe for our scouts again.
Thank you.
Our enemies in Kritias are relentless. However, perhaps we were hasty in assuming that they couldn't be reasoned with.
I need someone with a strong will to reach out to them. Test the waters for diplomacy.
I'll give it a shot.
Thank you for volunteering. Go to $map:02020001$ and initiate talks with the $npcNamePlural:25020501$. If that fails... you know what to do.
Go to $map:02020001$ and initiate talks with the $npcNamePlural:25020501$. If that fails... you know what to do.
How did the talks go?
They went nowhere.
I see.
We shouldn't give up yet. Maybe another opportunity will come up in the future.
$map:02020004$ is a key strategic location for Sky Fortress.
You understand, then, that I am not pleased that Tairen continues to hold it.
If we can take the area from them, it will increase our operational range on Kritias.
Go to $map:02020004$ and defeat $npcNamePlural:25020402$.
Go to $map:02020004$ and defeat $npcNamePlural:25020402$.
Our soldiers now have a direct path through the area.
Thank you for helping secure our position.
Do you smell something?
That would be $npcName:25020303$ poison. My men encountered some in $map:02020006$.
The smell is... potent. And persistent. We haven't been able to get the smell out of anything it touches.

If we had some $item:30001223$, we might be able to engineer a cleaning agent—but nobody is willing to volunteer for the mission. Which is why I'm volunteering you. Go to $map:02020006$ and get $item:30001223$ from $npcNamePlural:25020303$.
Go to $map:02020006$ and get $item:30001223$ from $npcNamePlural:25020303$.
We've been holding our breath waiting for your return.
I only hope that this $item:30001223$ holds the antidote for this stench.
We've fought our fair share of aggressive monsters, but we've met a new beast that gave us pause.
I'm referring to the $npcNamePlural:25020503$ of $map:02020001$.
Almost every scout I've sent there has been grievously injured. $npcNamePlural:25020503$ are big, strong, and as mean as they come. We must strike them down before they hurt any more of my people.
I'm ready.
Excellent. We must make the safety of our non-combatant crew a priority.
Go to $map:02020001$ and defeat $npcNamePlural:25020503$.
Go to $map:02020001$ and defeat $npcNamePlural:25020503$.
You were more than a match for those creatures.
Thank you for doing what must be done for the good of Sky Fortress.
It's time for you to undergo routine testing.
I have no concerns about your performance. Your assistance in Kritias has been invaluable so far.
I try to do my best.
Then let the test begin. Even if you don't complete this test, you'll still have my utmost trust.
Then I'd better earn that trust by completing the test!
You have your work cut out for you. Return without injury, if you can.
You never disappoint. Good job, $MyPCName$.
With you on our side, it's only a matter of time before we fully understand Kritias.
I've heard disturbing rumors about a monster at the $map:02020017$. At first, I wanted to brush them off...
Some rumors just stick, no matter how hard you try to scrub them off.
So, is that what we've got here? One of those... sticky rumors?
I'm ordering an investigation if for no other reason than to quell these rumors. Go to the $map:02020017$ and uncover the truth.
Go to the $map:02020017$ and uncover the truth.
Was the rumor true?
Yes, but don't worry. I took care of it.
That's good. Perhaps we should keep the truth to ourselves, though.
As difficult operations like this one drag on, morale begins to suffer.
Many of our troops feel helpless against the enemies arrayed against us.
They look up to you, however. If they see that even you still do mundane tasks like routine testing, they'll be emboldened.
That's why I ask you to do this. Not for your sake, but for the sake of the mission.
You have much work ahead of you. I expect the best from you.
I can already feel a change in the morale. You did well.
Thank you, $MyPCName$.

The $map:02020010$, $map:02020034$, and $map:02020032$ all hold positions of strategic significance to $map:02020041$. If enemy forces get too powerful in these areas, then our entire position will be compromised.
And if we can't hold this position against the Daemon Army or Tairen, then Sky Fortress itself could be destroyed.
I want to drive the enemy forces from those areas, but that may not be possible. At the very least, we should thin out their numbers.
Leave it to me.
I will. Defeat $npcNamePlural:25020601$ in the $map:02020010$, $npcNamePlural:25020701$ at the $map:02020032$, $npcNamePlural:25020801$ in the $map:02020034$.
Defeat $npcNamePlural:25020601$ in the $map:02020010$, $npcNamePlural:25020701$ at the $map:02020032$, $npcNamePlural:25020801$ in the $map:02020034$.
That was quicker than I expected. It seems you were successful.
$map:02020041$ is secure for another day. Thank you.
You've done great things for us here in Kritias.
That's why you're the only person I can entrust with this mission. Are you up to a challenge?
Of course.
The $npcNamePlural:25020601$ at the $map:02020010$ don't appear remarkable, but their weapon systems are powerful. I want to know why, and the only way to find out is to collect $item:30001224$.
Defeat $npcNamePlural:25020601$ in the $map:02020010$ and get $item:30001224$.
Defeat $npcNamePlural:25020601$ in the $map:02020010$ and get $item:30001224$.
You've exceeded my every expectation.
These $item:30001224$ will teach us a lot. The research team owes you one.
$MyPCName$, I have an important assignment for you. The Tairen $npcNamePlural:25020606[gender:0]$ are a bigger problem than we expected.
We need to investigate the $map:02020010$, but our scouts can't get past their defensive lines. Worse, they're coming back with life-threatening injuries.
That's where you come in. We can't afford to lose any more scouts, so I'm sending you in to deliver swift retribution.
Defeat as many $npcNamePlural:25020606[gender:0]$ as you can and make sure they think twice about fighting Sky Fortress in the future.
Well done, $MyPCName$. Now our scouts can finally get us the information we need.
$MyPCName$, I'm glad you're here. I could use your help.
Our research team is collecting information on Tairen $itemPlural:61000160$ to discover their strengths and weaknesses. This study shows a lot of promise. But it means they need specimens.
So I'm reassigning you to $map:02020030$ to collect $itemPlural:61000160$ for them. See what you can find.
Capture $itemPlural:61000160$ in $map:02020030$
I've got the specimens!
Well done! Now keep exploring while I deliver this to our research team. We need all the information we can get.
$MyPCName$, as you may be aware, Tairen has firm control of the $map:02020034$.
If we could infiltrate the plant, we could destroy their aetherine fusion reactor and deprive the Tairen mechs of their most crucial energy source. But so far, that's proved impossible.
However our research team informs me that the Tairen have been using $npcNamePlural:25020801$ to regulate their aetherine production. That's our new target.
If we figure out what makes those mechs tick, we can bring the whole plant to a screeching halt.
Find the $npcNamePlural:25020801$ in the $map:02020034$, destroy them, and collect $itemPlural:30001225$. This mission will deal a crucial blow to Tairen.
Find the $npcNamePlural:25020801$ in the $map:02020034$, destroy them, and collect $itemPlural:30001225$. This mission will deal a crucial blow to Tairen.
I'll see that the research team gets these parts immediately.
You have my thanks. Now get some rest and be ready for your next mission.
There's an intense standoff between Sky Fortress and the Daemon Army at the $map:02020032$ on the outskirts of $map:02020041$.
From the moment we took this field, our enemy has battered us relentlessly with increasingly vicious attacks.
But we will never surrender $map:02020041$. And I've decided it's high time we take the fight to them.
I need you on the $map:02020032$ to lead our soldiers against the $npcNamePlural:25020701$ and show them that we will not be cowed by their brutality.
I need you on the $map:02020032$ to lead our soldiers against the $npcNamePlural:25020701$ and show them that we will not be cowed by their brutality.
Very well done, $MyPCName$. You've won us time to rest and recover before the next battle.
When we learned of $map:02020013$, we had hoped to discover allies as well as a safehaven.
But our earliest scouts report that the native creatures are shockingly vicious, which has put a kink in our plans.
Our research team's prevailing theory is that the local $npcNamePlural:11004548[gender:0]$ are somehow inciting that violent behavior, but they haven't figured out how to prevent it yet.
I need you to clear the area of $npcNamePlural:25020901$. Then, hopefully, our scouts can bring back some useful information about $map:02020013$ and its local wildlife.
Hurry. Our people's lives are once again in your hands.
You never disappoint. Good job, $MyPCName$.
$MyPCName$, I have your next assignment. It seems the Tairen $npcNamePlural:25021001$ in $map:02020016$ are surprisingly agile despite their heavy armor.
Tech like that could be a major asset, and one of our researchers got the bright idea to do some reverse engineering.
Given enough time and proper analysis, our team could provide significant upgrades to Sky Fortress weaponry. That's where you come in.
We need you to destroy $npcNamePlural:25021001$ in $map:02020016$ and collect $itemPlural:30001226$. The sooner our people can study this tech, the better.
We need you to destroy $npcNamePlural:25021001$ in $map:02020016$ and collect $itemPlural:30001226$. The sooner our people can study this tech, the better.
Good job, $MyPCName$. I'll get these to our team immediately.
Let's hope this idea pans out.

Perfect timing, $MyPCName$. $npcName:11004315[gender:0]$ just received new information about Kharon from Humanitas. $npcName:11004315[gender:0]$, why don't you bring $male:him,female:her$ up to speed?
My contact, $npcName:11004395[gender:1]$, tells me Kharon has joined forces with Tairen to kidnap exiles and attack Humanitas.
Of all people, you'd think Kharon exiles would be the most empathetic toward other exiles, but they're just vicious.
It's unforgivable.
We will not suffer Kharon brutality against the innocent. $MyPCName$, we need you out in $map:02020010$ fighting $npcNamePlural:25020602$ and helping as many people as you can.
We will not suffer Kharon brutality against the innocent. $MyPCName$, we need you out in $map:02020010$ fighting $npcNamePlural:25020602$ and helping as many people as you can.
Thank you for taking action.
The people of Humanitas have expressed their gratitude for your selflessness.
Ah, $MyPCName$. Good to see you again. I have news about our ally, Humanitas.
What's the word?
Humanitas is determined to take the $map:02020034$, Tairen's most valuable power production facility. But so far, they've failed to claim it. Now they're requesting backup.

The area is crawling with Tairen mechs, so Sky Fortress is going to lend a hand. For Humanitas to take control of the $map:02020034$, you and our other soldiers must destroy as many $npcNamePlural:25020802$ as you can to weaken their defense.
For Humanitas to take control of the $map:02020034$, you and our other soldiers must destroy as many $npcNamePlural:25020802$ as you can to weaken their defense.
I've heard a lot of talk about you from the Humanitas soldiers, all of it good.
Well done, $MyPCName$.
It's about time you showed up. We're in a standoff with the Daemon Army on the $map:02020032$, and we may have found a way to gain the upper hand.
Our scouts have discovered the army is drawing power from some kind of $item:30001227$. If this really is the source of their power, then we need to learn more about it.
It's possible we could reverse engineer it and use the technology to our advantage.
I need you to defeat $npcNamePlural:25020702$ at the $map:02020032$ and collect their $itemPlural:30001227$, so our research team can begin studying them immediately.
I need you to defeat $npcNamePlural:25020702$ at the $map:02020032$ and collect their $itemPlural:30001227$, so our research team can begin studying them immediately.
Perfect timing. Our research team just finished prepping the lab.
I'll get the fragment to them right away. Thank you.
I know it's a long shot, but I'm still hoping we can negotiate with some of the Kritias monsters.
They would make for some very powerful allies in our fight against Tairen.
Big, tough monsters? Of course they'd be great allies.
I thought you might agree. The trouble is, my scouts just aren't equipped to handle it if negotiations turn... violent. But that won't be a problem for you.
Go to $map:02020013$ and try talking to the $npcNamePlural:25020902$ there. But be warned. If it doesn't pan out, you may need to employ more aggressive negotiation tactics.
Go to $map:02020013$ and try talking to the $npcNamePlural:25020902$ there. But be warned. If it doesn't pan out, you may need to employ more aggressive negotiation tactics.
Were you successful?
I successfully defeated a bunch of monsters.
I see. Well, perhaps we'll fare better next time. Thanks, $MyPCName$.
Exploring Kritias gets increasingly difficult by the day. How are you faring, $MyPCName$?
It's challenging, but I can handle it.

Good. I assumed someone with your experience would fare better than most of our soldiers. That being the case, I'm sure you won't mind running some routine testing exercises to prove you're still fit for active duty.
I'll assign you several basic missions. All you have to do is complete them.
Is that all?
Yes. Now, you may be inclined to rush, but I urge you to rest as needed. Save your strength for the real battles.
I need to you complete all of the missions I gave you to prove you're fit for active duty, but don't push yourself too hard. Save your strength for the real battles.
Well, you've set a fine example for our other soldiers.
It was tough, but I was tougher.
It seems you're even stronger than I thought.
Well done, $MyPCName$. Now we can get you back out into the field.
$MyPCName$, thanks to you, we get closer to the heart of Kritias every day. Unfortunately, that also means it's getting more dangerous every day.
We need to be more vigilant than ever.
Agreed. And now that we've discovered so many new regions, we have another problem. We know nothing about the local wildlife or the threat it might present to us.
Sounds like you need me to do some investigating.

I do. I want you to find out everything there is to know about $npcNamePlural:25021205$ in the $map:02020017$, $npcNamePlural:25021305[gender:0]$ in $map:02020033$, and $npcNamePlural:25021104$ in the $map:02020051$.

Find out everything there is to know about $npcNamePlural:25021205$ in the $map:02020017$, $npcNamePlural:25021305[gender:0]$ in $map:02020033$, and $npcNamePlural:25021104$ in the $map:02020051$. I don't want any unpleasant surprises just because we didn't do our research.
What did you learn? Are there any serious threats we need to be concerned about?
They seem like run-of-the-mill beasties to me.
That's good to hear. Now stay on your toes. I'll speak with you again soon.
$MyPCName$, you've been setting a shining example for all of our other soldiers.
To be honest, this test is probably unnecessary for you considering all the missions you've been running. But you can never be too careful.
Oh. For a moment, I thought you'd say I could skip it.
Nevermind! Let's do that test!
Yes. Let's.
And keep in mind this will be on record.
All set? Let's take a look at the report.
I'm sure I passed with flying colors.
Indeed. You performed admirably.
I hope to see similar results from you in the future.
$MyPCName$, I've been hearing some unsettling rumors that $npcName:23090006[gender:0]$ is still alive.
No... It can't be...
I know it sounds far fetched, but we have to be sure. And I'd like to squash these rumors before they start to affect morale.
I need you to investigate the rumors, so we can lay this beast to rest for good this time. Go to $map:02020017$ and keep a wary eye out for anything suspicious.
Come back soon. Our troops are uneasy enough as it is.
What did you discover?
You could have warned me about $npcName:23090006[gender:0]$'s ghost.
So the rumors were true?!
Sure, I guess. You sort of forgot to give me the details, so...
Hm, well whatever the threat, we need to make sure it's gone. I won't stand for anything threatening the safety of Sky Fortress while we're here.
$MyPCName$! You're not a moment to soon.
Why? What's wrong?
We've received an urgent request for help from Humanitas.
They recently gained control of $map:02020033$, but almost as soon as they did, the Tairen led a vicious attack against them. Now they're trapped without food or equipment.
They desperately need your help to fend off the attack. Go to $map:02020033$ right away and help defeat the Tairen soldiers there.
Go to $map:02020033$ right away and help Humanitas defeat the Tairen soldiers there.
I've received word from Humanitas. They're out of danger thanks to you.
For now, yes, but I don't think this is over.
Doubtless. Tairen will be bitter about losing such a strategically advantageous location to Humanitas.
I'll check in on them occasionally.
That's a good idea. Thank you.
Now that we discovered a new region, there's more to study than ever. But after the last few nightmares I sent our research team, they're not exactly in a helpful mood.
If you sent me a pack of vicious beasts, I don't think I would be either.
Yes... Well... I figured we could give them a break this time by sending a more docile test subject. You know, something four-legged, possibly furry, and impossibly cute?
It's worth a shot.
I'm glad you think so, because I want you to retrieve it. You'll have the best chance of finding what I need in $map:02020008$, so head that way and see what you can do.
I want you to retrieve our new, cuddly research subject. You'll have the best chance of finding what I need in $map:02020008$, so head that way and see what you can do.
How did you do?
These $itemPlural:61000167$ seemed to fit your description. Take a look.
Kyuuu!
Kyuuu kuu!
OH! THEY'RE ADORA— Ahem! I mean... Well done, $MyPCName$. If this doesn't win back my research team's favor, nothing will.
$MyPCName$, I've already got another assignment for you. The $npcNamePlural:25021401$ population in $map:02020014$ has gotten out of control, and they've started acting very strangely.
What kind of strange are we talking here?
They keep ramming the trees until there's nothing left but stumps.
A lot of our people depend on the fruit from those trees for food, so we can't afford to let the $npcNamePlural:25021401$ keep destroying them.
So what can I do to help?
Go to $map:02020014$ and thin the $npcName:25021401$ population. Maybe they'll calm down once they feel less cramped.
Go to $map:02020014$ and thin the $npcName:25021401$ population. Maybe they'll calm down once they feel less cramped.
How did it go?
A few of the trees were badly damaged, but the rest should be fine now.
Then I'm glad we took care of the problem early on. Thank you.
$MyPCName$, have you visited $map:02020014$ yet?
Many of our people find peace among the beautiful plants there. Unfortunately, Tairen soldiers have taken notice and seek to deprive us of that respite by invading it.
$map:02020014$ is critical for morale. We can't let them have it. Defeat $npcNamePlural:25021406[gender:0]$ and ensure our refuge remains safe from those who would destroy it.
$map:02020014$ is critical for morale. We can't let them have it. Defeat $npcNamePlural:25021406[gender:0]$ and ensure our refuge remains safe from those who would destroy it.
The Tairen soldiers have withdrawn. This is was an important victory.
I only worry that this isn't the last we've seen of them.
True. But I'm sure you'll handle it just as well the next time.
Of course.
Thank you. Now get some rest. Your next mission is right around the corner.
Humanitas has be struggling to recapture the $map:02020003$, but between Kharon, Tairen, and the Daemon Army, they're fighting a losing battle. As their allies, it's time for Sky Fortress to step in.
But it's about more than fighting alongside our allies. We stand to gain a lot of ground in Kritias if Humanitas gains control of that region. That means more information and more resources.
So where do I come in?
I'm sending you to the $map:02020003$ to help take out $npcNamePlural:25021501$. With them out of the way, Humanitas might just have a shot.
Go to the $map:02020003$ and help take out $npcNamePlural:25021501$. With them out of the way, Humanitas might just have a shot.
How did you fare against the Daemon Army?
We did our best.
Good. Then I think Humanitas will be all right for a while. I'll update you if things change.
It's good to see you, $MyPCName$. I was just thinking you'd be the perfect person to help me solve a little problem.
One of my scouts reported seeing $npcNamePlural:25021201$ in the $map:02020017$. What's got my interest piqued is their tremendous strength.
I'd like to figure out how they're capable of such strength and use it to Sky Fortress's advantage. That means I need your boots on the ground out there to collect some spare parts for me.
Go to $map:02020017$, destroy $npcNamePlural:25021201$, and collect $itemPlural:30001228$.
Go to $map:02020017$, destroy $npcNamePlural:25021201$, and collect $itemPlural:30001228$.
I'm glad to see you could collect the parts without damaging them.
I'll get these to the research team immediately. Thanks, $MyPCName$.
$MyPCName$, we've had a big win. Humanitas took control of $map:02020033$ in one, swift, coordinated strike.
But Tairen is relentless. They've sent wave after wave of soldiers against Humanitas and managed to cut them off from all resources. It's only a matter of time before our allies fall.
What if we drove some of the enemy forces out of the region?
I'm hoping we can do exactly that. Head to $map:02020033$ and defeat as many $npcNamePlural:25021301[gender:0]$ as you can. That ought to give Humanitas a fighting chance.
Head to $map:02020033$ and defeat as many $npcNamePlural:25021301[gender:0]$ as you can. That ought to give Humanitas a fighting chance.
Did you drive the $npcNamePlural:25021301[gender:0]$ out of $map:02020033$?
Every last one of them, yes. They won't be a problem for a while.
Excellent. I'll keep an eye on the area and let you know if things change.
We've finally penetrated far enough into Kritias to discover the nastiest problem yet.
What is it?

The $map:02020051$. It exists solely as a waste disposal site for all of Tairen's most destructive mechs. Even thinking about the disgusting stench in that place is enough to make me—hrk! Ugh. See what I mean?
Anyway, I've asked our research team what we can do to prevent any more of our people from losing their lunch, and they've come up with a solution.
If we destroy some of the $npcNamePlural:25021101$ in the area, they won't be able to dump any more... waste, and the—hrk—the smell might dissipate.
We have to look out for our people's health. Go to $map:02020051$ and destroy as many $npcNamePlural:25021101$ as you can.
Go to the $map:02020051$ and destroy as many $npcNamePlural:25021101$ as you can.
Our research team is reporting vastly improved air quality in the $map:02020051$.
You made a huge difference. Next time we need help, I'll let you know.
$MyPCName$, our $npcName:25021402$ woes never seem to end. The $map:02020014$ has been overrun.
Again?!
They're everywhere, and they're crushing every living thing in sight. If this continues much longer, there won't be anything left of our beautiful, lush refuge.
Please go to $map:02020014$ right away and chase the $npcNamePlural:25021402$ out of there.
Please go to $map:02020014$ right away and chase the $npcNamePlural:25021402$ out of there.
Have you cleared $map:02020014$ of that menace?
Those adorable little miscreants won't be bothering you for a while.
Good job. Why don't you rest up, so you're ready for your next mission?
Hm... I've been thinking a lot about Kharon lately.
What about them?
Well, for a band of exiles who left with little more than the clothes on their backs, they're surprisingly well organized. I want to know how they're communicating.

I doubt they managed to steal Tairen technology, which means they must be using an analog system. It may be as simple as written messages. If we could intercept even one, we might gain more insight into how the organization functions.
So here's what I need you to do. Go to the $map:02020003$, defeat $npcNamePlural:25021502$, and get their documents.
Go to the $map:02020003$, defeat $npcNamePlural:25021502$, and get their documents.
Did you get the Kharon documents I need?
Here they are!
This is exactly what we need. Well done!
$MyPCName$, we could use your help. Humanitas took control of $map:02020033$, and they've managed to hold it for a while, but they may not have it much longer.
Our enemies just mobilized newer, much stronger $npcNamePlural:25021302[gender:0]$. If $map:02020033$ falls, we'll lose a crucial foothold in Kritias.
No. I refuse to let that happen.
I thought so. In that case, go to $map:02020033$ right away and help fight back the $npcNamePlural:25021302[gender:0]$ there.
Go to $map:02020033$ right away and help fight back the $npcNamePlural:25021302[gender:0]$ there.
Another victory for Sky Fortress and Humanitas. Well done.
The next time they need support, I'll be sure to call on you.
Hello, $MyPCName$. I'm glad you're here!
Let me guess. It's time for another round of routine fitness tests courtesy of Sky Fortress?
I don't know how you knew that, but... Yes!
Bring it on! I'm ready to test my limits!
You want to test your limits? In that case, why don't we run you through hell mode difficulty?
Do your best. I want to know exacly how capable our soldiers are.
You're practically inhuman. Are you aware of that?
I guess I'll have to prepare something even more challenging for you next time!
Despite our best efforts to quell them, I'm still hearing rumors about $npcName:23090006[gender:0]$. He's terrorizing our troops.
I'll get to the bottom of this if it's the last thing I do!
I had a feeling you'd say that. Go to the $map:02020017$ and see if you can beat that ghost back into oblivion where it belongs.
Go to the $map:02020017$ and see if you can beat that ghost back into oblivion where it belongs.
You're white as a sheet! I take it you had another run in with $npcName:23090006[gender:0]$'s ghost?
Yep.
At least you took care of it. Just... keep it up, would you? Thanks.
Ready for your next Sky Fortress fitness test, $MyPCName$?
I had a feeling it was time for another test...
Well, by this point, I'm sure you know the drill, so I'll just leave you to it.
I certainly do! In fact, I could probably do this totally on my own.
You probably could.
Then I'll get started!
Good. I've got to handle some more pressing matters anyway.
Well done. You've got this down to a science now.
Keep up the good work, $MyPCName$.
It looks like I've got another assignment for you, this time out at the $map:02020009$.
From what Humanitas has told us, Tairen has been using the area to conduct ecological experiments for years. Now that they've handed control over to Kharon, it's ripe for the taking.
So they're asking for backup from Sky Fortress?
Exactly. I'm sending you out to help them.
Go to the $map:02020009$ and get rid of any enemies you find there.
Go to the $map:02020009$ and get rid of any enemies you find there.
Was the mission a success?
I did my best, but we've still got a long way to go.
I thought that might be the case. This is definitely going to be a long-term project for us. For now, well done.
$MyPCName$, thanks to you, we've expanded our territory even further.
One of the new regions we discovered, $map:02020018$, has some very interesting geological and atmospheric features.
