Unfortunately, control of the area is still hotly contested, and our scouts can't safely gather information. So I need you to go out there and get rid of some of the Tairen enemies first.
Of course.
Thanks. Focus on removing the soldiers from $map:02020018$ for now, and we can worry about the other territories later.
Focus on removing the soldiers from $map:02020018$ for now, and we can worry about the other territories later.
How did you fare in $map:02020018$? Is it safe to send in our scouts?
It's not completely clear, but your scouts should be able to hold their own now.
Well done. I'll give our scouts the green light.
The $map:02020009$ is still largely occupied by Kharon forces and has been for some time. But now one of our scouts reports seeing some new, unusual mechs there.
If those mechs are taking orders from Kharon, then we have a bigger problem than I initially thought.
You want me to check it out?
I do, yes. In addition, whether these new mechs are working for Kharon or not, they're still a threat to our safety. So while you're investigating, destroy as many of them as you can.
Go to the $map:02020009$ and figure out whether the $npcNamePlural:25021606$ are taking orders from Kharon, then destroy as many as you can.
Go to the $map:02020009$ and figure out whether the $npcNamePlural:25021606$ are taking orders from Kharon, then destroy as many as you can.
Is it as bad as I thought? Are the $npcNamePlural:25021606$ taking orders from Kharon?
No, it doesn't look like it.
That's a relief. One less problem to deal with. Thanks for looking into it.
Back again, $MyPCName$? I'm not sure I have any assignments for you...
You look sad... What's got you down?
Do I? Hm, I didn't think it showed. This expedition has been going on for so long that I think I'm just feeling a little homesick for my friends and family.
Is there something I can do to cheer you up?
I'd be happy to bring in a cuddly, new research subject!
Oh, would you?! The research team has been asking about studying the $itemPlural:61000169$ in $map:02020037$ for a while now. How about one of those?
You'll find a lot of $itemPlural:61000169$ over in $map:02020037$.
Here you go! This little guy really looked like he could use a friend!
Er... Maybe a simple cat would have been better...?
Not at all! I love him already! I'm sure the two of us will get along well! Thanks for looking out for me, $MyPCName$.
I'm glad you're here, $MyPCName$. We've got another problem on our hands.

$map:02020036$ truly lives up to its name. It's crawling with Daemon Army soldiers, the worst of which are the $npcNamePlural:25022001$. They don't just attack our people—they steal their equipment and supplies!

It's bad enough that they stole the emergency rations, but taking our morale-boosting, $item:30001230$ is just spiteful! We need support from someone with your experience. Go to $map:02020036$, defeat $npcNamePlural:25022001$, and take back what's ours!
Go to $map:02020036$, defeat $npcNamePlural:25022001$, and take back what's ours! We need that $item:30001230$.
I hope that stolen food turned to ash in their mouths when they saw you coming.
I didn't even give them the chance to taste it. I got what you asked for.
I expected no less of you, $MyPCName$. We'll make sure these get back into the right hands.
$MyPCName$! Finally someone I can trust with this mission! With all the chaos at the $map:02020009$, Kharon fighters are exploiting our weak points and harassing our soldiers to no end.
I'd be more than happy to provide a little backup.
I knew you would be. Like I said, the worst of the skirmishes are happening in and around the $map:02020009$.
We need to reduce their numbers, so they can't keep getting the drop on our people. Find the $npcNamePlural:25021601$ and take as many as you can out of the fight... permanently.
Find the $npcNamePlural:25021601$ in $map:02020009$ and take as many as you can out of the fight... permanently.
Our soldiers tell me you've solved our problem.
It won't last forever, but our people are grateful for what you've done. I'll let you know the next time they need help.
It's been a long and costly fight, but we've nearly reached the heart of Kritias.
It really has been a long time...
Yes. And now that we're so close, Tairen has sent reinforcements to stop us at $map:02020037$. If we want to make it any further, we need to get through there.
Our scouts are looking for a detour, but it's a long shot. And with so many enemies in the area, it's gotten far too dangerous.
Go to $map:02020037$, defeat $npcNamePlural:25022101$, and find another path our people can use to infiltrate Kritias.
Go to $map:02020037$, defeat $npcNamePlural:25022101$, and find another path our people can use to infiltrate Kritias.
Did you find a way to enter mainland Kritias?
No luck.
I'm sure we'll find a solution soon enough. Well done, $MyPCName$.
Perfect timing, $MyPCName$! Our scouts just discovered a major Tairen mech production facility.
Really?!

Yes! The $map:02020035$ is their largest facility, and we finally managed to locate it. Now is our chance to deal a massive blow to their offense. I need you on site right away to help weaken the protections around the building.
I won't disappoint you.
I knew I could count on you. This fight will be crucial. Go to $map:02020035$ and defeat $npcNamePlural:25021901$ before they realize we've found them.
Go to $map:02020035$ and defeat $npcNamePlural:25021901$ before they realize we've found them.
This was a massive success.
Thanks to you, our people have infiltrated the factory. They'll bring it to a grinding halt in no time.
$MyPCName$, you've been to $map:02020008$, right?

Well, whether you have or not, I have another animal assignment for you. We've received word of a $npcNamePlural:25021801$. As cute as those Wrigglers are, this particular one is causing some giant-sized headaches for our scouts.

I need to send someone with experience handling them, and you're that someone. Go to $map:02020008$ and defeat the $npcName:25021801$. Once you've done that, get $itemPlural:30001231$, so our researchers can figure out how this thing grew so big in the first place.
Go to $map:02020008$ and defeat the $npcName:25021801$. Once you've done that, get $itemPlural:30001231$, so our researchers can figure out how this thing grew so big in the first place.
These $itemPlural:30001231$ are pristine! Very well done.
I'll get these to our research team right away.
We have analyzed quite a few monsters during our time in Kritias, but it's only a fraction of what's out there.

Take $npcNamePlural:25021701$, for example. Their hides are a remarkable shade of blue, but we have no idea what purpose a good paint job serves in $map:02020018$. Is it something Sky Fortress can use to its advantage or is it just a Tyrano fashion trend?
I would like you to bring back data for analysis. Go to $map:02020018$, defeat $npcNamePlural:25021701$, and collect $itemPlural:30001232$ for our research team.
Go to $map:02020018$, defeat $npcNamePlural:25021701$, and collect $itemPlural:30001232$ for our research team.
You've brought back another pristine specimen for our research team.
I never regret trusting you with a mission. Thanks, $MyPCName$.
We defeat more of the Kharon forces every day, but somehow they keep finding ways to make 5 enemies feel like 500.
Some of the Sky Fortress fighters we recently dispatched to $map:02020009$ have suffered heavy losses. That place is crawling with $npcNamePlural:25021602$.

We just can't compete with the range on their grenade launchers. But I'm sure you can handle them easily. Go to $map:02020009$ and take out the $npcNamePlural:25021602$, so our people have a chance to do some damage of their own.
Go to $map:02020009$ and take out the $npcNamePlural:25021602$, so our people have a chance to do some damage of their own.
How did you fare against the Kharon forces?
They may be robots, but I managed to instill a healthy fear of Sky Fortress in them.
I had no doubt you'd succeed. Well done. And get some rest. You've earned it.
As long as the Daemon army occupies $map:02020036$, they'll be a permanent thorn in Sky Fortress's side. It's time we did something about it.
Just point me in the right direction!

First things first. We need to cut down the number of patrols they have roaming the area. Rather than send a unit there and start a full-scale battle, I'd like to send you in to do some quick work in the shadows.
Go to $map:02020036$ and defeat as many $npcNamePlural:25022002$ as you can. That ought to slow them down enough for our soldiers to finish them off for good.
Go to $map:02020036$ and defeat as many $npcNamePlural:25022002$ as you can. That ought to slow them down enough for our soldiers to finish them off for good.
I'm glad you made it back. And none the worse for wear, I see.
Good. It won't be long before $map:02020036$ is fully within our control.
You've kept me waiting, $MyPCName$.
It is once again time to test the abilities of all Sky Fortress agents.
As you are not above this requirement, I thought that Kritias would make an excellent testing ground for you.
This mission will push you to your very limits. Do not underestimate this.
I do not want to see you relax or attempt shortcuts! I will watch you like a hawk.
Hm... It seems that I have underestimated your abilities.
This was but one test. The next one will be harder.
$map:02020030$, $map:02020029$, and $map:02020031$ are under attack by Tairen's mechanical soldiers.
Perhaps they tire of this war and seek to end both ourselves and Humanitas in one fell swoop.
Defeat Tairen's mechanical monstrosities at these locations.
Defeat the mechanical soldiers in $map:02020030$, $map:02020029$, and $map:02020031$.
Good job.
You passed your last test with ease, even though the conditions were unfamiliar to you.
But that was merely the beginning. You are aware of this, are you not?
This test will put you through the wringer, as they say.
Now, go complete your mission.
Once again, you pass the test as if it were nothing.
I expected no less, of course. You've acclimated to this land in record time.
I look forward to your next test.
$map:02020030$ is under attack from demons, both mechanical and otherwise.
Though their reasons no doubt vary, both Tairen and the Daemon Army want $map:02020030$ for their own.
If $map:02020030$ falls, so falls Humanitas. Go forth and defeat these monstrosities.
If $map:02020030$ falls, so falls Humanitas. Go forth and defeat these monstrosities.
I have dreamed of this moment.
You faced two great and terrible armies. How did you fare?
It was no problem.
I have chosen my disciple well.
Do you recall the dropship you used to arrive here from Sky Fortress?
It's still in $map:02020029$. Do you know that?
I know all about it!
We sent people to retrieve the dropship, but the local monsters won't let them.
The $npcNamePlural:25020004$, in particular, are proving to be a hindrance.
I ask that you ensure the safe recovery of the dropship.
You must make haste or the dropship will be lost forever.
I sense that the $npcNamePlural:25020004$' numbers have decreased significantly.
We shall retrieve the dropship in short order.
The $npcNamePlural:25020104$ of $map:02020030$... It is said that they overflow with fearsomely dark power.
Indeed, darkness billows out from their robes. Such concentrated darkness must have a unique source.
Defeat $npcNamePlural:25020104$ in $map:02020030$ and uncover the source of their power.
I do not care to wait overlong. Defeat $npcNamePlural:25020104$ in $map:02020030$ and uncover the source of their power.
Have you discovered the source of their dark power?
Yeah. They had these crystals...
A $item:30001233$... Fascinating.
Well done. I shall investigate this for myself...
Even I must admit that Tairen's technology is impressive. Their machines are powered by pure aetherine.
In fact, I sense that aetherine touches all of the civilizations of Kritias, past and present. Even the mages use aetherine to empower their spells.
I would learn more of this aetherine. Gather samples for me in $map:02020029$, $map:02020030$, and $map:02020031$.
Unless I've had a lapse in my memory, I've tasked you with gathering aetherine.
This meager quantity shall suffice... for now.
I shall send you to collect more in due time. Farewell.
$map:52100104$ in $map:02020031$ is occupied by the Daemon Army. They did not win this foothold by strength of arms, however. Instead, they somehow turned Tairen's machines to their side.
According to Humanitas scouts, the mechanical soldiers joined the Daemon Army as soon as $npcName:11001813[gender:0]$ set his gaze upon them.
Dismantle these $npcNamePlural:25020204$ and uncover what caused them to betray their side.
Dismantle the $npcNamePlural:25020204$ and uncover what caused them to betray their side.
Tell me what you've learned.
I fought the $npcNamePlural:25020204$, but I have no idea why they switched sides.
I see. I shall set my Lumiknights to this task, then. Thank you for your efforts.
You heeded my telepathic call! It seems that something about Kritias has strengthened our mental bond.
Yeah, sure. What do you need?
Have you encountered the $npcNamePlural:25020005$ of $map:02020029$? They are, as my cohorts put it, "adorable." They are unfortunately also quite vicious.
Unfortunately, my own templars were deceived by the creatures' appeal and allowed themselves to be injured. Such a thing would never happen to me!
You don't say.
The honor of the Lumiknights is besmirched. Travel now to $map:02020029$ and... unsmirch it.
Shouldn't an actual Lumiknight—
Need I repeat myself?
I'm going.
Go to $map:02020029$ and vanquish the $npcNamePlural:25020005$.
Go to $map:02020029$ and vanquish the $npcNamePlural:25020005$.
Did you get my point across?
I doubt the $npcNamePlural:25020005$ will cause any trouble now.
Very good. All the same, I shall warn my subordinates to take care with those beasts...
I've been waiting for you.
Is something wrong?
$npcNamePlural:25020105$ attacked one of our teams in $map:02020030$.
They must be defeated before they strike again.
Go to $map:02020030$ and defeat $npcNamePlural:25020105$.
I trust your work went smoothly.
There were no problems.
As expected. I'll call upon you again soon.
It is good that you're here. I have a request for you.
What is it?
The $npcNamePlural:25020205$ in $map:02020031$ have stolen data from our research teams.
I understand that it has something to do with the topography of Kritias. Ah, the researchers worked so terribly hard for that data! I shed a tear for them.
I don't see any tears.
Defeat them and retrieve the data.
Defeat $npcNamePlural:25020205$ and retrieve the data.
Good job.
Is the stolen data safe?
It is.
Good. Our researchers can finally be at ease.
Ah, $MyPCName$.
What's wrong?
You've noticed the darkness building within me. Well done.
What is it?
We have discovered mechanical soldiers in league with the Daemon Army in $map:02020029$. I must learn what makes them move...
As you may have surmised, you will be the instrument of my discovery.
Defeat $npcNamePlural:25020001$ and retrieve their power sources.
Defeat $npcNamePlural:25020001$ and retrieve their power sources.
How long I have waited for this!
Do you have the source of their power?
<font color="#909090">(Show him the aetherine crystals.)</font>
This...!
If the Daemon Army has also mastered aetherine... This bears further investigation.
I'm glad you came by. My telepathy has poor reception today, so to speak.
And why might that be?
$npcNamePlural:25020201$ in $map:02020031$ are jamming our radio signals. It seems that even my telepathy is affected.
Progress will be slow if we have no reliable means of communication. Can I trust you to go to $map:02020031$ and defeat them?
Leave it to me.
Then I leave it to you.
Go to $map:02020031$ and defeat $npcNamePlural:25020201$.
I'm already aware of your performance. My telepathy has returned, you see.
Our communications should be secure for the foreseeable future, thanks to you.
Tairen's machine soldiers are said to run on aetherine.
I know all about it!
And every civilization of Kritias has used aetherine.
I know about that, too.
And that's why we need to continue our research on aetherine. I ask that you collect some.
Have you gathered the aetherine yet?
This is not much, but I suppose it will have to suffice for now.
Thank you. I'll send for you when I have more work.
Oh, you're back.
I see a lot of medics today.
$npcNamePlural:25020104$ launched an attack against our people in $map:02020030$. The injured have just now arrived.
I will avenge our fallen comrades!
Yes! Channel your righteous fury! Defeat these fiends before they can cause more harm!
Go to $map:02020030$ and defeat $npcNamePlural:25020104$.
I've received a report of your success on the battlefield. Well done.
I shall call upon you again soon.
You passed your last test with ease, even though the conditions were unfamiliar to you.
I have no choice but to acknowledge your abilities. That is why this test will be even greater than the last.
Go, complete your missions! But if you truly wish to impress me, you will do it while wearing a blindfold.
Good luck.
Now, go complete your mission.
In spite of your past success, I am still surprised.
I shall devise something truly devious for your next test. You have been warned.
Ah, $MyPCName$.
Is it just me, or are the monsters extra feisty today?
I cannot blame them. They've been driven from their natural habitat by Tairen's tyranny.
They only grow more vicious with each passing day. It's a problem for our field researchers.
Between the monsters and the mechanical soldiers... I tire of these intrusions on our work!
There is only one solution to our problems. $MyPCName$, you will be my blade! Visit my righteous fury on any monster who would meddle with us!
I leave it to you.
Defeat the monsters! Defeat the soldiers! Defeat them all!
It seems things have calmed down a bit.
Good job.
It is once again time to test the abilities of all Sky Fortress agents.
A mission truly worthy of your skills awaits you.
I'm pitting you against the worst that Kritias has to offer. There is no shame in giving up now if you fear for your life.
Now, go complete your mission.
Just as I expected.
Thank you for once again showing me your skills.
I've uncovered a mysterious phenomenon.
$map:02020001$ is a place of great beauty upon which the aurora shine. But this aurora has an affect on the monsters who live there.
The $npcNamePlural:25020504$, particularly, are gluttons for this aurora energy. It seems that the energy is condensed within their bodies.
This bears further investigation. Go to $map:02020001$ and tear the $itemPlural:30001236$ from their bodies so that I may study it.
My patience has its limits, my friend. Go to $map:02020001$ and tear the $itemPlural:30001236$ from their bodies so that I may study it.
I trust you were successful?
Here's the $item:30001236$.
So this is $item:30001236$...?
The light that it gives off... Intriguing. Very intriguing!
Our people exploring $map:02020006$ were ambushed by monsters and badly hurt. It seems that the Daemon Army has tainted the monsters of the area.
Their dark power is no trifling matter. We must keep it contained before it spreads further.
Defeat the monsters in $map:02020006$.
Good job.
$map:02020004$ is currently held by Tairen.
Our people are under constant threat of attack. Particularly dangerous is a pack of soldiers wielding blades.
The must be defeated if we are going to gain a foothold in $map:02020004$.
The blade-wielding soldiers must be defeated if we are going to gain a foothold in $map:02020004$.
I've already heard of your success.
It seems you impressed our field agents. Good work.
Do you know of the $npcNamePlural:25020502$?
It is said that their necklaces glow with a mysterious light.
I wish to examine the gemstones in their necklaces. Could you get them for me?
Go to $map:02020001$, defeat them, and get their $itemPlural:30001237$.
Are you done yet? Go to $map:02020001$, defeat them, and get their $itemPlural:30001237$.
Where are the $itemPlural:30001237$?
Here are the $itemPlural:30001237$.
Oh, that light really is mysterious. Well done.
Ah, $MyPCName$.
Everyone looks busy today.
Ah... A group of $npcNamePlural:25020405[gender:0]$ attacked some of our scouts in $map:02020004$ and stole their data.
That data contained vital intelligence on Kritias...
I'll get it back for you!
Very good! Defeat the $npcNamePlural:25020405[gender:0]$ and retrieve the data.
Defeat the $npcNamePlural:25020405[gender:0]$ and retrieve the data.
I'm astonished they were able to steal so much... Good job.
I'll ask for your help if something like this happens again.
There you are.
Our aetherine research is progressing too slowly. The team has requested more samples...
The aetherine in $map:02020004$ is more concentrated. I think that should yield some useful samples.
Fine. I'll go.
You are shrewd. I'll be waiting.
Are you done yet? Get as much aetherine as possible.
Such an abundance of aetherine! I feel as though I were rich.
I shall call upon you again soon.
There you are.
Have you encountered the $npcNamePlural:25020505$? The growths on their backs look like aetherine.
I ordered some of my agents to retrieve samples, but the monsters were uncooperative with our attempts.
I would like you to get samples from the $npcNamePlural:25020505$ by force.
I will continue to wait for you here.
Get samples from the $npcNamePlural:25020505$ by force.
It seems you've made things easier for our researchers.
Well done. I'll call upon you again soon.
Ah, $MyPCName$.
The medics look busy today.
A patrol drew too close to some cute $npcNamePlural:25020304$. Predictably, they were all grievously injured.
I cannot trust my own people to stay away from those adorable menaces. The only recourse is to destroy them all.
Go to $map:02020006$ and defeat $npcNamePlural:25020304$.
Go to $map:02020006$ and defeat $npcNamePlural:25020304$.
I trust you were successful?
I sent those little cuties to the afterlife.
I am glad you did not waver. Good job.
Our forces at $map:02020004$ have been halted by $npcNamePlural:25020405[gender:0]$.
I fear that our people are helpless against the enemy's powerful swords.
Go to $map:02020004$ and defeat $npcNamePlural:25020405[gender:0]$.
Go to $map:02020004$ and defeat $npcNamePlural:25020405[gender:0]$.
As your reward, I shall grant onto you a fraction of my aura.
Ah, you're here.
I worry for about the slow progress we're making on our aetherine research. It seems the research team never has enough samples.
It seems we've discovered a rich vein in $map:02020001$. Could I ask you to gather some samples?
I'll take care of it.
I will continue to wait for you here.
I ask that you bring aetherine.
Only one sample today?
It shall suffice for now. Return soon for more tasks.
Would you believe that I still have yet to hear of any results of our aetherine research?
I want results, but the research team insists that they need aetherine samples from $map:02020006$.
Gather aetherine from $map:02020006$.
It is vital that we learn the true nature of aetherine.
Gather aetherine from $map:02020006$.
You've brought me only one sample. Well, I suppose I should have expected this.
Well done. I'll call upon you again soon.
Ah, you've arrived.
I saw some poisoned Sky Fortress agents.
Indeed. With each passing day, more of our compatriots are poisoned by $npcNamePlural:25020305$.
I've received reports that even the local ecology is being affected by these monsters. It would be best to go to $map:02020006$ and defeat them.
I leave it to you.
I fear for our compatriots. Go to $map:02020006$ and defeat the monsters who threaten them.
Fewer of our people are being poisoned now.
On behalf of the Lumiknights, thank you.
I see you.
You look different today.
Ah, you've noticed that the dragon within me is stirring from its slumber. Do you fear that I cannot control it?
I will require some time alone to calm it. In the meantime, I shall assign you your test.
Normally I would complete such a task with my eyes closed. For today, I entrust it to you.
Complete your test while I pacify the dragon within me.
I heard of your progress while I was centering my balance.
Your performance was satisfactory. Good job.
I received a report that $npcName:11001813[gender:0]$'s lackey, $npcName:23000301$, is attempting to summon $npcName:23000071$.
If $npcName:23000071$ is summoned here in Kritias, I may need to intervene personally.

This is tough. If I were forced to use my full power, the whole world would be in danger. $MyPCName$, go to $map:02020200$ in my place, and defeat $npcName:23000301$ before he can succeed in his plot.
Go to $map:02020200$ in my place, and defeat $npcName:23000301$ before he can succeed in his plot.
Well done, $MyPCName$.
This cannot have been an easy mission. I shall call upon you the next time the world is in danger.
Today's test will be less strenuously than usual. I believe you've earned a little rest.
However, do not let your guard down! This is still a test by me, $npcName:11004316[gender:0]$!
I can feel your skills improve. I look forward to your future accomplishments.
I'll say this again. Don't let your guard down.
I see this posed you no challenge, as expected.
I hope your future tests go as smoothly as this.
Today's mission is of vital importance.
$map:02020010$ is a major Tairen base. From there, they're poised to drive Humanitas out of Kidel.
It has been decided that we will launch an assault on $map:02020010$. However, the enemy's defenses are formidable.
Go to $map:02020010$ and act as our vanguard. Destroy the enemy's first line of defense.
Go to $map:02020010$ and act as our vanguard. Destroy the enemy's first line of defense.
That was a mighty battle!
On behalf of the Lumiknights, I thank you for leading the charge.
I will ask for your service again.
$map:02020034$ is a vital part of Tairen's aetherine infrastructure.
From their war machines to their everyday appliances, Tairen is completely reliant on aetherine.
As it happens, Tairen makes life hard for both ourselves and Humanitas.
Their aetherine plant in Kidel is what keeps their front lines supplied and fresh for the fight.
We're in no position to destroy it. But if we can throw their garrison there into disarray, then perhaps someday we'll be ready to launch a final offensive.
Go to $map:02020034$ and defeat their soldiers.
Go to $map:02020034$ and defeat their soldiers.
Thank you for once again showing me your skills.
Among Tairen's machines, the $npcNamePlural:25020807$ have some of the strongest arms.
My researchers report that they can't identify the material that their weapons are made from. We've determined that they're heavy... and that the $npcNamePlural:25020807$ can swing them with ease.
They need more data to fully understand these weapons.
Combat observation should suffice. Fight $npcNamePlural:25020807$ while our researchers watch.
Fight $npcNamePlural:25020807$ while our researchers watch.
Thank you for once again showing me your skills.
I have another request for aetherine samples from the research team.
This time, they need aetherine from $map:02020034$, $map:02020010$, and $map:02020013$.
One never knows how different environment might affect the aetherine.
I will continue to wait for you here.
The research team needs aetherine from $map:02020034$, $map:02020010$, and $map:02020013$.
This aetherine is unlike any other that I've encountered.
Well done.
Kharon! The lowest scum among all of Tairen's exiles.
Aren't we allied with some of those exiles?
Certainly, but not all exiles are created equally. Kharon are vile criminals who use their strength to bully the weak.
They capture innocent exiles and put them to work.
Exiles turning against exiles? They have no honor!
Such injustice!
Yes. I cannot let this stand.
Let us make an example of them.
Punish Kharon for their cruelty!
Has Kharon been properly reeducated?
They should be quiet for a while.
You truly are an implement of justice.
Have you heard the dire news?
Kharon has gained a foothold in $map:02020010$.
If left unchecked, they will become a great threat to Sky Fortress.
We must to defeat them quickly. Vanquish $npcNamePlural:25020603$.
Go to $map:02020010$ and vanquish $npcNamePlural:25020603$.
How did it go?
They were pretty wild fighters...
As expected... We will have to redouble our efforts to keep them at bay.
No matter how I push them, the research team produces no results. They only produce more requests for aetherine.
I've lately sensed a strange energy coming from $map:02020034$. I suspect that the aetherine there will finally give us a breakthrough.
$MyPCName$, collect the aetherine in $map:02020034$.
$MyPCName$, collect the aetherine in $map:02020034$.
This is a suitable amount. Good job.
The Lumiknights will study it carefully.
Ah, you've arrived.
I saw some of our people get carried off to the infirmary...
Ah, yes. The team from $map:02020034$. It seems that they were ambushed by bow-wielding $npcNamePlural:25020803$.
Defeat them to prevent more of our people from falling to their arrows.
Go to $map:02020034$ and defeat $npcNamePlural:25020803$.
Were you successful?
I sure was.
That's a relief. Thank you, $MyPCName$.
Our scouts in $map:02020032$ were bitten by $npcNamePlural:25020703$.
The bites are unlike any we've seen before. We need to study the hounds' fangs to come up with a treatment.
Collect their teeth.
Go to $map:02020032$ and collect fangs from $npcNamePlural:25020703$.
Hmm... These fangs are unlike any I've seen on Maple World.
Good job, $MyPCName$. We will analyze this very closely.
$map:02020013$ is the main route that Humanitas uses to send us supplies.
Unfortunately, $npcNamePlural:25020903$ have taken to attacking our caravans.
Defeat $npcNamePlural:25020903$ and secure the supply route.
Defeat $npcNamePlural:25020903$ and secure the supply route.
Thank you, $MyPCName$. There won't be problems with our supplies now.
Our research on aetherine progresses ever onward. And yet, we never seem to make any breakthroughs...
The aetherine in $map:02020013$ seems to have unique properties. Perhaps we'll have new results with some samples of that.
It is vital that we learn the true nature of aetherine.
Unless I've had a lapse in my memory, I've tasked you with gathering aetherine.
This sample seems... unremarkable.
The Lumiknights will study it carefully.
Kharon forces are plundering the ruins of $map:02020016$.
$map:02020016$ is a key historical site!
Any civilized person has a duty to protect history. Even if it isn't his own history...
If you agree, move swiftly to defeat the $npcNamePlural:25021003$ who are leading these vile efforts.
Defeat $npcNamePlural:25021003$ in $map:02020016$.
Has Kharon quieted down?
History is safe. For now.
That's what I'd hoped to hear. Well done.
$MyPCName$?
What is it?
I feel that you are not applying yourself as much as you could. But perhaps I'm imagining things. What do you think?
Uh... Excuse me?
Kritias is a dangerous land. This is no time to rest on your laurels.
Your skills must be constantly honed and tested. It won't be easy, of course!
Your skills must be constantly honed and tested. It won't be easy, of course!
Ah, now this is the $MyPCName$ that I know and respect.
See to it that you do not become careless again.
Hey! You, uh, don't look so good.
Enemies at every corner, lurking in every shadow... A constant stream of casualties in from the field...
We are simply trying to study this land, but we are met with nothing but hostility!
I'll take care of the bad guys for you.
$MyPCName$... Did you read my mind?
Defeat $npcNamePlural:25021105$, $npcNamePlural:25021405$, and $npcNamePlural:25021505$ in $map:02020051$, $map:02020014$, and $map:02020003$.
Defeat $npcNamePlural:25021105$, $npcNamePlural:25021405$, and $npcNamePlural:25021505$ in $map:02020051$, $map:02020014$, and $map:02020003$.
So, you've returned.
My templars have asked me to thank you for your efforts.
Good job. I shall call upon you when next my worries grow too great.
It seems that you've got a following among the Sky Fortress crew.
Would you mind elaborating?
Many of our people have thrown themselves fully into exploration after seeing your valiant efforts.
For that reason, I urge you to take on more missions. Build more of a following!
To that end, let us begin today's test.
That was some build-up...
Now, go complete your mission.
You've lit the fire of enthusiasm in the hearts of the crew!
We should do this again soon.
There you are.
Everyone seems more nervous than usual.
$npcName:11001813[gender:0]$'s lackey, $npcName:23000301$, has returned. He is once more corrupting the land with his darkness.
We thought we had seen the last of him... His return is not good for morale.
I'll put him down again.
That is a good idea. Go to $map:02020200$ and defeat $npcName:23000301$.
Not done yet? Go to $map:02020200$ and defeat $npcName:23000301$.
You have successfully halted the spread of darkness.
Our agents can take a breath of relief. Well done.
I will ask for your service again.
At last. You really must be more punctual, $MyPCName$.
The $map:02020051$ is quickly becoming a headache. The delicate and unique ecology of that place is being destroyed by a pack of strange monsters.
I sent a team out to investigate, but they can't do much with so many monsters about.
Things would go more smoothly if someone were to defeat those monsters. Perhaps that someone could be you.
I shall await your return.
Defeat the monsters at the $map:02020051$.
The monster problem seems to be under control. You're as reliable as always.
However, now the stench of the $map:02020051$ is giving me a headache... We shall have to postpone investigation until a later date.
Thank you.
There you are.
I must speak with you about the $npcNamePlural:25021205$ of the $map:02020017$.
What is it?
These heavily-armored machines use their tremendous power to defend the $map:02020017$.
However... their behavior has changed a bit lately. They've taken to attacking our scouts, even when they're well away from any critical areas.
The $map:02020017$ is worth investigating. Defeat them so that we may continue our research.
Defeat $npcNamePlural:25021205$ in $map:02020017$.
My agents have sent me the all clear. You've exceeded my expectations.
I'll ask for your help if this occurs again.
At last. You really must be more punctual, $MyPCName$.
Are you familiar with the $map:02020003$? There are ruins of ancient civilizations there. We have a duty to excavate the place.
For reasons unfathomable, Tairen's soldiers don't seem interested in us studying the history of their land. The $npcNamePlural:25021504$ are particularly bothersome.
Please defeat the $npcNamePlural:25021504$.
Please defeat the $npcNamePlural:25021504$.
With your help, we've been able to double our knowledge of the ruins in the $map:02020003$.
We are, once again, in your debt.
Ah, $MyPCName$. I was hoping to speak with you.
I saw some agents chatting about something...
Ah, they are gossiping about the $npcNamePlural:25021304$ at $map:02020033$. Though they are our enemies, they've taken to boasting about their great power.
They claim that the power comes from their hats. Absurd! And yet...
I'll go get some for you.
Yes. Yes, do that. Defeat $npcNamePlural:25021304$ in $map:02020033$ and take their hats.
Defeat $npcNamePlural:25021304$ in $map:02020033$ and take their hats.
Well? Do you have the hats?
Here are the $itemPlural:30001240$.
They contain aetherine batteries! How unexpected. I'll send this in for research straight away.
Oh, you're back.
You seem troubled.

There's much on my mind. They say that, in times of worry, one should view nature to alleviate one's stress. Such a pedestrian technique would have no effect on me, of course, but I understand it works for much of our crew.
The habitats of the $map:02020014$ provide a source of respite, for instance. Unfortunately, $npcNamePlural:25021407[gender:0]$ have made a mess of that place.
It's had a demoralizing effect on the crew, I'm afraid.
Perhaps you can help. Go to the $map:02020014$. Slay the $npcNamePlural:25021407[gender:0]$.
You may depart now.
Are you done yet? The $map:02020014$ is being destroyed as we speak.
Thank you, $MyPCName$. I think the crew is feeling a little better.
Perhaps I shall go to see these vistas for myself...
Good job. I shall call upon you again.
You didn't radio ahead of your visit today.
My radio was only picking up static.
Again...! It's the $npcNamePlural:25021204$. The aetherine that grows on their backs interferes with our signals.
Those little twerps! How am I supposed to eavesdrop on my favorite kittens without a functioning radio?!
...Let us pretend we did not hear that.
Anyway, the solution is clear. Destroy $npcNamePlural:25021204$ in the $map:02020017$.
Destroy $npcNamePlural:25021204$ in the $map:02020017$.
Our radios returned to normal a short while ago. I trust that means you were successful.
How's $npcName:11004314[gender:1]$ doing?
For better or for worse, she's return to her usual irrepressible self.
Ah, you're here.
I believe you are already familiar with the $map:02020051$. It's becoming a rather conspicuous thorn in our side, mainly because of the scrap robots and stench.
The stench is... somewhat manageable, but these scrap robots are not, as they've taken to attacking our people.
We've tried to monitor the area, but... well, I did mention the stench, didn't I?
Simply put, head to $map:02020051$ and defeat any $npcNamePlural:25021104$ you find.
Simply put, head to the $map:02020051$ and defeat any $npcNamePlural:25021104$ you find.
Good job.
I'm already hearing fewer complaints about the $npcNamePlural:25021104$. Now, if only you could beat up stenches...
Hm...
Should Sky Fortress be making that weird sound?

Ah, you noticed as well. Yes, apparently our frequent voyages between Maple World and Kritias has caused some kind of buckling in the bulkheads. The variance in atmospheric... I can see you glazing over already. Long story short, we need parts to effect repairs.
The engineers tell me that $npcNamePlural:25021105$ have the parts we need. You just need to... remove those parts.
Defeat $npcNamePlural:25021105$ in $map:02020051$ until you have the parts we need.
Defeat $npcNamePlural:25021105$ in the $map:02020051$ until you have the parts we need.
Good work, $MyPCName$. We'll get these to the engineers on the double... so that infernal racket will end.
Now maybe I can get back to my practice. I'll summon you again soon.
Oh, good. I have urgent need of you, $MyPCName$.
What is it?

Several of our people have fallen ill, and I've traced the pathology of the virus back to $npcNamePlural:25021405$. The vector can be found in the $map:02020014$, and needs to be eliminated immediately.
Bah! What a waste, coddling our soldiers over a little sniffle! In my day...
Your day was before the advent of germ theory. Here in the modern era, we battle diseases. $MyPCName$, if you would, please.
Rid us of $npcName:25021405$ in $map:02020014$. And wash your hands on the way back.
Has the virus been dealt with?
Every trace of the disease has been wiped out.
Excellent. Now I don't need to bother myself with making a vaccine...
Ah, you're here.
As you know, aetherine—
Aetherine is a mysterious and powerful substance widely used throughout Kritias. Studying it is one of our most important missions on the continent!
Ah... yes. Indeed. So, the particular—
In fact, I've already located a deposit at the $map:02020017$, and I came here to inform you about my plans to collect some for study!
...Well than. I leave it to you.
Please gather aetherine in $map:02020017$. As you said.
I should have expected this kind of initiative from you, $MyPCName$.
Well done. As expected, of course.
$MyPCName$, do you recall the Tairen soldiers that attacked our forces in $map:02020003$?
<font color='#909090">(You nod.)</font>
A class of Tairen soldiers known as $npcNamePlural:25021505$ is tearing through our soldiers. It seems as soon as one falls, another appears in their stead.
Well, all we can do is keep taking them down. Or rather, you. Defeat $npcNamePlural:25021505$ in $map:02020003$ before they wipe out our people.
Well, all we can do is keep taking them down. Or rather, you. Defeat $npcNamePlural:25021505$ in $map:02020003$ before they wipe out our people.
You're back. The results speak for themselves... injuries among the troops are at an all-time low.
Let us enjoy this lull while it lasts, $MyPCName$. Well done.
I'll need your service again.
Oh, you're back.
Testing is scheduled for today, but... I have concerns about the mission.
I have to wonder if you're up to the task...
(His concern is... genuine? Now you're feeling concerned.)
This is your chance. Carry out this nigh-impossible mission, and prove yourself as I did, so long ago.
I believe in you, $MyPCName$.
For anyone else, this would be impossible. But for you...
As expected. Even faced with so great a challenge, you pulled through.
With you so close to my level, I see I have little to worry about.
What is it?
Now is not the time. But soon... we shall talk.
At last. You really must be more punctual, $MyPCName$.
My blade thirsts for destruction, and it's all I can do to keep it in check. It's clearly reacting to the power of darkness.
Power of darkness?
$npcName:11001813[gender:0]$'s lackey $npcName:23000301$ continues to spread evil throughout the area. The effect is so strong that it can be felt even here.
That is why he needs to be put down once again. I cannot risk the destruction I would cause the world if I faced him, and so I leave him to you.
Go to $map:02020200$ and defeat $npcName:23000301$.
Thank you, $MyPCName$. I can feel my sword returning to its passive state. The threat of annihilation has passed, thanks to you.
Now I can meditate in peace.
I'll notify you if this happens again.
I... have to wonder if this test is even meaningful.
Why's that?
Isn't it obvious? After all the missions you've completed... what's left to prove?
However, if there's one force in this world that does not respond to such reason... it's bureaucracy.
So, get to it.
Good job, $MyPCName$. Perhaps these tests are worth the effort just to see your skills in action.
Your performance speaks for itself. As expected.
I can't imagine there's anything left for you to fear, $MyPCName$.
The attack on $map:02020036$, the heart of the Daemon Army of Kritias, is at last upon us.
I expect them to fight for their lives, considering how perilous their position is. And that means great danger for our own forces.
(Volunteer to strike at the Daemon Army first, to thin their numbers.)
You see the situation as a true tactician does. Excellent.
Go to $map:02020036$, and do what you can.
I feel the power of darkness ebbing from our foes. Yes, even from here. Don't question it.
The defenses of $map:02020036$ are failing. Our victory is at hand.
Our allies have reached the gates of the Tairen Kingdom, at $map:02020037$.
This is a critical moment in our campaign. To push into the Tairen Kingdom, we must break through $map:02020037$ with the Humanitas forces.
Naturally, the Tairen have amassed a sizable force to block us. And they are joined by elements of the Daemon Army.
(Volunteer to strike at the Tairen forces and Daemon Army.)
You're as motivated as ever. I leave this dreadfully important task in your capable hands.
Thin the Tairen forces and Daemon Army in $map:02020037$.
Good job.
Our scouts tell me the garrison at $map:02020037$ is a much softer target now.
Reaching the Tairen Kingdom is only a matter of time now.
Oh, you're back.
You look pretty sour today.
Very perceptive. Yes, there is a... cloud over my soul today.
Despite all our efforts, we are getting nowhere in aetherine research. The requests keep coming for more samples... I suppose they're trying a more intensive study.
I can get it.
It needs to be aetherine from a specific region again. The samples they require are found in $map:02020009$, $map:02020008$, and $map:02020018$.
We're fortunate to have your help, $MyPCName$. Good hunting.
Have you gathered the aetherine yet?
Surely this much aetherine will yield results.
If not... those researchers will have much to answer for.
Good job.
Ah, you're here.
We have important intel to act on. It's regarding a Tairen soldier called $npcName:25022102$ in $map:02020037$.
Apparently they've been logging all their activities in a notebook. This could be the break we need in Kritias.
Think of how much we stand to learn about Tairen's military capabilities! The possibilities are thrilling... and so we need that notebook.
Face the Tairen Guardsman and get his $item:30001242$.
You're back. Did you get the $item:30001242$?
<font color="#909090">(You hand over the notebook.)</font>
Thumbing through this... there appears to be plenty of info we Lumiknights can act on. Good job.
I'm certain you've heard of $map:02020035$, yes? It's a facility to produce mechanical soldiers for the Tairen Kingdom here in Kidel.
The factory is currently occupied by the Daemon Army. $npcName:11001813[gender:0]$ has bent that entire place, soldiers and all, to their will.
Now the machine warriors are being built for the ranks of the Daemon Army.
If we are to have any hope of victory over the Daemon Army, the factory must be destroyed. Our first step must be defeating the $npcNamePlural:25021902$ guarding the factory.
Defeat $npcName:25021902$ in $map:02020035$.
Security at the factory seems to have fallen apart. I know who to credit for that.
Another excellent mission. Well done.
Ah, you're here.
Have you heard of $npcName:25021906$?
Um... Am I supposed to know about that?
Our people are saying it's one of the most powerful mechanical warriors they've ever seen. Some of our best soldiers barely survived their encounter with it.
I considered destroying it myself... but I'd like to see how you handle it.
Go to $map:02020035$ and defeat $npcName:25021906$.
I know the $npcName:25021906$ is intimidating to some... but certainly not for you!
I trust you were successful?
Didn't even break a sweat.
Hm... perhaps the $npcName:25021906$ was not as formidable as I thought. Ah well, good work nonetheless.
Cough, cough... There you are.
Are you sick?

Of course not, don't be ridiculous. It's a particularly insidious affliction from $npcName:11004548[gender:0]$'s pollen. That wretched stuff has found its way to $map:02020008$, if you can believe that.
Apparently I could be affected just by receiving this report...
Worse than that, though, is the monster that's gone wild because of the pollen's effect. $npcName:25021802$'s influence can't be overstated.
So... what do we do?
Well, I'm in no condition to unleash my true power. I think you've got to cover this one.
Take down $npcName:25021802$ before it does any more harm. Simple, right?
Our people are already starting to recover. You did well.
What about you?
I'll be fine, of course. Just need some time to refocus.
Ah, you're here.
As you know, the Daemon Army is fairly well holed up in $map:02020018$.
Their forces are bolstered by the mechanical soldiers that $npcName:11004430[gender:0]$ reprogrammed. However, one of their units seems to have broken free of that programming.
It's called $npcName:25021702$, and the secret to shutting down the mechanical hordes might be locked away in its memory.
That's why I need you to defeat it and return with its memory chip.
Defeat $npcName:25021702$ and bring back its memory chip.
Do you have the chip?
Here it is, one $item:30001243$.
Hm. This is nothing like the memory units we've found in other machines. Even I don't recognize the design. Very good.
At last. You really must be more punctual, $MyPCName$.
At last, the aetherine research team is producing results. I didn't need to step in after all.
They do need one more set of aetherine to study, this time from $map:02020008$.
This may be the last time I ask about this. The end is finally in sight.
They do need one more set of aetherine to study, this time from $map:02020008$.
I wonder what could be special about this aetherine from $map:02020008$... Ah well, as long as these chores are coming to an end.
I shall call upon you again soon.
Ah, you're here.
Tell me what you know about $map:02020009$.
<font color="#909090">(You describe the area, using the biggest vocabulary words you can think of.)</font>

...Indeed. Of particular note is the quality of the natural environment there. Unfortunately, a particular class of Kharon brigand has been laying waste to the area. They are known as $npcNamePlural:25021603$.
We cannot let such beauty be so callously destroyed. The very thought enrages me. Settle this by defeating these heathens.
Not done yet? Go to $map:02020009$ and defeat $npcName:25021603$.
Good job. We've already recovered a few vegetation samples from $map:02020009$.
I expect the ecosystem to fully recover, in time.
I will ask for your service again.
You're here, and I have news. Good news.
I've received word that the aetherine research is almost concluded. Only one more sample is needed.
Simply bring back the aetherine in $map:02020018$, and that will be the last sample.
I'm eager to see the end of this...
Simply bring back the aetherine in $map:02020018$, and that will be the last sample.
The final sample. At last, our skills can go towards something greater...
I'll send it straight to the research team. You'll be the first to know when the research is complete.
Now we wait. Good job.
There you are.
Hey, I saw tamers disembarking from the Sky Fortress.
Oh, you noticed. It's because of the Daemon Army Guard Dogs in $map:02020036$.
Monsters known as $npcNamePlural:25022003$ have been attacking our people using those Guard Dogs. We're trying to counter with our own top tamers from Maple World.
What if I took out these $npcNamePlural:25022003$?
Exactly what I was thinking. Good hunting.
Defeat $npcName:25022003$ and free the Guard Dogs.
You've done good work today. You should be proud.
The fewer the $npcNamePlural:25022003$, the better. We're fortunate to have you, $MyPCName$.
I will ask for your service again.
Captain $npcName:11004312[gender:0]$ overheard people whining about how much they hate routine tests... She interpreted it to mean that the tests are too easy.
I'm sorry, $MyPCName$, but I have no choice.
I'm ramping up the difficulty. Captain's orders.
Between you and me, I don't think the Captain'll really do anything if you fail, but still...
Give it your all!
You did it, $MyPCName$, just like I knew you would!
Hi, $MyPCName$! You know how we've found traces of lapenshards in Kritias?
The Green Hoods think it may have something to do with the dark crystal explosion in Maple World a while back...
We're trying our hardest to find the connection.
But the creatures here aren't exactly helping!
Think you can clear some of them out of the way so we can do our work?
We need to get to the bottom of everything that's happening!
That was quick! Thank you! Everyone'll be so excited to get back to work!
Captain $npcName:11004312[gender:0]$ overheard people whining about how much they hate routine tests... She interpreted it to mean that the tests are too easy.
Sorry, $MyPCName$, policy is policy! I'm ramping up the difficulty.
But don't freak out, I'm sure Captain $npcName:11004312[gender:0]$ won't really do anything to you if you fail...
But it might be safer not to fail, so...
Give it your all!
Wow, $MyPCName$, you never cease to impress me!
A large Tairen mine was discovered in $map:02020031$. Aetherine, the material found there, is really special!
It has a similar wavelength as that of mana—yes, the very same mana that mages use in Maple World! Imagine what we could do if we could harness aetherine to fuel magic!
Unfortunately, the mechanical soldiers in $map:02020031$ are making it hard to find out! It's be great if you could, ah, convince them to get out science's way.
Stop the mechanical soldiers in $map:02020031$ from interfering with our research!
Thanks, $MyPCName$! Today, you've won a victory for science!
You've heard that latest research, right, $MyPCName$? Tairen soldiers are powered by aetherine!
Not only that, but it turns out that everything in Tairen uses aetherine as an energy source! Isn't that amazing?
Here's the real kicker: the aetherine crystals here in Kritias react to the mana of Maple World!
The Green Hoods have been trying to study this relationship in aetherine's natural settings, but the creatures here keep getting in the way.
Would you mind clearing out some enemies so we can conduct our studies?
Would you mind clearing out some enemies so we can conduct our studies?
Thank you! We're one step closer to finding the connection between aetherine and mana!
Argh! Can you believe it?! Creatures have been breaking into our aetherine supplies!
And do you know why? To steal aetherine so that they can decorate themselves with it! Sure, maybe they also use the aetherine as body armor, but that's not the point!
Don't they know how hard we worked to mine all that aetherine? We've got to put a stop to this! Will you help, $MyPCName$?
Stop the creatures from stealing our aetherine!
They won't dare touch our precious aetherine now, right? And it's all thanks to you, $MyPCName$!

The $map:52100104$ in $map:02020031$ is currently occupied by the Daemon Army. What's strange is, as you'll recall, the Tairen mechanical soldiers defending the area defected to the Daemon Army without a moment's consideration.
According to the Humanitas scout stationed there, their allegiance changed with the blink of $npcName:11001813[gender:0]$ 's eye. We still don't understand how he took over the machines.
I want you to dismantle $npcNamePlural:25020203$ in that area so we can study their components for clues.
Dismantle the $npcNamePlural:25020203$ so we can study their parts for clues as to how they were hacked.
<font color="#909090">(With great shame, you report that inspecting the salvaged components from the $npcNamePlural:25020203$ revealed nothing about how they were co-opted by the Daemon Army.)</font>
Don't look so sad. It was a longshot to begin with. Besides, I might find something after I comb through the combat data.
As always, thank you for your help, $MyPCName$. I'll call you if we find anything!
The $itemPlural:30001244$ we've harvested from $map:02020030$ to use in our aetherine research is being stolen by $npcNamePlural:25020102$!
Ugh, that stuff is way too valuable to be used as... as... batteries! We need to put a stop to this!
Defeat the $npcNamePlural:25020102$ and get back those $itemPlural:30001244$!
Defeat the $npcNamePlural:25020102$ and get back those $itemPlural:30001244$!
Whew, close call. Looks like the crystals are all still intact. Thanks, $MyPCName$!
Since arriving in Kritias, we've tried to open the lines of communication with the local flora and fauna. Doesn't hurt to be nice, right? We've had moderate success with the Poings.
$MyPCName$, I'd like you to try communicating with them, too.
Who knows, they might like you better than the rest of us. You are pretty charming!
Try communicating with the Poings.
I managed to communicate with it a little, but I'm not sure it liked me...
Hey, it's a start! I'll take it, $MyPCName$!
I'm glad you're here, $MyPCName$! Humanitas will soon begin the initiative to retake the floating island to the right of $map:02020030$!
The Tairen forces patrolling the island have tremendous endurance. They've been giving us a real hard time.
But you can take them out, can't you? Help us reclaim the floating island!
Take out the Tairen forces in $map:02020030$ to help reclaim the floating island!
I've been absolutely bombarded with reports of your heroism, $MyPCName$! I wish I could've been there to see it in person!
I've received so many reports of people hearing a strange melody. It seems to follow a regular pattern, but beyond that... nobody seems to know much about it.
If we could identify that melody, it might give us an edge in our exploits in Kritias!
$MyPCName$, would you mind going out there and seeing what you can find out?
Try following the melody... and then see if you can play it yourself.
Such a beautiful song. It appears it's not just the science that's advanced here in Kritias, but the music, too!
Oh no! We just learned from a Shadow Walker that the Daemon Army that arrived in Kritias before us has already learned how to apply aetherine to amp up their magic!
This means that we're behind! Oooh, I just hate not being first. Almost as bad, it appears they've been tainting the aetherine with darkness.

They're plotting something, I just know it! But the question is... what? If we could collect some samples of the corrupted crystals, maybe I could find out. Will you go out there and gather some $itemPlural:30001245$ for me?
The Daemon Army is plotting something, I just know it! But the question is... what? Will you go out there and gather some $item:30001245$ for me?
Wonderful work! I'll send these samples to be analyzed by my team right away!
Bad news, $MyPCName$! I've gotten a report that researchers studying aetherine crystals in a $map:02020031$ mine were attacked by mechanical soldiers!
They must be taught not to not to interfere with our work! Please, will you go teach them a lesson?
They must be taught not to not to interfere with our work! Please, will you go teach them a lesson?
Thank you, $MyPCName$. The researchers should be able to do their work in peace for a while.
$MyPCName$! $MyPCName$! Have you heard?
$npcName:11004315$! $npcName:11004315$! Heard what?
A scout at the $map:02020029$ said a platform appeared out of thin air! And at the very top of that platform, he spied what he thinks was a beautiful flower!
We just have to investigate, don't you think? Think of everything we could learn!
The scout couldn't make it all the way to the top, but I know you can, $MyPCName$! Will you retrieve that flower for me to study?
I'm still waiting for that flower!
Do you have the flower?
Oops. I totally forgot to grab the flower... I was distracted by a strange box.
Um, so did you bring the box?
Er...
So you have nothing for me to study?
Next time! I promise!
Sheesh, what's a girl gotta do to get a flower around here? All I wanted to do was dissect and analyze it...
What should I do? Those $npcNamePlural:25020005$ are causing such a headache! Oh, $MyPCName$! Perfect timing!
I'm here to save the day!
You sure are! The $npcNamePlural:25020005$ at the $map:02020029$ spread their poison everywhere they go, making our researchers faint and weak.
Our research must continue, which means...
You've got work for me!
That's right! Will you defeat the $npcNamePlural:25020005$ so that our researchers can work without vomiting?
Defeat the $npcNamePlural:25020005$ in $map:02020029$, please!
Wonderful job! What would I do without you, $MyPCName$?
Did you hear? Captain $npcName:11004312[gender:0]$ overheard people whining about how much they hate routine tests... She interpreted it to mean that the tests are too easy.
As much as I hate to do it, I have to up the difficulty. Rules are rules!
But don't worry about it too much.
Between you and me, I don't think the Captain'll really do anything if you fail, but still...
Give it your all!
Perfectly executed, as always, $MyPCName$!
<font color="#909090">(Nairin looks up from a report as you appear.)</font>
$MyPCName$, just in time! I have something you can help me with.
We've encountered a few monsters that are more aggressive than the rest... A lot of researchers have gotten hurt.
We can't have our people venturing into the unknown and getting bullied by local wildlife, right? Right! I think you know what to do.
Destroy the aggressive monsters that are making life difficult for researchers!
Thanks to you, we've been able to safely transported those who were injured to safety and send out a new batch of researchers.
Maybe this time, they can do their work in peace!
Captain $npcName:11004312[gender:0]$ overheard more people whining about how much they absolutely loathe routine tests... She interpreted it to mean that the tests are still too easy.
I tried to convince her that the tests are fine, but she was adamant.
I'm so sorry, $MyPCName$. I know this puts more of a burden on you.
Between you and me, I don't think the Captain'll really do anything if you fail, but still...
Give it your all!
A perfect score, as usual. What, you didn't know I was grading you?
$map:02020004$ is a key location that connects to $map:02020041$, our first settlement in Kritias. But it's constantly being attacked by Tairen forces.
Our own forces have grown weak, but the enemy keeps coming... They could make a serious push on $map:02020041$ at any time.
We barely have enough resources to defend our settlements, let alone explore the continent...
Something must be done!
Clear out enemies in $map:02020004$ to give our guys a break!
Clear out enemies in $map:02020004$ to give our guys a break!
The forces of Tairen must realize now that we won't stand idly by when they attack, and it's all thanks to you!
Eeeee! We've discovered a new energy signature in $map:02020001$!
The Green Hoods are going to construct a research facility there so I can study this to my heart's delight!
There's just one problem. The Kharon forces there won't let us!
If you could clear them out of the way, we can finally start construction on the new facility!
If you could clear the Kharon forces out of the way, we can finally start construction on the new facility facility!
Now, construction on the research facility can finally begin! I can't wait!
$npcNamePlural:25020301$ are stealing our food supplies! Do you understand, $MyPCName$? People are starving!
You have to do something! Please! Head to $map:02020006$ and clear out the $npcNamePlural:25020301$ stealing our food!
Please! Head to $map:02020006$ and clear out the $npcNamePlural:25020301$ stealing our food!
Thank you! You've saved a lot of lives today, $MyPCName$!
I've just received the most amazing report!
Strange devices have appeared all over Kritias. When a scout activated one of them, it made blossoms appear! And they're supposed to be really pretty!
That sounds like something that could use a lot more investigation, so...
You want me to bring you flowers?
N-no! I mean, well, yes! But it's for research, not to make my desk pretty!
You... you believe me, right?
Sure.
Great! Then, I'll just be here, clearing off a space on my desk...
So I have a place to do my research! N-no other reason!
You're back, $MyPCName$! And...
You're empty-handed...
I'm sorry. I couldn't get any of the flowers.
Oh... Well, that's okay. Maybe next time...
Next time. It's a promise.
R-really? I'll hold you to that!
I just got a call via our emergency line.
Some of our scouts were ambushed at $map:02020001$ and had their reports stolen.
Thankfully, the scouts all made it back okay. But our reports...
They fell into enemy hands!
Don't worry, Nainai! I'll get them back!
Really? Thank you! You can find the reports on $npcNamePlural:25020501$, and don't call me 'Nainai'!
Defeat $npcNamePlural:25020501$ and gather up those missing reports!
You're retrieved them! Oh, they're damaged. It's okay. I'm sure I can still analyze them for useful information. Thank you!
We've got trouble, $MyPCName$. Our $map:02020004$ scout was attacked, and his report was stolen.
That report contained detailed studies of enemy weaknesses! I really wanted to analyze that information...

You're missing the point, Nainai, darling. The mission details of a Shadow Walker agent was included in that report, making it a confidential document of utmost importance. We can't allow that information to fall into the wrong hands.
This is terrible. What should we do?
Don't worry. I'll retrieve the report for you.
Oh, $MyPCName$. You're always here to save the day.
Head to $map:02020004$ and battle $npcNamePlural:25020401$ to find the stolen report!
Head to $map:02020004$ and battle $npcNamePlural:25020401$ to find the stolen report!
Did you retrieve the report?
I think I gathered most of it...
Thank goodness! Even a small portion of the information included in that report will help tremendously.
It looks like you retrieved the part about the Shadow Walker agent... I guess I can put knives and clothespins away.

I don't even want to think about how you were planning to torture our enemies with clothespins, Schatten... Anyway, I'll try to piece together the rest of this report using the data you retrieved, $MyPCName$.
I was so happy earlier when we found a new aetherine mine and started increasing our aetherine stockpiles. I have so many experiments I'm planning to conduct!
But then those $npcNamePlural:25020403$ near $map:02020004$ started mining the aetherine, too, leaving less for us to gather!
This just can't stand! My experiments can't wait!
Will... will you help us?
Of course! I could never refuse you, Nairin.
R-really? That's a relief! Then, will you go to $map:02020004$ and clear out the $npcNamePlural:25020403$?
Please, defeat $npcNamePlural:25020403$ in $map:02020004$!
I just received a note from the mines. It looks like our aetherine stockpile is growing again, and it's all thanks to you!
Oh... Hi there, $MyPCName$...
Why the long face?
I've already told you how important aetherine is, right?
I mean, it has the potential to revolutionize the world.
But the aetherine we've been stockpiling keeps getting stolen. This time, we have footage of $npcNamePlural:25020302$ sneaking into camp to eat the aetherine. To eat it! Can you believe that?
We've tried fences, boxes, traps, you name it... But they always find their way in. It's so discouraging.
All that's left for me to do is to ask you for help.
No problem. This'll be a piece of cake.
Really? Then, there's still hope. Go to $map:02020006$, clear out the $npcNamePlural:25020302$, and retrieve any $itemPlural:30001245$ you can find.
Go to $map:02020006$, clear out the $npcNamePlural:25020302$, and retrieve any $itemPlural:30001245$ you can find.
Now there's a chance I'll get to conduct all my experiments. Thank you so much, $MyPCName$!
A strange device was discovered a few days ago at $map:02020001$. It opened a large platform in the sky when it was operated!
But before we could investigate what was on the platform... it disappeared! Can you believe that?
Kritias is full of mysteries!
Ah. I've encountered this phenomenon before. Ghosts. Gotta be it.
Pffft, nice try, Schatten, but ghosts don't scare me. They're just another set of creatures to study.
Y-yeah. Gh-ghosts aren't frightening at all. Especially n-not to someone as strong as me...
Condor! Are you scared of ghosts?
N-no, of c-course not! What kind of stupid j-joke is that?
Condor! Wait! Come back! Where are you going in such a hurry? Oh, he's gone...
Anyway, $MyPCName$, would you head to $map:02020001$ and investigate?
Investigate the platform that appears at $map:02020001$ and let me know what you find.
You're back, $MyPCName$. What did you discover?
I'm not exactly sure, but I didn't see any ghosts.
See! I told you there's no such thing as ghosts!
I thought you said that you weren't scared of ghosts, not that they weren't real...
Wh-what? Same thing! Ahahahaha, shouldn't you be focusing on your mission?
Oh, that's right. $MyPCName$, thank you so much for your help!
I need your help, $MyPCName$.
$map:02020001$ is the main source of drinking water to $map:02020041$ and multiple other nearby settlements. The water there also contains aetherine, so it's important for research purposes as well.
But the $npcNamePlural:25020504$ in the area keep stealing our equipment, making it difficult for us to progress in our research!
Do you think you could go to $map:02020001$ and teach the $npcNamePlural:25020504$ to stop messing with our stuff?
Go to $map:02020001$ and teach the $npcNamePlural:25020504$ to stop messing with our stuff!
Nice work, $MyPCName$!
Argh, the $npcNamePlural:25020507$ at $map:02020001$ are attacking the energy lab there!
If this continues, not only will this lead to the destruction of the lab, but it'll interfere with the flow of aetherine... and delay my personal research projects!
We can't allow that to happen! Will you head to $map:02020001$ and stop the $npcNamePlural:25020507$?
We need to protect our research! Will you head to $map:02020001$ and stop the $npcNamePlural:25020507$?
Thank you, $MyPCName$! I think you, and my research thanks you!
$MyPCName$, just in time! I have a mission for you.
Some of the supplies we temporarily stashed at $map:02020006$ have gone missing.
We checked the surveillance footage and discovered that the $npcNamePlural:25020303$ are to blame.
They consider our supplies some sort of status symbol or something.
If it were just the missing supplies, it'd be one thing. But they're very aggressive when they take the supplies.
We need to take action before the problem gets worse. Please, head to $map:02020006$ and clear out the $npcNamePlural:25020303$.
Please, head to $map:02020006$ and clear out the $npcNamePlural:25020303$.
Nice work, $MyPCName$! We can all rest a little easier, thanks to you.
Captain $npcName:11004312[gender:0]$ thinks the routine testing is still too easy. Time to up the difficulty again.
I know this makes things tougher for you, but... orders are orders!
Don't worry too much about it. How well you do on this test won't really affect your status aboard Sky Fortress. Not at this point, hehe.
$MyPCName$, this test really just measures your devotion to Sky Fortress more than anything else, so do your best and you'll be fine.
You'll do great!
Give it your all!
I knew you could do it, $MyPCName$! Hehe!
Exploration is fun and exciting! I love seeing what new and strange things our scouts uncover!
Of course, the more we delve into new terrain, the more dangerous it gets, too.
If only there were a brave, strong hero who could clear out new areas so our scouts could explore in relative safety...
Wait, we do have someone like that! It's you, $MyPCName$!
We're currently focusing our explorations on the $map:02020032$, $map:02020034$, and $map:02020013$...
Will you head to those areas and clear out the $npcNamePlural:25020701$, $npcNamePlural:25020805$, and $npcNamePlural:25020905$?
If you clear out the aggressive creatures in the areas we're currently exploring, it would be such a big help!
If you clear out the aggressive creatures in the areas we're currently exploring, it would be such a big help!
Thank you! Now we can keep exploring what this strange place has to offer!
Captain $npcName:11004312[gender:0]$ recently decided that putting effort into attempting to complete routine tests is more important than actually completing them.
She said that true desire and earnest effort are what we should be evaluating everyone on.
Sounds great, right? It's not. I've had to increase the difficulty level to ensure I get an accurate analysis of your efforts.
Just remember, this test isn't meant to gauge if you're still fit for Sky Fortress service, so... just keep doing what you've been doing, okay?
Don't worry too much about it, and do your best!
Give it your all!
I think the Captain was right! Everyone performed their tests with much more zest and gusto this time!
But the best amongst them was you, of course, $MyPCName$! Great work!
I've got a really! Really important mission for you!
$map:02020013$ is a key section of the supply route between Humanitas and ourselves.
It's great, except... well... There are lots of monsters there, and they love to ambush our caravan.
I want you to go to $map:02020013$ and take out the monsters there.
I want you to go to $map:02020013$ and take out the monsters there.
Supplies are moving through $map:02020013$ again. Thanks, $MyPCName$!
오셨나요? $MyPCName$님. 이번 임무는 꽤나 어려운 일이 될거 같아요.
거대 기계 괴수 <font color="#ffd200">$npcName:23001006$</font>$pp:가,이$ 이곳저곳에서 지진을 일으키고 파괴를 일삼는 바람에 부상당한 탐사대원들이 늘어나고 있고 진동때문에 파손되는 스카이 포트리스의 장비도 늘어나고 있어 상황이 심각해요.
게다가 새로운 개척지마다 오염물질을 퍼뜨려 개척지도 심각한 타격을 받고 있구요. 이대로 방치하면 피해가 되돌릴 수 없을 정도로 심각해질 거예요.
<font color="#ffd200">$npcName:23001006$</font>의 근거지인 <font color="#ffd200">$map:02020051$</font>$pp2:로,으로$ 가서 녀석을 퇴치해 주세요.

감사합니다! 이걸로 이주민들도 대원들도 한 시름 놓았어요!
Let's get to briefing!
Tairen has all kinds of advanced technology on their side. It makes things hard for us and Humanitas.
The $map:02020010$ and $map:02020034$ are proof of that.
Well, $npcName:11004314[gender:1]$'s agents say that the soldiers at the $map:02020010$ have blueprints for the $map:02020034$.
If we get those $itemPlural:30001249$, we'll learn lots... including a way to take down the $map:02020034$! Can you get the blueprints from the $npcNamePlural:25020604$?
Can you get the $itemPlural:30001249$ from the $npcNamePlural:25020604$ in $map:02020010$?
Amazing! This even includes operation instructions for a fusion reactor! It'll take some time to figure out, but that's the fun part!
Great work!
$MyPCName$! It's an emergency! $npcNamePlural:25020704$ are attacking the $map:02020032$!
If this continues, the enemy will push through our defenses to $map:02020041$ itself!
Listen here! My men are doing their blasted best to hold the line. But for every one of those blighted monsters we cut down, three more pop up!
I don't have enough people to keep up this fight!
He's right. We're all out of soldiers for this fight.
But we're not going to lie down and let the bad guys stomp all over us, right? Please defeat $npcNamePlural:25020704$ at the $map:02020032$!
Please defeat $npcNamePlural:25020704$ at the $map:02020032$!
Things have calmed down at the $map:02020032$. Thanks!
I never expected anything less from my cadet! BAHAHA!
$MyPCName$님! 기다리고 있었어요!
<font color="#ffd200">$npcName:23001006$</font>$pp:가,이$ 강력한 지진을 일으키는 바람에 탐사대원들은 물론 스카이 포트리스의 장비들도 망가져버려 피해가 막심해요.
게다가 사람들이 살고 있는 개척지에 오염물질을 퍼뜨려 사람들이 병드는 등 여기 저기 큰 문제가 속출하고 있고요. 이대로 방치하면 피해가 정말 심각해질 거예요.
<font color="#ffd200">$npcName:23001006$</font>의 근거지인 <font color="#ffd200">$map:02020051$</font>$pp2:로,으로$ 가서 녀석을 퇴치해 주세요.
<font color="#ffd200">$map:02020051$</font>$pp2:로,으로$ 가서 <font color="#ffd200">$npcName:23001006$</font>$pp:를,을$ 퇴치해 주세요.
$MyPCName$님 수고하셨습니다! 덕분에 한 시름 놓을 수 있게 되었어요.
Did you hear the news?
Our people found a mysterious device in the $map:02020010$ that made a huge ring appear in the sky!
They think that flying through the ring would cause another ring to appear. Unfortunately, none of them can fly, so...
I can't sleep because I'm so curious about it!
Please, $MyPCName$, think of your poor, sleep-deprived tactical officer!
I'll get to the bottom of these rings!
Really? Thank you so much!
Remember: after you use the device in the $map:02020010$, fly through the ring that appears in the air!
Well? Did you find out about the ring?
<font color="#909090">(You tell her what you encountered.)</font>
Well, that's kinda... disappointing, I guess.
Well, at least now I can sleep in peace!
Are you ready to explore Kritias some more?
Leave it to me.
Our scouts have discovered a strange melody in $map:02020013$! We couldn't figure out why it was playing, but we're working on getting to the bottom of this.
Could you go to $map:02020013$ and check it out?
I'll take care of it.
Thank you! You can do it!
Please go to $map:02020013$ and gather data.
Did you figure out the melody?
<font color="#909090">(You do your best to hum the melody.)</font>
Uh... That sounds... interesting...?
I'm doing my best here!
I think it's gonna take a while to gather the data. Thanks, though.
This is exciting news. We picked up a new energy signal in the ruins at $map:02020016$!
Of course, I want to get my hands on whatever's transmitting it.
I admit it, Nainai. I'm the source of the signal. So... Where're those hands?
St-stop kidding around! This is serious!
Oh, I am being serious, Nainai. Now... show me those hands.
Stop teasing me!
And miss out on these adorable reactions? I think not.
F-fine! Whatever! I'm... I'm going back to my briefing!
L-look, having lots of energy is important to our operations here.
But $map:02020016$ is a wild place. The $npcNamePlural:25021004[gender:0]$ there won't let our researchers near the signal's source.
We can't make any more progress without you, $MyPCName$!
How can I help?
I'm counting on you! Beat the $npcNamePlural:25021004[gender:0]$ in $map:02020016$.
Beat the $npcNamePlural:25021004[gender:0]$ in $map:02020016$.
Good job, $MyPCName$! I'll start ramping up our research on this project.
This is a little worrying. According to this scout report, $npcNamePlural:25020804$ in the $map:02020034$ are equipped with $itemPlural:30001250$.
This is a great opportunity to get a bunch of $itemPlural:30001250$! Of course, we need someone who can take on an army of $npcNamePlural:25020804$...
Hey, you can take on an army of $npcNamePlural:25020804$! Please please please get those $itemPlural:30001250$ for me?
Please defeat the robots in the $map:02020034$ and take their $itemPlural:30001250$.
Wow! You brought a lot! Thank you so much, $MyPCName$!
These numbers are bad. In all of our experiments, we spend more energy extracting power from aetherine crystals than we get out of it.
Don't ask me why, but I think that $npcNamePlural:25020904$, um, excrete a fluid that can catalyze the process.
Of course, no one wants to go around squeezing $npcNamePlural:25020904$ for their fluids...
I want to!
Really?! Wow! You always come through for me!
Maybe I should've mentioned this earlier, but $npcNamePlural:25020904$ smell terrible. Really terrible.
Defeat $npcNamePlural:25020904$ in $map:02020013$ and collect their $item:30001251$.
Defeat $npcNamePlural:25020904$ in $map:02020013$ and collect their $item:30001251$.
Yay, you brought it! You—Oh, put that down. Um, over there. I'll have a researcher pick it up. Thanks a ton!

You know that the $map:02020034$ produces a ton of refined aetherine, right? I sent some of our crew on an innocent fact-finding mission there, and the $npcNamePlural:25020806$ ambushed them. The nerve!
Those guys are big. And strong. And skilled, too.
But I think you're even more skilled. I think you can beat the $npcNamePlural:25020806$!
Please teach the $npcNamePlural:25020806$ in the $map:02020034$ a lesson.
Please teach the $npcNamePlural:25020806$ in the $map:02020034$ a lesson.
Thanks! That'll show 'em.
You're needed at the $map:02020010$, and quickly! Our soldiers are under attack from $npcNamePlural:25020605$.
We need to dismantle those $npcNamePlural:25020605$ if we want to stand any chance of winning.
You're our only hope of turning things around. Please defeat $npcNamePlural:25020605$ at the $map:02020010$.
Please defeat $npcNamePlural:25020605$ at the $map:02020010$.
Nice going. We've still got a shot at this fight!
Don't spread this around, but I heard that not all of our crew members are taking their missions seriously.
That's why Captain $npcName:11004312[gender:1]$ is really pushing this whole "routine testing" bit. These tests... Well, they aren't easy.
But don't worry! I'm sure you've got nothing to worry about.
My advice is to not sweat it. We're not evaluating you as a person, after all. We're just calculating your value as an asset to the mission!
Just do what you always do, and you'll be fine!
Just do what you always do, and you'll be fine!
I knew you could do it. You always do, after all.
And I'm pretty sure I saw the captain give an approving nod. You're golden!
I know we have a lot of work ahead of us, but I can't help getting giddy when I think about all the stuff we're learning. With your help, of course!
We're discovering new energy sources and creatures every day. I'm so lucky to be alive when we're exploring a brand new land!
Of course, not everything's going so great. Our research outposts in Kidel are under attack. All of the time.
Can you fight off the monsters who keep getting in the way of our research?
