Please defeat $npcNamePlural:25021503$ in the $map:02020003$, $npcNamePlural:25021303[gender:0]$ in $map:02020033$, and $npcNamePlural:25021203$ in the $map:02020017$.
Please defeat $npcNamePlural:25021503$ in the $map:02020003$, $npcNamePlural:25021303[gender:0]$ in $map:02020033$, and $npcNamePlural:25021203$ in the $map:02020017$.
Phew! We can finally research in peace. Thanks a bunch!
I don't know if you heard, but Captain $npcName:11004312[gender:1]$ changed our testing criteria to focus on fieldwork.
I think she's trying to get a better handle on each crew member's contribution to our work here.
I don't think that'll make any difference for you, though. Just keep doing what you always do.
You're going to knock it out of the park. Good luck!
You're going to knock it out of the park. Good luck!
Wonderful work, as always!
$MyPCName$님! 큰일이에요! 최근 크고 작은 지진이 자주 발생해 탐사 대원들이 부상을 입고 장비가 고장 나는 일이 속출하고 있어요!
원인은 <font color="#ffd200">$npcName:23001006$</font>였어요! 녀석이 탐사 캠프나 주요 거점에 땅굴을 파내는 바람에 지진이 일어나고 있던 거였죠!
지진 때문에 탐사대원들이 부상을 입는 것은 물론, 스카이 포트리스의 장비에도 피해를 주고 있습니다. $npcName:23001006$의 전투 데이터 확보고 뭐고 당장 크리티아스 탐사 전체에 문제가 생기겠어요.
이대로 방치하면 피해가 정말 심각해질 거예요. <font color="#ffd200">$npcName:23001006$</font>의 근거지인 <font color="#ffd200">$map:02020051$</font>$pp2:로,으로$ 가서 녀석을 퇴치해 주세요.
<font color="#ffd200">$map:02020051$</font>$pp2:로,으로$ 가서 <font color="#ffd200">$npcName:23001006$</font>$pp:를,을$ 퇴치해 주세요.
$MyPCName$님 덕분에 $npcName:23001006$의 말썽도 한동안 잠잠해지겠죠? 탐험대원들도 감사의 메시지를 보내오고 있어요!
Oh, perfect! I was about to radio you. Have you heard of $map:02020003$?

We have several exploration goals for this particular area, focused on studying the magic and structures of ancient Kritias. Unfortunately, interference from the Tairen and Kharon forces has slowed... well, stopped our progress.
It seems pretty clear they've allied against us, just as we've allied with Humanitas.
If you could drive them out, the expedition team can finally make some headway. Can I count on your help, $MyPCName$?
Please head to $map:02020003$ and take out as much of the Tairen and Kharon forces as possible.
Good job, $MyPCName$! With your help, we've secured our position.
Welcome! I've got another job for you. A lot of our people have been getting sick, all because of $npcName:23001006$. That thing spews this nasty poison everywhere, and it gets into everything!
We don't have an antidote yet, because it's so hard to find pure samples of the poison. But we need one, and fast.
I need your help getting samples of the poison. Or... more like, making it possible to get samples. There're these creatures called $npcNamePlural:25021102$ that eat the poison.
I have no idea why any creature would eat poison, but... that's the situation.
We need to hurry! Please take out the $npcNamePlural:25021102$ in the $map:02020051$ so we can get those samples.
Please take out $npcNamePlural:25021102$ in the $map:02020051$ so we can get those samples.
Good job! I have to wonder... could this stuff taste good? I mean, I'm not going to try it!
Anyway, our research team tells me they're getting all the samples they need. You really did it, $MyPCName$!
어서 오세요, $MyPCName$님. 최근 $npcName:23001006$의 움직임이 활발해지고 있다는 것 알고 계세요?
그린후드는 <font color="#ffd200">$npcName:23001006$</font>가 누구의 어떤 목적으로 움직이고 있는지 파악하고 있어요.
녀석이 어떤 패턴을 갖고 행동하고 있는지 알아낸다면 대응할 수 있을 거라 생각 중입니다. 마치 기상예보처럼 말이죠.
하지만 녀석이 워낙 신출귀몰하고 행동을 예측하기 곤란한 상황이에요. 우선 녀석에 대한 데이터가 너무 부족해요.
데이터를 수집하기 위해선 녀석과 부딪혀 보는 수밖엔 없어요! 녀석과 전투를 치러 본다면 녀석이 어떤 패턴으로 움직이는지 데이터를 확보하기 가장 좋을 거 같아요!
어렵고 위험한 부탁인 줄은 알고 있지만… $MyPCName$님 말고는 이 임무를 무사히 마칠 수 있는 대원이 떠오르질 않네요.
부탁드려요! <font color="#ffd200">$map:02020051$</font>에서 <font color="#ffd200">$npcName:23001006$</font>$pp:와,과$의 전투를 벌이고 최대한 많은 행동 패턴을 모아주세요!
<font color="#ffd200">$map:02020051$</font>에서 <font color="#ffd200">$npcName:23001006$</font>$pp:와,과$의 전투를 벌이고 최대한 많은 행동 패턴을 모아주세요!
우와! 어마어마한 데이터양이에요! 이 정도면 <font color="#ffd200">$npcName:23001006$</font>$pp:를,을$ 연구하는 데 큰 도움이 될 거예요.
$MyPCName$! We're in trouble!
Okay, okay, slow down.
Hahh... Are you familiar with the $map:02020017$?
The Green Hoods designated it as a Category One protected area, since it's full of ancient texts and records of Kritias.
But the $npcNamePlural:25021202$ are laying waste to any buildings or facilities they find.
It looks like they would rather destroy the ancient texts of Kritias than let us find them.
We can't let this happen! Who knows what hidden knowledge will be lost if they do this?
Calm down, $npcName:11004315[gender:0]$...
How can I be calm when important historical records are going to be lost? Please help, $MyPCName$!
Please go to the $map:02020017$ right now and defeat the $npcNamePlural:25021202$!
Don't worry, I'm on it!
<font color="#909090">(This is very important to $npcName:11004315[gender:0]$... Don't mess this up!)</font>
Please go to the $map:02020017$ and defeat the $npcNamePlural:25021202$!
Good job, $MyPCName$. Uh... I should apologize for getting so... worked up before.
I completely understand. It's fine.
Really? Phew, what a relief! Let's just not mention this to the Captain, okay?
$MyPCName$, just in time! Do you remember when we were talking about making an antidote for $npcName:23001006$'s poison?
Yes, has there been a breakthrough?
Yes! Sort of. The research team discovered that fluids from $npcName:25021403$ contain an enzyme that completely neutralize the poison!
So now we know exactly what we need for the antidote! And it's all thanks to you, $MyPCName$!
Our only problem is getting enough of the fluid to create all the doses we'll need.
Here we go again...
Um... Is there a problem?
No, not at all. Please continue.
Okay! All you need to do is defeat the $npcNamePlural:25021403$ in $map:02020014$ and bring as many $itemPlural:30001252$ as you can!
I'll get right on it.
Please defeat $npcNamePlural:25021403$ in $map:02020014$ and bring as many $itemPlural:30001252$ as you can!
You're back already?
(I didn't really have a choice...)
Sorry, did you say something?
Nah, it was nothing.
So, this is the $item:30001252$... Well, we definitely didn't get it for the smell, geez. I'll handle it with great care.
Thank you! You've been a huge help!
$MyPCName$... welcome...
Wow, you look beat.
Oh! You can tell? No... it's okay...
Hah, it's just that... our expedition members discovered a strange device in $map:02020003$ that plays a... unique melody.
They couldn't figure out what it was for... and the melody changed each time it played.
It's... it's driving me crazy! Why is the device there? What are the melodies? It's keeping me up at night!
Please... I beg you... solve the mystery of the melody in $map:02020003$ so I can sleep again.
Please investigate the melody device in $map:02020003$.
Did you figure it out? Is it over?
<font color="#909090">(You hum the melody.)</font>
What... is this strange music?
That's all I got from it.
Well... it's not perfect, but... close enough to ease my mind.
Thank you, $MyPCName$! I'm going to take a quick nap when you leave. Just a day or two, I promise!
$MyPCName$! We've got a bit of an emergency.
$npcNamePlural:25021503$ in $map:02020003$ have been stealing parts of the Sky Fortress! It's not serious yet, but they need to stop before they pinch something serious!
I don't think it's an attack. They seem to be competing to steal the biggest parts. It would almost be cute, if they weren't, y'know, ransacking the ship. And harming our crew!
We can always repair the ship, but hurting our comrades is unforgivable!
Please defeat the $npcNamePlural:25021503$ in $map:02020003$ before the losses mount!
Please defeat the $npcNamePlural:25021503$ in $map:02020003$!
Great job!
I still can't believe we had to deal with that, but at least it's over.
$MyPCName$, you always know just when we need you!
The second Humanitas base, $map:02020033$, is under attack by $npcNamePlural:25021303[gender:0]$. They can be formidable foes, but these have been worn down by the long battle.
If $map:02020033$ falls, that'll be a huge setback for Humanitas. We can't let our allies suffer like that!
$MyPCName$, dire situations like this are exactly what we need you for.
Please go to $map:02020033$ and stop the $npcNamePlural:25021303[gender:0]$.
Please go to $map:02020033$ and stop the $npcNamePlural:25021303[gender:0]$.
We've received a message from $npcName:11004395[gender:1]$!
It's from the garrison in $map:02020033$, explaining how $MyPCName$ arrived just in time and turned the tables on the enemy single-handedly.
They said the only reason they're still there to send this is because of you. Wow.
What did you do to earn such praise from $npcName:11004395[gender:1]$, of all people? You really are something!
Oh, $MyPCName$... I'm glad you're here. Those darned $npcNamePlural:25021203$ have been harassing our people again.
Are you okay? You sound really worried.
I can't help it. Every day there's some new crisis, and I've been working day and night to keep up...
Ahhh! I shouldn't be complaining when people like you are working so much harder!
Don't say that. We just work in different ways.
R... really? Yeah, I guess that is true! Still, I can't help but worry about how understaffed we are...
Case in point, the $npcNamePlural:25021203$ in $map:02020017$ have stolen our $itemPlural:30001253$. Again!
Losing the $itemPlural:30001253$ means losing tons of valuable research on Kritias.
I'll get the $itemPlural:30001253$ back. You relax.
Oh, thank you so much. I felt so bad about asking... But yes, find the $npcNamePlural:25021203$ in $map:02020017$ and recover the $itemPlural:30001253$!
Find the $npcNamePlural:25021203$ in $map:02020017$ and get the $itemPlural:30001253$ back!
Finally... the $itemPlural:30001253$! You have no idea what a relief this is. I just want to hug them...
$MyPCName$! Disaster! Humanitas has sent an urgent request for backup at $map:02020033$.
But we're so shorthanded... I have no idea where I can pull a unit from... But we can't afford to lose the whole $map:02020033$...
I'll take care of it.
Really? Even for you... No, I have faith in you. I know you can do this! All right, your targets are the $npcNamePlural:25021307$! Drive them out of $map:02020033$!
Find the $npcNamePlural:25021307$ and drive them out of $map:02020033$!
You did it! I got a message from $npcName:11004395[gender:1]$, and it's... Wow, they're just gushing about you.
I know $npcName:11004395[gender:1]$ can seem cold, but she seems really touched by what you did, $MyPCName$.
$MyPCName$! We're in trouble!
We keep losing probes in the $map:02020051$ to $npcNamePlural:25021103$ and their surface-to-air missiles.
They're too mobile for us to take them out with our own weapons. That means you'll have to go in and take them down one-by-one.
I really underestimated them... they may be busted, but those weapon systems still work.
$MyPCName$, I can count on you for this, right? Please go to the $map:02020051$ and take out those $npcNamePlural:25021103$!
$MyPCName$, I can count on you for this, right? Please go to the $map:02020051$ and take out those $npcNamePlural:25021103$!
Thank goodness that's over! I'm so glad I can count on you, $MyPCName$.
Captain $npcName:11004312[gender:0]$ thinks the whole evaluation system for Sky Fortress crew needs to be overhauled.
It's true, there's not much structure to the system, and we've only recently transitioned from reporting to field evaluations...
Ahh, but this shouldn't concern you! You've been taking on all our toughest missions anyway!
Just keep doing what you're doing, $MyPCName$.
Just keep doing what you're doing, $MyPCName$.
It's like I said, $MyPCName$! Just do what you always do. That's all we need!
어서 오세요, $MyPCName$님. 지난번 보내주신 $npcName:23001006$의 전투 패턴과 최근 패턴을 비교했는데 많은 부분에서 변경점을 발견했어요.
(지난번 전투 데이터가 부족했던 것 아닌지 묻는다.)
이전 전투 데이터가 부족하지는 않았어요. 아마 $npcName:23001006$$pp:는,은$ 전투를 통해 상대에 맞는 전투 패턴을 스스로 추가하고 있는 것으로 예상됩니다.
아무래도 녀석의 신경망 회로는 우리가 생각하는 것보다 복잡한 모양이에요.
$npcName:23001006$의 공격 패턴을 더 수집한다면 케이트 시드를 통해 다음 공격 패턴을 예측할 수 있을 거라는 것이 연구팀의 생각입니다.
이를 위해 적당한 스카이 포트리스 대원은 아무리 생각해도 $MyPCName$뿐이에요.
부탁드려요! <font color="#ffd200">$map:02020051$</font>에서 <font color="#ffd200">$npcName:23001006$</font>$pp:와,과$의 전투 후 전투 데이터를 최대한 많이 수집해 주세요.
<font color="#ffd200">$map:02020051$</font>에서 <font color="#ffd200">$npcName:23001006$</font>$pp:와,과$의 전투 후 전투 데이터를 최대한 많이 수집해 주세요.
우와! 엄청난 데이터! 지난번 데이터보다 훨씬 많네요. 이걸 분석하려면 케이트 시드를 며칠 동안 풀가동해야겠는데요?
정말 수고 많으셨습니다! $npcName:23001006$의 행동을 파악하는 데 큰 도움이 되겠어요!
Captain $npcName:11004312[gender:0]$ still isn't happy with our evaluations... she thinks there's too much variance between missions to evaluate people fairly.
She was so convinced, we had to stop her from going out into the field herself to try an evaluation mission!
I mean, we certainly need the manpower...
$npcName:11004315[gender:0]$! If we're still short on people, I will-
Ahh! Nope! No, we're fine! I was just, ah, speculating!
Is that so? Hmm... very well. Then I don't want to hear about missions being pushed back!
Hahh... Y-yes, Captain!
I need to start watching my back...
Listen, the overall difficulty of the evaluation missions has increased, but the purpose isn't to evaluate your qualifications or anything. Try not to stress about it.
Just do your best, as you always do!
Just do your best, as you always do!
I knew you could do it, $MyPCName$! You took that tricky mission and put it to shame!
I've got a new mission for you, $MyPCName$. Do you know about $map:02020035$? It's a large facility built by the Tairen Kingdom to produce mechanical soldiers.
The factory was built centuries ago, and somehow continues to crank out robots.
It's pretty amazing... and explains part of why this has been such a difficult struggle for us.
Now the factory has been occupied by the Daemon Army. The robots being produced are now serving them, under the command of $npcName:11001813[gender:0]$.
Perhaps that is why the mechanical soldiers have been much more aggressive towards our forces.
The feedback from Cat Sith is that it's impossible to destroy the factory itself at present due to its heavy defenses. But we do have the option to occupy the factory.
First, we need to clear out the security force so we can get our teams in to reprogram the place. Defeat as many robot forces as you can in $map:02020035$!
Defeat as many robot forces as you can in $map:02020035$!
$MyPCName$, it looks like you cleared our route into $map:02020035$. Our troops can mop up the rest.
Goodness, is there anything you can't do?
$MyPCName$, did you know large quantities of aetherine were discovered in the vines covering the $map:02020051$?
The plants there may have the ability to send their roots deep underground and absorb the aetherine directly.
If we can harvest these vines, we can collect aetherine more easily! But...
The monsters in the region are too aggressive for our people to work there at the moment.
$MyPCName$, if you can thin out the monsters in $map:02020008$, we can continue our aetherine research. Will you help us?
Of course I'll help.
Thank you so much, $MyPCName$! I hope I'm not depending on you too much...
$MyPCName$, if you can thin out the monsters in $map:02020008$, we can continue our aetherine research.
Great job!
Now we can finally establish our research camp! The expedition members will be thrilled. I'm thrilled, too!
Welcome, $MyPCName$! We've been tracking a suspicious $npcName:25021804$ in $map:02020008$.
According to our scouts, the $npcName:25021804$ is avoiding all hostiles and fighting back fiercly if cornered. It's odd for this type of foe...
Oh, that! I was absolutely taken with that one, so I had my men extend that $npcName:25021804$ a polite invitation to join us.
Say, Nainai... you haven't been misplacing things lately, have you? Important things? Important things.
Well... in all the chaos, I suppose...
Things like this?
Ah! That's $item:30001254$! $npcName:11004314[gender:1]$, how do you have this?
Oh, you know me. I'm very persuasive. That $npcName:25021804$ had it last...
What? No! If $item:30001254$ fell into the hands of the Tairen forces...
With the $item:30001254$, the Tairen forces will know exactly where to strike us!
Well, lucky for you they've split it into several pieces for transport. As long as they don't get back together, we're safe. Although, their rendezvous is coming up soon...
Why... why didn't you tell us this sooner?!
Dear, sweet Nainai... You can't rush a Shadow Walker. We take our time and do it right. certain.
Oooh...! $MyPCName$, please hurry to $map:02020008$! Find and take that $npcName:25021804$ down, and bring back that $item:30001254$ ASAP!
Wow... I've never see you fired up like this. I like it.
Please hurry to $map:02020008$! Find and take that $npcName:25021804$ down, and bring back that $item:30001254$ ASAP!
Phew! Thank goodness we've got the $item:30001254$ back. I'm going to enter this in the database and then shred this document like six different ways.
$MyPCName$, thanks for saving my bacon!
Hey! Nainai! What about me? Don't I get some of your bacon, too?
Argh! If you hadn't waited so long... Sigh. It's true... We would have been in deeper trouble if it wasn't for the Shadow Walkers.
That's what I like to hear! You can repay me later. I've got a few ideas how.
$MyPCName$님 어서 오세요. 전에 $npcName:23001006$의 전투 데이터 분석이 완료되었습니다!
분석한 결과 전투 패턴의 변화가 너무나 랜덤하고 변화가 많아 이를 예측하는 것이 어렵다는 결과가 나왔어요.
하지만 너무 상심하지 마세요. 우린 정답을 찾을 테니까요. 늘 그랬던 것처럼요!
연구팀에서는 <font color="#ffd200">$npcName:23001006$</font>의 내부 접속 취약점을 찾아내 AI 자체를 해킹하는 방법을 제안했어요.
어떤 기계든 외부에서 내부로 접속할 수 있는 수단이 있을 거라는 게 연구팀의 의견이었죠. 이를 위해서는 좀 더 많은 전투를 통한 $npcName:23001006$의 허점 찾기가 필수에요.
<font color="#ffd200">$map:02020051$</font>에서 <font color="#ffd200">$npcName:23001006$</font>$pp:와,과$ 전투를 하며 최대한 데이터를 모아주세요. 수집된 전투 데이터를 통해 외부의 허점을 찾아보도록 하겠습니다!
<font color="#ffd200">$map:02020051$</font>에서 <font color="#ffd200">$npcName:23001006$</font>$pp:와,과$ 전투를 하며 최대한 데이터를 모아주세요. 수집된 전투 데이터를 통해 외부의 허점을 찾아보도록 하겠습니다!
정말 감사합니다! 이 정도 데이터라면 $npcName:23001006$의 허점을 찾아내기에 충분할 거예요.
Our forces have advanced as far as $map:02020037$, which serves as a sort of gateway into the heart of Tairen's territory.
The current plan is to make our push into Tairen by slipping through $map:02020037$ with the Humanitas forces.

The problem is, since this area is of significant strategic value to Tairen, their forces are sure to have a heavy presence in the region. The knights of the Royal Guard seem especially strong. If they got involved, they could make progressing through the region difficult.
Among them, the $npcName:25022103[gender:0]$ are the most formidable, and that's not good for us.
Just leave them to me. I'll beat a trail right to Tairen's doorstep.

I feel kind of guilty, always asking you to do the missions no one else wants to do. This is really important, though, so I hope you come through like always. If you need any backup, though, I'll do my best to help!
You need to take out the $npcNamePlural:25022103[gender:0]$in the vicinity of $map:02020037$.
We did it! We've finally established a foothold right on Tairen's doorstep. From here, we can practically march right in!
Now, we just need to work with Humanitas to decide on a winning strategy to reclaim Tairen.
I don't know when that'll happen-you know how these bureaucratic processes go-but when the time comes, I'm looking forward to seeing you in action again!
어서 오세요! $MyPCName$님. 마침 찾고 있었습니다!
전에 가져다주신 $npcName:23001006$의 전투 데이터를 분석했지만… 결국 외부에서 접속 가능한 허점은 발견하지 못했어요.
녀석은 생각보다 매우 치밀하게 만들어진 기계 괴수였어요. 그렇다고 포기할 우리 그린후드가 아닙니다! 파헤치고 파헤쳐서 결국 녀석의 결점을 찾아내 고철덩이로 만들 거예요!
그리고 지난번 전투 데이터를 통해 $npcName:23001006$의 외부 골격이 특수 금속으로 이뤄져 있다는 것을 알아냈으니 지난번 전투가 소득이 없진 않았죠!
이 특수 금속을 분석한다면 $npcName:23001006$의 공격이 닫지 않는 상공에서 스카이 포트리스의 원자진동포를 발사해 특수 금속에 균열을 발생시킬 수 있다고 합니다.
먼저 녀석의 외부 골격을 이루는 특수 금속이 뭔지 알아내려면 직접 전투를 통해 특수 금속의 충돌 음파를 분석하는 것이 최선이라는 게 연구팀의 의견입니다.
$MyPCName$님. <font color="#ffd200">$map:02020037$</font>에서 <font color="#ffd200">$npcName:23001006$</font>$pp:와,과$의 전투를 통해 특수 금속의 충격 음파를 수집해 주세요!
<font color="#ffd200">$map:02020037$</font>에서 <font color="#ffd200">$npcName:23001006$</font>$pp:와,과$의 전투를 통해 특수 금속의 충격 음파를 수집해 주세요!
수고하셨습니다! 전달해주신 자료는 그린후드 연구팀에서 분석을 시작하겠습니다.
$MyPCName$! I've got some good news for you! That's...less common than I wish it was, so listen up!

The Green Hoods' engineering division has concluded that if we're able to conduct a thorough analysis of the robots manufactured in the <font color="#ffd200">$map:02020035$</font>, we might uncover a security vulnerability that would let us turn these metal menaces into allies!
Even the possibility sounds amazing, right? Making those cool precision-tuned mechanical soldiers fight FOR us instead of against us!
There's one small problem, though... We need to bring in a pile of $npcName:25021903$ memory chips before the engineers can even get started.

And who's better qualified to turn robots into rubbish than you? You'll need to defeat <font color="#ffd200">$npcNamePlural:25021903$</font> in the $map:02020035$, then bring back their memory chips for the research team. How about it? Do you think you can pull it off?

And who's better qualified to turn robots into rubbish than you? You'll need to defeat <font color="#ffd200">$npcNamePlural:25021903$</font> in the $map:02020035$, then bring back their memory chips for the research team. How about it? Do you think you can pull it off?
Goodness... You're back already? Were you able to get those memory chips?
You mean these $itemPlural:30001255$? All in a day's work.

Hm. They're not exactly in pristine condition, which I suppose is to be expected when you have to beat the bolts out of them to get to the chips in the first place, but I think the researchers should still be able to work with these.
Anyway, I think we can safely cross this one off the list as 'Mission Accomplished'! I'll let you know when we've got something we need your help with again.

Oh! Your timing couldn't be better, $MyPCName$! I just received a report that our field medic stations have been inundated with a wave of sick explorers. Apparently, they lost consciousness and collapsed while scouting in $map:02020008$.
At first, we thought it was simply exhaustion from the physical demands of exploration and reconnaissance, but then the nurses caring for them started collapsing, suffering the same symptoms.

That's when the research team came in to perform a thorough examination of everyone affected and found poison in their systems! After checking it against the known toxins in Kritias, they discovered it was a fine powder from the wings of the $npcNamePlural:25021803$.

Fortunately for us, the recently established pharmaceutical team was able to develop an antidote and are currently treating everyone who was poisoned. But more are being stricken every day, and it's only a matter of time until the number being stricken is greater than the amount of antidote we can produce.

The poison powder from the wings of the $npcNamePlural:25021803$ in $map:02020008$ is especially potent. Not only is it easily spread by contact, but it requires larger doses of our antidote to counteract.

We need you to exterminate $npcNamePlural:25021803$ in $map:02020008$ to reduce the risk of our explorers and scouts getting poisoned. Swords, flames, and general-purpose explosives are not only approved for this mission, but encouraged!
You need to exterminate $npcNamePlural:25021803$ in $map:02020008$ to reduce the risk of our explorers and scouts getting poisoned.
Good work out there, $MyPCName$! The production of more antidote is ramping up, and that means we should be able to stay on top of this problem.
$MyPCName$! We're in big trouble! The agents who infiltrated $map:02020036$ to assess the strength of the Daemon Army were discovered! They're in full retreat now, but they've sustained injuries.

$map:02020036$ is an important stronghold for the Daemon Army. To stay on top of their activity, we have no choice but to risk this kind of intelligence gathering. If we didn't, there'd be no warning if and when they decided to launch a surprise attack.
The $npcNamePlural:25022005$ in $map:02020036$ are nimble, despite their size. They have especially keen senses, too. Our scouts are trained pros, but they manage to find them and give chase.

If we don't thin their numbers, our efforts to scout the enemy's base will be thwarted. That's why we need you to take out the $npcNamePlural:25022005$ at $map:02020036$. Only then can the scouts gather the vital intel we need!

If we don't thin their numbers, our efforts to scout the enemy's base will be thwarted. That's why we need you to slay <font color="#ffd200">$npcNamePlural:25022005$</font> in <font color="#ffd200">$map:02020036$</font>. Only then can the scouts gather the vital intel we need!
Look! We have reports coming in from our scouts in $map:02020036$ again! And you're the one who made it possible, $MyPCName$!
$MyPCName$! It may come as no surprise to you, but we've got another mess on our hands! Do you remember the substance you brought in before that could counteract the $npcName:23001006$'s poison?
Thanks to you, our pharmaceutical team succeeded in developing an antidote! It's still in the trial phase for now, but once it's been deemed safe, it can go straight into mass production.
Or rather, it could have... You see, the $npcNamePlural:25021604$ launched a surprise raid on the research team's facilities, destroyed the research data, and stole the $item:30001256$!

Without the research data, the team would have no choice but to re-create the sample again from scratch, and that'd take time we can't afford. If we delay the mass production of the antidote, we'll have a lot of poisoned soldiers on our hands!

Who else could we turn to but you? You need to go to <font color="#ffd200">$map:02020009$</font>, eliminate the <font color="#ffd200">$npcNamePlural:25021604$</font> there, and retrieve the <font color="#ffd200">$item:30001256$</font>.

We need you to go to <font color="#ffd200">$map:02020009$</font>, eliminate the <font color="#ffd200">$npcNamePlural:25021604$</font> there, and retrieve the <font color="#ffd200">$item:30001256$</font>.
You really came through in a pinch, $MyPCName$! Now we can get the mass production of this antidote rolling and start treating everyone!
Greetings, $MyPCName$. Do you happen to remember me telling you about a large quantity of aetherine we detected in $map:02020018$?
Uh... Yeah, how could I possibly forget such a fascinating detail?
Hm... You say you do, but scratching your head like that makes it seem sort of like you don't... T-that's no problem, though, because I needed to brief you on the mission anyway.
The Green Hoods decided to set up a research camp in $map:02020018$ to collect large quantities of aetherine and begin research on it right away.

Unfortunately, the researchers have had their hands full dealing with attacks from $npcNamePlural:25021703$ instead. They've completely foiled every attempt the researchers have made to set up a camp.

$map:02020018$ is a key region we need to control for aetherine research and collection. But for that to happen, we need to set up a camp, and we can't do that until you send those <font color="#ffd200">$npcNamePlural:25021703$</font> packing!
We need to set up a camp, and we can't do that until you send those <font color="#ffd200">$npcNamePlural:25021703$</font> packing!
I've received a report that the research team has begun setting up their camp! It's been a long time coming, and they couldn't have done it without your expert display of applied force, $MyPCName$!
Ah, there you are, $MyPCName$. Did you receive the classified document from Humanitas?
<font color="#909090">(Oh no... That one I made into a really sweet paper airplane?)</font>
Huh? You never got it? Hmm... It must be because you're out in the field so often. Not to worry, though; giving briefings is one of the little joys I cherish.

A-ahem! 'Humanitas is planning to launch a full-scale attack on the Daemon Army's key stronghold, $map:02020036$, with the support of the allied forces of Sky Fortress. The goal of this operation is to suppress enemy activity and secure a launching point to reclaim Tairen'

'We formally request the aid of Sky Fortress, due to their exceptional capabilities in reconaissance and intelligence gathering. All data related to this operation must be encrypted and transmitted on the secure channel Badger-Mushroom-Mushroom-Slime.'
That's their official communique. In compliance with our allies' request, the Green Hoods sent scouts to $map:02020036$. However...
While the scouts were gathering information on $map:02020036$, they were discovered by $npcNamePlural:25022004$ and forced to retreat, giving up ground.

It's not easy to shake their pursuit, either. Their smell, hearing, and sight are all incredibly acute. But the problem is, we can't coordinate a proper attack on $map:02020036$ without the data those scouts are gathering.

Please, do this one for the Green Hoods! Help our attack on <font color="#ffd200">$map:02020036$</font> succeed by taking out those <font color="#ffd200">$npcNamePlural:25022004$</font> and letting our scouts do what they do best!
Help our attack on <font color="#ffd200">$map:02020036$</font> succeed by taking out those <font color="#ffd200">$npcNamePlural:25022004$</font> and letting our scouts do what they do best!
Take a look! We've got brand new, up-to-date topographical data on $map:02020036$! We'll be able to use this to find the most defensible routes to advance on the enemy!
$npcName:11004395[gender:1]$'s adjutant, $npcName:11004396[gender:0]$, sent a request for support. Are you available?
Of course.
The monsters in $map:02020029$ and $map:02020030$ are closing in on Humanitas. Unfortunately, Humanitas doesn't have the manpower to hold them off for long.
Defeat $npcNamePlural:25020004$ in $map:02020029$ and $npcNamePlural:25020104$ in $map:02020030$.
Defeat $npcNamePlural:25020004$ in $map:02020029$ and $npcNamePlural:25020104$ in $map:02020030$.
$npcName:11004396[gender:0]$ reports that you were a great help. Humanitas owes you a debt.
Good job.
I'm sure you're aware that $map:02020004$ and $map:02020006$ are key strategic locations for $map:02020041$.
Our scout patrols have reported increased monster locations around both of those areas.
This is a direct threat to our supply lines. If we don't do something about those monsters, this outpost will fall.
Defeat $npcNamePlural:25020305$ in $map:02020006$ and $npcNamePlural:25020403$ in $map:02020004$.
Defeat $npcNamePlural:25020305$ in $map:02020006$ and $npcNamePlural:25020403$ in $map:02020004$.
Our patrols are already reporting that the situation has improved.
Our supply lines are safe once again. You're dismissed.
We set up $map:02020041$ in record time, but there were some critical elements that we neglected.
Our soldiers are holding the $map:02020032$, but that's all that stands between the civilians here and the Daemon Army.
We need a safe haven here on Kritias. If not, all of our operations will fall apart. That's why we must hold the line.
Defeat the monsters attacking the $map:02020032$.
Defeat the monsters attacking the $map:02020032$.
Now that we have a secure foothold, we can begin our exploration in earnest.
Good work.
Kritias is fascinating. Nowhere in Maple World can you find so much advanced technology alongside so much lush nature.
I wish to protect this uniqueness. The monsters in $map:02020014$ have other ideas.
Defeat the monsters in $map:02020014$ before they ruin the beautiful scenery there.
Defeat the monsters in $map:02020014$ before they ruin the beautiful scenery there.
Thank you. $map:02020014$ is one of the few places where our agents can relax peacefully.
In fact, I'm thinking of visiting it for myself when the fighting is over. I may ask you to be my guide when that time comes.
The further we push into Kritias, the more fierce our opposition becomes. I can't afford to lose anymore scouts to unexpected ambushes.
I'll clear a path for the scouts.
That should work. Thank you for volunteering.
Defeat $npcNamePlural:25022005$ in $map:02020036$ and $npcName:25021805$ in $map:02020008$.
Defeat $npcNamePlural:25022005$ in $map:02020036$ and $npcName:25021805$ in $map:02020008$.
Thanks to you, our scouts have managed to push into a new area.
We're lucky to have you. Take a rest before your next mission.
Our scouts' radios are being jammed by $npcNamePlural:25020102$.

Normally, I'd be perfectly happy to use telepathy to communicate over the vast distances required, but our scouts lack the sensitivity that you and I share. Unfortunately they don't, so we must ensure that their wretched radios are in working order.
Go to $map:02020030$ and dispose of the meddlesome machines.
Go to $map:02020030$ and dispose of the $npcNamePlural:25020102$.
I was just contacted by a scout via radio, so it seems your efforts were not in vain.
Thanks to you, I have many, many radio conversations in my future... Sigh.
$map:02020004$ is practically next door to $map:02020041$. It is also overrun with Tairen's mechanical abominations.
This means that Tairen is always in striking distance of us.
Go to $map:02020004$ and defeat $npcNamePlural:25020405[gender:0]$.
Are you not yet done? Go to $map:02020004$ and defeat $npcNamePlural:25020405[gender:0]$.
I expected nothing less than complete success.
On behalf of the Lumiknights, you have my thanks.
Ecological research in $map:02020034$ and $map:02020013$ has come to a stop.
I'm assured that this research is of vital importance, but it's impossible to progress when our scientists are under constant threat of monster attack.
In order to get things under way once again, defeat $npcNamePlural:25020804$ in $map:02020034$ and $npcNamePlural:25020904$ in $map:02020013$.
In order to get things under way once again, defeat $npcNamePlural:25020804$ in $map:02020034$ and $npcNamePlural:25020904$ in $map:02020013$.
Research is progressing apace thanks to you.
As your reward, I shall grant onto you a fraction of my aura.
Have you read the signs, too, $MyPCName$?
The signs... that all of our soldiers look busy?
It's because we are preparing to call our wrath upon the Tairen wretches in $map:02020017$ and $map:02020033$.
I would have you participate in this raid. Go to those places and defeat $npcNamePlural:25021205$ and $npcNamePlural:25021305[gender:0]$.
The time for words is past. I will leave this mission to you.
Defeat $npcNamePlural:25021205$ and $npcNamePlural:25021305[gender:0]$.
You may have turned the tide of the battle.
Truly, the goddess has sent you to our side.
I have waited for you through the minutes and the hours.
The monsters of $map:02020035$ and $map:02020037$ are attacking our agents.
The $npcNamePlural:25021904$ and $npcNamePlural:25022104$ present a particularly troubling threat. I would have you vanquish them first.
I will continue to wait for you here.
The $npcNamePlural:25021904$ and $npcNamePlural:25022104$ present a particularly troubling threat. I would have you vanquish them first.
Did the monsters seem strange to you?
Not particularly.
I see. I shall have my templars look into this more thoroughly. Thank you.
Guess what? I've got a mission for you!
It's hard enough getting enough aetherine for our research, and the $npcNamePlural:25020102$ near $map:02020030$ have only made our job harder.
These $npcNamePlural:25020102$ gather aetherine crystals and use them like batteries to keep their bodies going.
The more of them show up, the less aetherine there is for us. Help us by driving the $npcNamePlural:25020102$ from $map:02020030$!
Help us by driving the $npcNamePlural:25020102$ from $map:02020030$!
Thanks so much! Our aetherine source is secure... for now.
I've been looking all over for you!
The Green Hoods are researching the correlation between aetherine and mana levels. Unfortunately, the heaps and heaps of monsters out there keep getting in our way.
The monsters in $map:02020001$ and $map:02020004$ are especially terrible!
Can you help us out by defeating the $npcNamePlural:25020505$ in $map:02020001$ and $npcNamePlural:25020402$ in $map:02020004$?
Can you help us out by defeating the $npcNamePlural:25020505$ in $map:02020001$ and $npcNamePlural:25020402$ in $map:02020004$?
Thank you so much! We all owe you a big one!
I have news! Our scouts discovered a ruin in $map:02020016$.
I've got a team ready to excavate the place. Ancient ruins on an unknown world... It's like an adventure novel!
But it's not easy sailing. Enemies are coming from all over the place to keep us out of $map:02020016$.
I can't send my people into that. But I can't just give up on the research, either!
So... Help us? Pretty please? With a cherry on top?
How can I say no to that?
Thanks! I owe you soooo much!
Please drive the monsters away from $map:02020016$. I'll get my team ready to move out as soon as it's safe.
Please drive the monsters away from $map:02020016$. I'll get my team ready to move out as soon as it's safe.
Good job, $MyPCName$! We can finally start laying out the groundwork for a research camp out there.
Have I got an important mission for you!
$map:02020017$ is a high priority research site, since it contains an archive of writings on ancient Kritias.
The problem is, my scouts tell me that monsters and enemy soldiers are working together by stealing or destroying those writings.
Oh, and they're hurting my field agents, too. But think of all the writings we're losing!
We can't keep on like this. Please move out to $map:02020017$ and send those monsters packing!
Please move out to $map:02020017$ and send those monsters packing!
They should think twice before they mess with Sky Fortress again, thanks to you.
Great job!
One of my research teams are testing out how aetherine crystals react to mana from Maple World.
The strange thing is that they react with each other at all! Could these two types of energy be related somehow?
I want to know more, but monsters keep getting in our way!
This research is too important to give up now. Besides, our comrades need our help!
I'm always up for helping comrades.
I knew I could count on you, Comrade! Heheh.
So, where to?
Please defeat $npcNamePlural:25021605$ in $map:02020009$ and $npcNamePlural:25021704$ in $map:02020018$.
Please defeat $npcNamePlural:25021605$ in $map:02020009$ and $npcNamePlural:25021704$ in $map:02020018$.
That was amazing! I knew I could count on you.
$MyPCName$, we've got a UFO problem!
Wait, what?
We've detected an unidentified flying object blipping in and out of radar range. I want to analyze it to figure out what it is, and whether it's a threat to Sky Fortress. That's where you come in!
It's not aliens, is it? I'm not sure how I feel about aliens...

I said "unidentified," didn't I? Our sensors aren't currently able to identify what it is or where it's from. According to our radar logs, the object has approached the ship several times, each time coming a little closer. It's almost like its getting faster.
We won't know any more until we can get a better look at it.
Okay. Well, I'm up for the job, but it's not like I can fly or anything.
No worries there! At this rate, the object will catch up with us on its next approach! All you need to do is stand out on the deck and deal with whatever it is... Just wait for my signal!
All's quite in the skies. I'll contact you by radio when we have radar contact with the object.
Good work defending the ship! I've never seen a machine like that before... Were you able to salvage anything from it?
This doohickey looked important. <font color="#909090">(You hand over what's left of the mech's flight recorder.)</font>
Excellent work! I'll take it from here.
What now, do we bring that to the captain?
What are talking about? First I have to analyze it to see what it's recorded on it, and write up a report! I'm not going to bother the captain before we know what we've got.
Fair enough.
Hm, it looks like the data is mostly unsalvageable...
Wait, this file from the machine's radio logs is intact! I'm going to play it.
Hmph. Looks like I still have improvements to make to the primary rockets before we can reach the ship. CHKY, return to base.
W-what was that?
Don't look at me.
This could be bad... I've got to warn the captain immediately!
But what about your report?
This is an emergency! Out of the way!
Are you prepared for another sparring session with me?
Let's see how much you've improved since our last match.
Meet me on the top deck when you're ready.
Meet me on the top deck when you're ready.
An excellent match. You've improved.
The more you better yourself, the better the Alliance becomes. I look forward to our next match.
You. Me. A cage in a secret underground bunker. What do you say?
I can't wait to give you some of my... undivided attention.
I can't wait to give you some of my... undivided attention.
Not bad, hot stuff. I can tell you're improving.
But don't expect me to make things so easy for you next time.
I hear a whispering in my soul. It can only mean one thing...
Today is the day the oracle will speak.
Today is the day the oracle will speak.
The oracle remains silent.
So be it.
We will try again in our next battle.
You grow stronger nonetheless, $MyPCName$.
I have not given up hope...
...that you may be the one to punish the gods!
My upgrades are ready! This round of testing won't be like last time!
Shall we jump right in?
Shall we jump right in?
...All this data... So many anomalies... Thousands of errors...
Why is it giving me different results each time?!
You must be improving as well, $MyPCName$... I think my simulator is picking up on it...
I need more data! I'm going to work on a patch. Help me test it out later!
Back for more, huh?
Good! Let's rumble, cadet!
Good! Let's rumble, cadet!
Get a load of you! You're improving, day by day!
Finally, a worthy opponent!
What a workout! Why don't we sweat it out at the sauna? Just don't mention it to the captain!
You can visit the sauna all you wish... when you aren't on duty.
You know I'd never slack off at work, Captain! I was joking!
Hahaha, sure you were!
This isn't good. $npcName:23001006$ is on a rampage in the $map:02020051$.
We have to do something about $npcName:23001006$ before our agents get hurt.

Stop that monstrosity before it does even more damage! <font color=#909090>(Once you accept this mission, you cannot begin any other weekly [Special] Gigantica missions until the weekly reset.)</font>
Defeat $npcName:23001006$ in $map:02020051$.
Have you confirmed the destruction of $npcName:23001006$?
I think it got away.
That's unfortunate, but there was nothing you could do. We'll destroy it once and for all next time.
Ah, you're here.
The medics seem really busy today.
Ah, that. Our warriors in $map:02020051$ have had another encounter with $npcName:23001006$. Their injuries have been... numerous.
Our medical facilities are stretched beyond capacity. This is not a tenable situation, to be sure.
I'll see what I can do about it.

Defeating that mechanical abomination would be a good start. <font color="#909090">(Once you accept this mission, you cannot begin any other weekly [Special] Gigantica missions until the weekly reset.)</font>
Vanquish $npcName:23001006$ in $map:02020051$.
I have already heard praise for your valiant performance.
$npcName:23001006$ was no minor foe, but you dispatched it with efficiency.
I will call upon you again soon.
We're in trouble! My people in the $map:02020051$ are getting attacked by $npcName:23001006$!
How are we supposed to come up with a counter strategy against such a weird enemy? I just don't have enough data!

I beg you, $MyPCName$! Please fight it and collect as much data as you can! <font color="#909090">(Once you accept this mission, you cannot begin any other weekly [Special] Gigantica missions until the weekly reset.)</font>
Please collect data on $npcName:23001006$.
Wow, this is a huge amount of data. Thank you so much!
I'll put my top data analyst on it straight away!
There's no question: $npcName:11001813[gender:0]$ is behind much of the turmoil in Kritias. As long as he keeps us in the dark about his plot, he has us at a disadvantage.
We need to get to the bottom of his plans.

Track him. Find out what $npcName:11001813[gender:0]$ and his Daemon Army are scheming. <font color="#909090">(Once you accept this mission, you cannot begin any other weekly [Special] First Legion missions until the weekly reset.)</font>
Find out what $npcName:11001813[gender:0]$ and his Daemon Army are scheming.
Did you uncover the Daemon Army's plot?
I don't know the details, but I did what I could to stop them.
It's a start. Whatever they're planning, we must make sure we're ready for them.
Good job.
I sense $npcName:11001813[gender:0]$'s corruption in this land. It is particularly heavy in Kidel.
I sense that he will send his forces against us soon...

Meet his Daemon Army in battle and uncover $npcName:11001813[gender:0]$'s plot! <font color="#909090">(Once you accept this mission, you cannot begin any other weekly [Special] First Legion missions until the weekly reset.)</font>
Uncover what $npcName:11001813[gender:0]$ intends to do with his Daemon Army.
That Daemon Army was no joke. I think $npcName:11001813[gender:0]$ is trying to take Kritias by force.
We stopped them this time, but this isn't over.
Well done.
I shall rally the Lumiknights to action. We will counter the wraith's plot.
An urgent report just came in.
These Daemon Army guys keep attacking my teams in Kidel. Wherever they go, they leave our researchers scattered and their camps ruined.
The Daemon Army could endanger our very foothold in this place!
What we need is a battle strategy. Unfortunately, we know next to nothing about these guys.

I beg you, $MyPCName$. Fight them and collect intelligence on how they fight. <font color="#909090">(Once you accept this mission, you cannot begin any other weekly [Special] First Legion missions until the weekly reset.)</font>
Please collect data by fighting the Daemon Army.
Thanks! I'll get on this data right away.
The Daemon Army is on the move.
I'm worried they're preparing to make a bid for all of Kritias.
Whatever they're planning, we must stop them. Intercept them before they gain too much ground.
Be careful. This won't be an easy battle. <font color="#909090">(Once you accept this mission, you cannot begin any other weekly [Special] Second Legion missions until the weekly reset.)</font>
You haven't left yet? Attack before the Daemon Army can gain any ground!
That was a tough battle. Where is $npcName:11001813[gender:0]$ getting his troops from?
Well, that's not important. The important thing is that we continue to beat them.
$npcName:11001813[gender:0]$'s Daemon Army has resumed their grim march forward.
Wherever they tread, darkness follows...
This cannot be allowed.
Do what you can to weaken the Daemon Army. <font color="#909090">(Once you accept this mission, you cannot begin any other weekly [Special] Second Legion missions until the weekly reset.)</font>
We've little time to waste. The Daemon Army must be weakened.
I stopped them this time, but this isn't over. Not yet.
An astute observation, $MyPCName$. I shall take it under consideration.
Ugh! All of these reports are the same... A specter wearing a ragged cape shows up, says something ominous, and vanishes...
After all this time, we still know almost nothing about $npcName:11001813[gender:0]$. How?!
Well, I intend to change that. $npcName:11001813[gender:0]$ and his forces have been spotted in Kidel.
$npcName:11001813[gender:0]$ is a Category 1 threat. We can't leave ourselves in the dark when it comes to him, right?
So, if we can't get any information by tracking him...
...I say we go through his minions!

Fight the Daemon Army and learn everything we can. Surely one of them can shed some light on $npcName:11001813[gender:0]$! <font color="#909090">(If you accept the quest, you cannot being any other weekly legion battle quests until the weekly reset.)</font>
Fight the Daemon Army and learn everything we can. Surely one of them can shed some light on $npcName:11001813[gender:0]$!
Oh no... None of this data sheds any light on $npcName:11001813[gender:0]$ at all!
Oh well. We've just got to keep trying!
Scouts in the field report that $npcName:11004430[gender:0]$ continues to turn monsters to his side.
I don't know how he's doing it, but that's not important right now.
What is important, then?
We must destroy his minions, as well as any monsters we think might fall for under his thrall.
Your mission, should you choose to accept it, is to defeat $npcNamePlural:25020001$ in $map:02020029$, $npcNamePlural:25020205$ in $map:02020031$, and $npcNamePlural:25020106$ in $map:02020030$.
Defeat $npcNamePlural:25020001$ in $map:02020029$, $npcNamePlural:25020205$ in $map:02020031$, and $npcNamePlural:25020106$ in $map:02020030$.
Have you eliminated your targets?
I beat every last one.
That's good. They will return... but we will be ready.
The enemy forces seem to have no end. It's only a matter of time before Sky Fortress is overwhelmed.
If we are going to salvage this operation, then we all need to help out.
You can count on me.
I expected no less. Eliminate $npcNamePlural:25020002$ in $map:02020029$ and $npcNamePlural:25020206$ in $map:02020031$.
Eliminate $npcNamePlural:25020002$ in $map:02020029$ and $npcNamePlural:25020206$ in $map:02020031$.
My scouts have already reported your progress. You deserve a commendation.
Take a rest for now. I'll have more missions for you soon.
We received an call for help from Humanitas. They're outnumbered and outgunned by the enemy.
I don't have any regular forces to send to them. I'll need to call on a specialist...
I'll be your specialist.
That would be best. You've worked with them before, after all.
Help Humanitas by defeating $npcNamePlural:25020306$ in $map:02020006$, $npcNamePlural:25020406$ in $map:02020004$, and $npcNamePlural:25020506$ in $map:02020001$.
Help Humanitas by defeating $npcNamePlural:25020306$ in $map:02020006$, $npcNamePlural:25020406$ in $map:02020004$, and $npcNamePlural:25020506$ in $map:02020001$.
Humanitas sent us thanks for your work.
Our alliance survived today thanks to you. Well done.
A call for help came from Humanitas. They're struggling to hold off the monsters in $map:02020004$ and $map:02020001$.
We can't sit by and watch our ally suffer. Will you go to their aid?
Of course.
I knew you would say that. Defeat $npcNamePlural:25020403$ in $map:02020004$ and $npcNamePlural:25020507$ in $map:02020001$.
Defeat $npcNamePlural:25020403$ in $map:02020004$ and $npcNamePlural:25020507$ in $map:02020001$.
Humanitas sent their thanks for your help.
They've asked for you by name in any future missions.
$MyPCName$, I have a bit of a personal request.
That is... You see...
You can say anything to me, Captain.
The swordsmanship used here in Kritias is strange to me. I'd like to learn about their fighting style for myself.
That's why I'd like you to fight them for me. Through you, I can learn their techniques.
I'll take care of it.
I wish to know about $npcNamePlural:25020602$ in $map:02020010$, $npcNamePlural:25020802$ in $map:02020034$, and $npcNamePlural:25021004$ in $map:02020016$.
I wish to know about $npcNamePlural:25020602$ in $map:02020010$, $npcNamePlural:25020802$ in $map:02020034$, and $npcNamePlural:25021004$ in $map:02020016$.
What did you learn?
<font color="#909090">(You attempt to demonstrate the sword techniques you encountered.)</font>
...This will take some time. Thank you anyway.
While I have no issue facing a gunman with my swords, many of our crewmen are not warriors. We must learn the enemy's gun tactics so that we can teach our crew how to avoid their attacks.
I don't trust anyone but you with this task. Will you study the enemy's gun technique?
Okay! Leave it to me.
Battle $npcNamePlural:25020604$ in $map:02020010$ and $npcNamePlural:25021005$ in $map:02020016$.
Battle $npcNamePlural:25020604$ in $map:02020010$ and $npcNamePlural:25021005$ in $map:02020016$.
Good work, $MyPCName$. I'll send your data on to our field operatives.
Of course, we'll need more data in the future. I'll speak with you then.
This is unacceptable. I will court-martial whatever officer was responsible for this!
Something wrong?
Yes! $map:02020051$, $map:02020017$, and $map:02020003$ are some of the most hotly-contested zones in Kritias.
They form fronts on the civil war between this land's factions. Only our veteran agents are cleared for duty there.
And yet, somehow, our latest batch of recruits were shipped out there instead. They aren't ready for that level of action.

I need you to get there and defeat $npcNamePlural:25021106$ in $map:02020051$, $npcNamePlural:25021202$ in $map:02020017$, and $npcNamePlural:25021502$ in $map:02020003$. If you don't, our recruits won't be coming home.

I need you to get there and defeat $npcNamePlural:25021106$ in $map:02020051$, $npcNamePlural:25021202$ in $map:02020017$, and $npcNamePlural:25021502$ in $map:02020003$. If you don't, our recruits won't be coming home.
My soldiers are safely in their barracks, thanks to you. And I've taken steps to ensure that this does not happen again.
Unfortunately, I haven't been able to determine who sent the order to the wrong squad. If this happens again... I know who to turn to.
I've received an alarming report from the field.
New enemies in heavy armor have appeared. They've openly attacked our forces and are delaying our operations. Are you ready to strike back against them?
Sure!
Take care of $npcNamePlural:25021205$ in $map:02020017$ and $npcNamePlural:25021406$ in $map:02020014$.
Be careful, $MyPCName$.
Take care of $npcNamePlural:25021205$ in $map:02020017$ and $npcNamePlural:25021406$ in $map:02020014$.
You returned safely. Are you hurt?
I'm fine, but you should see the other guys!
Thanks to your quick work, our agents were able to continue their work. Well done.
$map:02020018$, $map:02020037$, and $map:02020035$ are major choke points on the main routes through Kritias.
It seems that Tairen is well aware of this fact. They've fortified their positions there.
An outright battle is inevitable. I want you to make the first strike.
Will do!
Very good. Take care of $npcNamePlural:25021703$ in $map:02020018$, $npcNamePlural:25022105$ in $map:02020037$, and $npcNamePlural:25021905$ in $map:02020035$.
Take care of $npcNamePlural:25021703$ in $map:02020018$, $npcNamePlural:25022105$ in $map:02020037$, and $npcNamePlural:25021905$ in $map:02020035$.
You've created enough of an opening for our scouts to get through.
It's only a matter of time before we strike out for the furthest reaches of Kritias.
My cartography team tells me that $map:02020018$ and $map:02020037$ are the gateway to the furthest reaches of Kritias.
Of course, our enemies have fortified their positions there.
Open the way for us by defeating $npcNamePlural:25021702$ in $map:02020018$ and $npcNamePlural:25022102$ in $map:02020037$.
Open the way for us by defeating $npcNamePlural:25021702$ in $map:02020018$ and $npcNamePlural:25022102$ in $map:02020037$.
My people tell me that the threats in those areas are gone. They will return someday, but we will defeat them again.
I'm counting on your help in extending our reach in Kritias.
$npcName:11004315[gender:1]$ tells me that she needs to study pacified monsters in order to understand them.
Let's begin with a $item:61000154$ in $map:02020031$.
I'm on it.
Capture a $item:61000154$ in $map:02020031$.
Capture a $item:61000154$ in $map:02020031$.
This is it?
Yes. This is the $item:61000154$.
...I see.
Something wrong?
No, no, it's fine. I'll pass this on to the researchers.
Our research into the creatures of Kritias continues.
My tactical officer has a working hypothesis, but she needs more samples for analysis.
Capture a $item:61000155$ in $map:02020006$.
Capture a $item:61000155$ in $map:02020006$.
It does look strange. Perhaps this will prove the researchers' theory.
Thank you. We'll see to this creature's return to the wild when we're done.
My scouts report a monster in $map:02020001$ that almost looks like it could be from Maple World.
This could be an important discovery. I trust you'll go there for yourself?
Of course.
Go to $map:02020001$ and capture a $item:61000159$.
Go to $map:02020001$ and capture a $item:61000159$.
Where is the $item:61000159$?
This is it.
It doesn't walk on all fours?
Hm?
Never mind. It seems my scout was mistaken.
My researchers will make sure the creature gets home when we're done with it. Take a rest until your next mission.
My research team needs another sample. A $item:61000161$, this time.
They won't tell me why they need this creature, but I think it won't be hard for you to find one.
It'll be a piece of cake.
Good. Capture a $item:61000161$ in $map:02020034$.
Capture a $item:61000161$ in $map:02020034$.
My research team won't be quiet about the creature. Do you have it?
I sure do.
I can hear them cheering from here. I'll tell you what results they achieve... just as soon as they tell me what it is they're doing.
We've been here for some time. You must have encountered the leshies by now.
Unlike the other monsters of Kritias, they don't have any aetherine in their bodies. Instead, they wear aetherine around their neck and draw power from that.
I wonder... could my soldiers learn to use $itemPlural:30001303$?
Take $itemPlural:30001303$ from $npcNamePlural:25020901$ and $npcNamePlural:25020902$ in $map:02020013$.
Take $itemPlural:30001303$ from $npcNamePlural:25020901$ and $npcName:25020902$ in $map:02020013$.
Do you have the $itemPlural:30001303$?
Here they are.
Good work. Hopefully our researchers can find a way to use these without hurting themselves too much.
The research team asked me to send you their thanks. They've made a lot of progress because of you.
Aw, shucks. It was nothing.
Of course, their thanks came with a request for more help. They need $itemPlural:61000164$.
I can count on you, can't I? You can capture $itemPlural:61000164$ in $map:02020051$.
You can capture a $item:61000164$ in $map:02020051$.
Is that it? It certainly is... unique.
I'll send them to the researchers. Thank you, $MyPCName$.
I'll keep this brief. Our research team needs another test subject.
They've requested a $item:61000165$ from $map:02020033$. In spite of its name, it's apparently less aggressive than the other monsters of Kritias. They want to know why.
I'm on it!
Very good. Capture a $item:61000165$ in $map:02020033$.
Capture a $item:61000165$ in $map:02020033$.
That was quick. The researchers should be happy.
I will send the $item:61000165$ to the team. If they need anything more, I will let you know.
You know what the research team needs, don't you?
They need me to capture a monster.
I don't know.
Correct. They tell me that they're nearing the end of their research.
What monster do they need this time?
They need monsters. Tamed monsters that they can experiment on.
Which monster do they need?
They need a $item:61000170$ from $map:02020033$.
Capture a $item:61000170$ from $map:02020033$.
Is that the $item:61000170$?
Yep.
...Are there no monsters that walk on all fours?
There's one like this that walks on all fours.
Insect...!
Is it cute?
I do not believe the captain likes that monster.
Pitiable creature. I shall take it with me.
Let's send the $item:61000170$ to the research team, first.
I'll take a look at that insect... that monster later. Good job.
My research team tells me that they've learned a great deal about the monsters of Kritias. However...
However?
We apparently still know very little about $itemPlural:61000166$. If you capture one from $map:02020018$, the research team would be ecstatic.
It'll be a piece of cake.
I expected nothing less.
If you capture one from $map:02020018$, the research team would be ecstatic.
The research team has been eagerly—and persistently—awaiting your return.
I'll send this creature on to them. When we're done, we'll release it back into the wild.
My researchers have been asking when you'd return.
What do they want me to catch this time?
The team wants to analyze a $item:61000169$ from $map:02020037$.
I'll be right back.
I'll be waiting.
The research team wants to analyze a $item:61000169$ from $map:02020037$.
That was quick. Was it difficult?
Not at all.
So you say. Take a moment to rest before you go on your next mission.
My research team is on edge. Every time I check on the lab, it's a tangle of shouting scientists and spilled beakers.
Let me explain the rest, Captain. I could use a little face time with $MyPCName$. You see, one of the researchers was burning the midnight oil and accidentally let a test subject go.
I've already found the culprit, but the team is short a specimen. While I get to work... disciplining the naughty researcher, I want you to catch a replacement monster for them.
They just need one measly $item:61000163$. You can find them in $map:02020009$.
You need to capture a $item:61000163$ in $map:02020009$.
It appears you've captured the monster.
My intelligence officer assures me that this won't be a problem again. Thank you both.
Our monster research continues. The monster for today is a $item:61000168$ from $map:02020008$.
The researchers are especially interested in this specimen, since it's surprisingly gentle for its size.
Capture a $item:61000168$ in $map:02020008$.
Did you capture a $item:61000168$?
By the skin of my teeth, I did.
Are you sure this is it?
Did I catch the wrong monster...?
This isn't the monster the researchers described...
Is that... disappointing?
No, no. You did fine.
I'll pass this along to the researchers...
You've been to $map:02020029$, haven't you? Our scouts believe that monsters are drawing aetherine from there.
They discovered a strange pit in the area. Unfortunately, they couldn't get close enough to investigate further.
The monsters shouldn't pose much of a problem for you. I'd like you to look into it.
I want to know what's in that pit.
Report what you discovered.
There's a cave filled with aetherine ore there.
Indeed? I'll send a party out there right away.
Well done.
The $npcName:25020302$ population in $map:02020006$ is on the rise. We can't afford to keep fighting them with conventional tactics.
So what's the plan?
You're going to enter their habitat and do something about it.
You're going to destroy their eggs.
We have no choice in this. Our scouts are in danger. Enter the $npcName:25020302$ habitat in $map:02020006$ and get rid of the eggs.
Enter the $npcName:25020302$ habitat in $map:02020006$ and get rid of the eggs.
It was no doubt a difficult mission. Good work.
Anything for my fellow crew.
Yes. The safety of the crew is important.
We've received an emergency communique from Humanitas in $map:02020033$.
They need help from our engineer corps, but I don't have the men to spare. That means that you're going in their place.
It's they're blasted cannons! The dang things aren't firing. Why don't you head out there and fix 'em up?\
It's be a piece of cake for my cadet. BAHAHAHA!
Yeah... Piece of cake...
There's no time to waste. Go to $map:02020033$ and do what you can for their cannons.
There's no time to waste. Go to $map:02020033$ and do what you can for their cannons.
Humanitas had a lot of great things to say about your work at $map:02020033$.
My trust was well placed, as always.
I feel... ill at ease.
What is it?
It's this place. Kritias. A dire aura runs deep through it.
The darkness is especially thick in $map:02020029$, $map:02020030$, and $map:02020031$. We must hasten to action.
Restore order by slaying $npcNamePlural:25020005$ in $map:02020029$, $npcNamePlural:25020104$ in $map:02020030$, and $npcNamePlural:25020202$ in $map:02020031$.
Restore order by slaying $npcNamePlural:25020005$ in $map:02020029$, $npcNamePlural:25020104$ in $map:02020030$, and $npcNamePlural:25020202$ in $map:02020031$.
I feel as though a weight has lifted. Sky Fortress is warded against evil for another day.
Of course, this peace won't last long. When the time comes, I shall call upon you again.
It is good to see you again, my loyal subject.
What is it?
I took counsel with the oracle yesterday. We must defeat the forces of darkness to avert a great disaster in Kritias.
That sounds really, um, serious.
Verily! Away, to defeat $npcNamePlural:25020105$ in $map:02020030$ and $npcNamePlural:25020004$ in $map:02020029$... before it's too late!
Defeat $npcNamePlural:25020105$ in $map:02020030$ and $npcNamePlural:25020004$ in $map:02020029$... before it's too late!
Thanks to your swift action, we may yet live to see another day.
I shall contact you when next the oracle speaks to me.
Should I despise them? No! It is my pity that they deserve!
Cool! Also, what?
Do not wave your ignorance brazenly in my face. I speak, of course, of the monsters whose souls have been twisted by corruption. Can you not hear them cry out in pain?
We cannot allow this to go on. Lay to rest the $npcNamePlural:25020306$ in $map:02020006$, $npcNamePlural:25020402$ in $map:02020004$, and $npcNamePlural:25020503$ in $map:02020001$!
Lay to rest the $npcNamePlural:25020306$ in $map:02020006$, $npcNamePlural:25020402$ in $map:02020004$, and $npcNamePlural:25020503$ in $map:02020001$!
The cries of the darned have ceased. A tragedy, and yet a relief!
I pray that they rest in peace.
You've arrived at just the right time. It seems our psychic connection has been firmly reestablished!
My many agents have reported of strange creatures in $map:02020006$. And their descriptions are...
Interesting.
I don't like where you're going with this.
I must know more. Travel to $map:02020006$ and carefully observe $npcNamePlural:25020307$ and $npcNamePlural:25020305$.
Travel to $map:02020006$ and carefully observe $npcNamePlural:25020307$ and $npcNamePlural:25020305$.
What mysteries have you uncovered?
They were monsters, all right.
Hm. Your observation is as useless as it is blind to the greater mysteries of the other world.
I'll be more specific next time I ask for your help.
It's wrong. The strategy is all wrong.
What are you going on about?
Do you not see? We will never win if we devote all of our efforts to fighting wave after wave of underlings!
I believe, however, that if we target the leaders, we have a chance. I'd do it myself, but it would be too great of a risk to unleash my power on the battlefield.

But you... Yes, you can be my implement of precisely-honed violence! Defeat $npcNamePlural:25020606$ in $map:02020010$, $npcNamePlural:25020806$ in $map:02020034$, and $npcNamePlural:25021006$ in $map:02020016$.
You can be my implement of precisely-honed violence! Defeat $npcNamePlural:25020606$ in $map:02020010$, $npcNamePlural:25020806$ in $map:02020034$, and $npcNamePlural:25021006$ in $map:02020016$.
So? Have we begun to make real progress?
Well, I accomplished something out there.
That you did, my friend. That you did.
We must discuss many dire things today, $MyPCName$. I hope you are prepared.
Prepared enough, I guess.
I have eyes on the forces of Kharon, and I have witnessed attempts to liaise with the Daemon Army. They are exchanging information.
<font size='45'>?!</font>
We cannot have that, can we? Let us punish them. Defeat $npcNamePlural:25020603$ and $npcNamePlural:25020703$.
They are in $map:02020032$ and $map:02020010$.
Defeat the $npcNamePlural:25020603$ and $npcNamePlural:25020703$.
Did you complete the mission?
I took care of it.
It is fortunate, then, that we nipped this alliance in the bud.
The researchers of Sky Fortress have drawn a connection between an unhealthy blue glow and aetherine in the body.
It's a curious idea. Don't you want to learn more for yourself?
I sure do.
As you should be! Let's begin by performing field autopsies on $npcNamePlural:25021101$ in $map:02020051$, $npcNamePlural:25021204$ in $map:02020017$, and $npcNamePlural:25021501$ in $map:02020003$.
You know how to perform a field autopsy, do you not? Strike your subject with vigor and see if aetherine comes out.
Perform field autopsies on $npcNamePlural:25021101$ in $map:02020051$, $npcNamePlural:25021204$ in $map:02020017$, and $npcNamePlural:25021501$ in $map:02020003$.
Tell me your results!
Inconclusive!
Were the researcher mistaken? We'll have to perform more autopsies...
Guns... Is there any weapon so inelegant, so detached from the true potency of the soul, as a gun?
Nonetheless, I must know every facet of the enemies we face. We must conduct research into the gun-wielders of this land.
Let's begin with $npcNamePlural:25021103$ in $map:02020051$ and $npcNamePlural:25021407$ in $map:02020014$.
Why do you linger? Your task awaits!
Defeat $npcNamePlural:25021103$ in $map:02020051$ and $npcNamePlural:25021407$ in $map:02020014$.
Those soulless gunslingers were beneath you, I assume. You can defeat them with your eyes closed, can you not?
Sure, but maybe I'll keep my eyes open, anyway.
Your lack of conviction is disturbing. We'll have to work on that, won't we?
My informants tell me that Kharon and the Daemon Army persist in their foolish alliance.
We must be more active in discouraging them.
Cut the lines between them by defeating $npcNamePlural:25021904$ in $map:02020035$, $npcNamePlural:25022005$ in $map:02020036$, and $npcNamePlural:25021602$ in $map:02020009$.
Cut the lines between them by defeating $npcNamePlural:25021904$ in $map:02020035$, $npcNamePlural:25022005$ in $map:02020036$, and $npcNamePlural:25021602$ in $map:02020009$.
Was the operation a success?
This should put their alliance on hold.
Well done. I knew I could count on you.
I've had some time to contemplate the challenges that face us in this strange land, and I've reached a conclusion.
And what is that?
Our greatest hope for surviving this place is the quick and complete destruction of the Daemon Army.
Take a step towards this goal by vanquishing $npcNamePlural:25021903$ in $map:02020035$ and $npcNamePlural:25022001$ in $map:02020036$.
Take a step towards this goal by vanquishing $npcNamePlural:25021903$ in $map:02020035$ and $npcNamePlural:25022001$ in $map:02020036$.
I can sense the Daemon Army's power waning from here.
With your skills and my insight, peace will come soon.
The Lumiknights take a keen interest in the culture and wildlife of Kritias. By studying how our worlds are different, we can learn more about Maple World.
The robotic insects, in particular, stand out to me. It seems they're only to be found in $map:02020029$.
Go to $map:02020029$ and find out who made these mechanical insects, whether they're truly alive, and what their purpose is.
Do you want me to bring them back?
No. I'll leave the actual seeing and touching to you.
Go to $map:02020029$ and find out who made these mechanical insects, whether they're truly alive, and what their purpose is.
What have you learned?
I don't know who made them, but they're kind of cute.
That's hardly helpful. Thanks anyway, I suppose.
But why would they all gather in such a place?
What are you talking about?
$map:02020030$. $npcNamePlural:25020104$ are swarming there, and I don't know why.
Could it be the dark crystals that are in that place?
I must know more. Go to $map:02020030$ and gather the crystals there.
Go to $map:02020030$ and gather the crystal fragments there.
I feel a dark aura coming from you. You must be carrying the crystals.
Perhaps these will reveal to me the weakness of the Daemon Army...
Humanitas is embroiled in a longstanding battle that I'd rather not get involved in, no matter what you or the captain say.
However, what's done is done, and it would be dishonorable to turn our backs on them now.
What are you talking about?
The transmission tower in $map:02020030$ is under attack by monsters. It seems the fence was broken by those monsters and needs to be repaired.
Please repair the fence. That should keep it safe... For a time, at least.
Please repair the fence around $map:02020030$'s transmission tower. That should keep it safe... For a time, at least.
Humanitas sent us their thanks. I'm still dubious of our alliance, but at least we've done some good here.
Thank you. I'll send for you when I have more work.
This world is full of strange ore. Perhaps too much for our research team to handle. I've noticed they're making more and more mistakes...
I would never make such mistakes, of course, but I recognize that not everyone can be me. I would like to do something to help them.
To that end, I want you to go to $map:02020031$ and examine the ore there.
I thought you were going to help them.
Absolutely not! Were I to put myself to this task, I'd complete it so quickly that all of the researchers would die of shame. We cannot have that.
Begin by examining the ore in $map:02020031$.
Excellent news! The researchers were enheartened by your help.
They didn't have the nicest things to say about the quality of the help, but it seems you've inspired them to redouble their efforts. Well done!
I didn't expect to find so much diversity in the wildlife here. There's something more to Kritias than meets the eye if such creatures can survive in such an environment.
Perhaps it's something in the water. Water is the source of life, you see.
That's pretty obvious...
While the ship's researchers are looking into various metals and creatures, I've turned my attention to analyzing the water.
I placed false plants in $map:02020001$ to gather data. Head there and see if there are any new records worth reviewing.
Head to $map:02020001$ and see if there are any new records worth reviewing.
Was there new data?
The water was shiny.
That's all...? Sigh. Thank you anyway...
Sky Fortress has been anchored in Kritias for some time. It's not meant to be at dock for so long.
Why not fly it around, then?
If we're in the sky for too long, the enemy starts deploying missiles. We have safe harbor here, but we don't exactly have free rein of the continent.
Of course, Sky Fortress must be ready to launch at a moment's notice. That means we can't slack off on regular maintenance.
$MyPCName$, please inspect Sky Fortress to make sure it's in flying condition.
Please inspect Sky Fortress to make sure it's in flying condition.
Were there any issues with Sky Fortress?
It's a little dusty, but the engines still work.
That's a relief. I'll call upon you again soon.
$MyPCName$, come here for a moment.
Hmm... Something's fishy.
This is about that, erm, that red fruit. You know. The one from Maple World...
You mean $item:30000232$?
Huh? Did someone say "$item:30000232$?!"
You're hearing things, Vanguard Captain! You're simply hearing things...
Hmph. The altitude must be messing with my hearing...
Keep your voice down, $MyPCName$. According to my research, they have $itemPlural:30000232$ in Kritias, too. It's the same as the cherries in Maple World in every way. Every way.
I need it. For my, er, my research, you see! Quickly... and discreetly... gather some $itemPlural:30000232$ for me.
Quickly... and discreetly... gather some $itemPlural:30000232$ for me.
I'd recognize that smell anywhere. I'll put this to good use!
Good research, you mean?
Isn't that what I said? Leave me to my cherries, $male:man,female:woman$.
We have no shortage of injured soldiers. That is nothing new. However, it's difficult to ship enough medical supplies from the empire.
Do not ask me how he discovered this, but one of my knights learned that a local herb called $item:30001299$ is an effective painkiller. That plant it comes from slumbers in $map:02020032$.
$item:30001299$ can only be harvested when the $npcName:25020705$ is sleeping.
Please examine the $npcName:25020705$ in $map:02020032$ and harvest some $item:30001299$.
Please examine the $npcName:25020705$ in $map:02020032$ and harvest some $item:30001299$.
Yes, this should be enough. For now, at least.
At least now I know who I can ask when we need more.
Do you recall the robot soldiers that $npcName:11004430[gender:0]$ hacked? Our researchers were inspired by him and started experimenting with the same techniques.
It took many sleepless nights, but they managed to finally capture and hack some of those robots for themselves.
<font size='45'>!</font>
The hacking isn't precise, unfortunately. The robots require constant adjustment to keep them in line.
I think it would be a good idea for you to check in with the lab and see if they have any updates.
I think it would be a good idea for you to check in with the lab and see if they have any updates.
What was the report?
It's not smooth sailing, but they're managing.
I see. I'll keep a close watch over the project.
The rafflesia of $map:02020013$ poison everything around them. It's made the $npcNamePlural:11004342[gender:0]$ there very angry.
As a templar, I can't sit by and watch these creatures suffer. They must be relieved of their anger!
Go to $map:02020013$ and pacify the angry poings.
Go to $map:02020013$ and pacify the angry poings.
Have the $npcNamePlural:11004342[gender:0]$ become peaceful?
I think so?
I shall take your word for it. Thank you, $MyPCName$.
Have you ever been to $map:02020014$? I'm told there are magnificent cherry blossom trees there.
Cherry blossoms on a backdrop of machines... I would like blossoms from such a tree. Can you retrieve some for me?
You want... flowers?
Do not make me ask again. Please.
Okay! Leave it to me.
You have my gratitude. The $itemPlural:30001300$ can be found in $map:02020014$.
The $itemPlural:30001300$ can be found in $map:02020014$.
Do you have the flowers?!
So... Who's it for?
Well...
It's for me! I needed something beautiful to go along with my radiant brilliance.
$map:02020014$ is a treasure trove of information about Kritias. It provides a microcosm of ecologies for our researchers to pour over.
Unfortunately, we've lost contact with our researchers there. I'm worried for their safety.
Go to $map:02020014$ and ensure their safety.
Go to $map:02020014$ and ensure their safety.
Were the researchers safe?
Let's just say that they're safe and busy with research.
...I see.
I suppose I shall have to get a more thorough report directly from them.
One of our scouts has found what appears to be a waspling breeding ground.
It's in the north of the $map:02020017$. We need to examine these creatures so we can learn how to better fight the wasplings.
I want you to secure the location.
I want you to secure the location.
Were you able to secure the area?
Well, it's about as secure as I can make it.
I see. Perhaps I should send a templar escort with the researchers...
Have you ever visited $map:02020018$? It's at a much higher altitude than anywhere else in Kritias.
Unlike the rest of this place, it seems almost untouched by technology. Perhaps that's why a unique plant grows only there—the Tiaman Sky Herb.
Every morning, $item:30001301$ gathers on this herb. I want you to retrieve some.
Gather $item:30001301$.
Did you bring the $item:30001301$?
<font color="#909090">(You show him the dew.)</font>
Interesting. I can sense a unique vibration from this dew... I will let you know if anything interesting comes of it.
I've received an interesting report. It seems that the plants in $map:02020037$ have an unusually high aetherine content.
I need not tell you that aetherine is an extremely valuable power source. I wonder if there's some way we could extract a useful amount from these plants.
As you might imagine, I intend to assign this task to you.
Go to $map:02020037$ and pick some flowers.
Go to $map:02020037$ and pick some flowers.
Hm. At a glance, I sense nothing remarkable about these $itemPlural:30001302$.
All the same, this warrants a closer analysis. I'll call upon you again soon.
Isn't Kritias great? So, so great. So many things to learn. Some might say too many things, but not me! No, I love pouring over pages and pages and pages and pages of data...
For instance, we need to know more about the local monsters. We can't have them eating our scouts, after all.
I'd like you to look into the monsters that live close to us. Doesn't that sound exciting?
